voice_info.appearance: You see Sister Francis.
sample_lines: Hi. I'm meditating. Did you notice? Can I help you?
Hello, brother. Can I help you?
Hello, sister. Can I help you?

npc_lines.text: Hi. I'm meditating. Did you notice? Can I help you?
Hello, brother. Can I help you?
Hello, sister. Can I help you?
Hello, brother. No, I've been meditating like a good initiate, waiting to be christened by the Servitors. I'm sure there's nothing to worry about.
Hello, sister. No I've been meditating like a good initiate, waiting to be christened by the Servitors. I'm sure there's nothing to worry about.
Is this a trick question? It's the Master, right?
Why brother, nothing so impure profanes the Cathedral. I would let the high priests know if such sins were being committed.
Why sister, nothing so impure profanes the Cathedral. I would let the high priests know if such sins were being committed.
I am armed, of course, if reason will not sway our enemies, but I do not arm myself to excess. Is there no ammo in the Gift Shoppe?
Oh no, brother, I do not require assistance. Please excuse me.
Oh no, sister, I do not require assistance. Please excuse me.
I don't know. Perhaps he will reveal himself in time.
Hello, sir. Can I help you?
Hello, miss. Can I help you?

voice_info.appearance: You see Deputy Fry.
sample_lines: Ive been hoping to run into you, child killer. I hope your stay isnt long. Ill be playing close attention to you while youre here. Keep your nose clean in my city, Im just dying for an excuse to
Hello friend, Deputy Tony Fry at your service.

Oh, a newcomer! Welcome to the Hub! You've reached the biggest city on the coast. Heck, maybe the biggest city in the world for all we know. I thought you were part of the caravan, did you come in wit

npc_lines.text: Ive been hoping to run into you, child killer. I hope your stay isnt long. Ill be playing close attention to you while youre here. Keep your nose clean in my city, Im just dying for an excuse to get rid of scum like you.
Hello friend, Deputy Tony Fry at your service.

Oh, a newcomer! Welcome to the Hub! You've reached the biggest city on the coast. Heck, maybe the biggest city in the world for all we know. I thought you were part of the caravan, did you come in with them?

Im not surprised. Most of the new members of our city come in with the caravans, even with the missing caravans weve had. Its a fine city but be careful who you associate with. People like Decker and his thugs can get you into a lot of trouble.

Thats surprising. Its been pretty rough out there, especially with the missing caravans. But youre safe now, just stay away from the Maltese Falcon. They're a bunch of trouble makers, Decker and his crew.
If you say so. So, did you have any other questions?

Its a tragedy really. Some caravans have turned up missing. Butch over at the Far Go Traders is offering a reward for information or something. You should check at the merchant market if youre interested.

He owns the Maltese Falcon in the merchant market, but I wouldnt associate with him if you want to stay out of trouble. Hes nothing but a murdering animal, but the Sheriff wont let me arrest him without proof.
No problem. Believe it or not, our city is quite safe and our police are all very highly trained peace keepers. You shouldnt have any problems, just avoid the Maltese Falcon.

Im sorry, I dont understand. Maybe you need healing? The Children of the Cathedral are south. Head straight down past the Merchant Market down to the Water Merchants. Theyre right next to the Water Merchants.
I'm still watching you, child killer.
Murdering animal!
I can't believe the Sheriff's dead . . .
There you are, you thieving little snake! I almost didnt recognize you. Guards!
Hello again. I hope you like our town. A nice young man such as yourself, is always welcome. If you should decide to stay, Im sure you would make a valuable addition to the Hub.
Hello again. I hope you like our town. A lovely lady such as yourself, is always welcome. If you should decide to stay, Im sure you would make a valuable addition to the Hub.
Hello again. What can I do for you?
Yes? I don't have all day. I'm trying to watch the front gate.
Really? I, uh, you should talk to the Sheriff. I cant leave my post right now. Ive got to . . . uh, fend off any raiders that might come. Plus, Im not very good with reports.

Oh, sorry. I hadnt noticed. The Children run the Hospital next to the Water Merchants. Go south past the Merchant market and youll see it just northwest of the Water Merchants. I hope everything goes okay.

Thats hard to miss. Its by far the busiest part of town. The Merchant Market is a few miles south of here. Youll be most interested in the northern section, thats where most of our locals buy and sell to the public.

Why that would be in the Merchant Market, a few miles south of here. Two of the caravan houses are located there, the third is further south. Id recommend the Far Go Traders. They pay well and they're not too crazy.
Dead theyre all dead . . .
Water Chip? Well, I've never heard of one. If it has to do with water, though, you should talk to the Water Merchants. Their headquarters are located further south, past the Downtown area.

voice_info.appearance: You see a large well armed man.
sample_lines: It's not often that we get visitors, how can I help you?
This place isn't very accessible with a nest of those damn Deathclaws right outside our factory.
We've gone over there and taken out a few, but they always seem to come back. Besides, we're machinists, not fighters.

npc_lines.text: It's not often that we get visitors, how can I help you?
This place isn't very accessible with a nest of those damn Deathclaws right outside our factory.
We've gone over there and taken out a few, but they always seem to come back. Besides, we're machinists, not fighters.
We manufacture weapons and ammunition.  We've been at this for the last 30 years.  But the last 10 have been hell.
We've stripped the area surrounding our factory of all the scrap metals that were left after the war.  Now we have to rely on Adytum to supply us with raw materials.

At first it was fine.  They supplied us with raw materials, we manufactured and sold the weapons.  Then 3 years ago Zimmerman hired some mercenaries to help  protect Adytum from the deathclaw and the odd random attack by raiders.  Those Regulators are cold hearted bastards and are squeezing us for all we have.  We make the guns and they get rich off of it.
We would if we could.  But moving is a major undertaking with all the lathes and mills.  These are things that aren't just picked up easily moved.  We could move but the deathclaw make it impossible.
If you could get rid of the Deathclaws once and for all you could name your price.
If you clean out that area we'll be leaving, but we'll leave behind more weapons and ammunition than you could possibly use.
You clear out the Deathclaws, all of them, and you got yourself a deal.
Hello again.

We need to be sure.  We've killed over 20 in the past 2 years and they always seem to come back.  And we could never figure out how.  Let's give it a few days and if they are still gone we'll see what we can do for ya'.
Let us know when you've taken care of the Deathclaws.
I know, tell me about it.
It's not often that we get visitors, can I help you?
This place isn't very accessible, with a nest of those damn Deathclaw right outside our factory.

We would if we could.  But moving is a major under taking with all the lathes and mills.  These are things that aren't just picked up and easily moved.  We could move but the Deathclaw make it impossible.
You got it- just take whatever you want. We're pulling out of here in a day or two, but we'll leave more weapons and ammo than you could carry right now. Just come back here whenever you need them.
Sorry I can't talk to you now, I'm very busy.
How goes it, my friend?
How goes it, my friend?
You what?!  You've killed them all? Thank the gods! Now we can move to where we can get our own materials and not have to rely on those snakes in Adytum.  You name it and you've got it, my friend.
You what?!  You've killed them all? Thank the gods! Now we can move to where we can get our own materials and not have to rely on those snakes in Adytum.  You name it and you've got it, my friend.
You got it.  Let your friends know that they got their weapons.
You got it.  Let your friends know that they got their weapons.
Thank you my friend.
Thank you my friend.
Sorry I can't talk to you, friend, but we're busy getting this place packed up to move. Help yourself to whatever you need.
Sorry I can't talk to you, friend, but we're busy getting this place packed up to move. Help yourself to whatever you need.
There's no reason to leave now that your friends have gotten rid of those damn regulators.
There's no reason to leave now that your friends have gotten rid of those damn regulators.
Welcome, friend. What can I help you with?
Welcome, friend. What can I help you with?
You need to talk to Zack about buying things.

voice_info.appearance: You see a seedy-looking Mexican man with slick hair.
sample_lines: Oye, muchacho, allow me to introduce myself. I am Hernandez, a man of mucho gusto! You look like you are new here. Please, allow me to be your informant to the casino.
But of course! This fine establishment is run by the famous Gizmo. A true visionary and a very wealthy man.
Perhaps you can spare a few caps? I guarantee success.

npc_lines.text: Oye, muchacho, allow me to introduce myself. I am Hernandez, a man of mucho gusto! You look like you are new here. Please, allow me to be your informant to the casino.
But of course! This fine establishment is run by the famous Gizmo. A true visionary and a very wealthy man.
Perhaps you can spare a few caps? I guarantee success.
Sorry, mi amigo. Hey, let me show you a neat game . . .
Thank you very much, mi amigo! In a few days I shall be able to pay you back, with interest. My system is slow, you see, it requires much patience, but it will most certainly reap great profits!
Very well, but I guarantee success! If you want to get in on the riches just waiting, come back soon, or I will find another partner!
My friend, I see you are a man of much taste, as well. Perhaps a simple game of dice?
Gizmo had a dream of setting up a place where people could meet and enjoy themselves. He had the ambition to make it happen. The result is the casino you see here.
He gives people a chance to shrug off their cares in the broken world outside. And he brings money into Junktown!
You obviously don't share Gizmo's brilliance. This place is a respite from the harshness of everyday life.

Well, Gizmo runs a pretty good house, although the games are, how shall we say, rather weighted towards the house. It's not like his dealers cheat, though. But unless you have a system, like me, you will need to be very clever.
My system is developing slowly. I have living expenses and such, you know, but it is working!
So, you think you have tumbled to me, eh? Well, you won't get anything from me!
Buenos dias, my friend! What can I do for you today?
Buenos dias, my friend! What can I do for you today?

voice_info.appearance: You see a ghoul gang member.
sample_lines: What are you doing here? Answer wisely - this could be your only chance . . .
Set ain't here, so git.
You gots some mental problems to work out. Set's not gonna let some loser like you take 'em down. He's got the guards and he's got the guns.

npc_lines.text: What are you doing here? Answer wisely - this could be your only chance . . .
Set ain't here, so git.
You gots some mental problems to work out. Set's not gonna let some loser like you take 'em down. He's got the guards and he's got the guns.
Set keeps at least two guards around him at all times, but he can call on more then ten if he needs it. And when he's in his throne room, those ten guards are seconds away.
I ain't telling ya' that. Whadda ya' think I am, stupid? Now git . . .
I'm supposed to make sure no one goes by. Dis is Zombie house.
Not a what . . . A WHO. We are the Zombies. If we do good, Set'll make us one of his guards. Now that's all I'm gonna tell you.
I said dat's all I'm gonna tell ya'. Now git.
You crazy. What do you think dis is? You better leave.
I don't think so. Get out before I call the boyz over and dance on your face.
It was. Now it's a fact. ZOMBIES!
Stay away from dis place if you value yer life.
HEY, ZOMBIES, WE GOT US A PUNCHIN' BAG!
You should git.

voice_info.appearance: You see before you, Garl, leader of the Raiders.
sample_lines: You think you can come here without challenge? This, the home of your deadliest enemies? We will see you dead. I will personally tear your heart out of your chest and eat it before my proud warriors!
I killed you!
I killed you!

npc_lines.text: You think you can come here without challenge? This, the home of your deadliest enemies? We will see you dead. I will personally tear your heart out of your chest and eat it before my proud warriors!
I killed you!
I killed you!
You would if you were my father, but you are not. You look like he did, but act different. No image of him remains to this day. You will just have to be removed.
I don't believe it! I can't believe it!
Don't tell me what I should have done, father. I rule the Khans now, and you are but worm meat.
Don't tell me what I should have done, father. I rule the Khans now, and you are but worm meat.
You should have. Now it's too late. I am Garl Death-Hand. I rule the Khans. You should be dead in your grave, and you will be again!
I can see you standing before me, but I don't believe it. What do you want?
Pledge that you shall return to the grave, and it shall be so.
So be it. Release the Shady Sands woman and escort this one out of here . . .
You don't rule here. You don't belong here. Death to the walking dead!
Never!
That's what I like. Initiative. But you should not have killed them without my orders. I don't like too much initiative.
What do you want?
Hmmm. Well, then. What do you offer for her release?
Hmmm. For some reason, I believe you. You may take the girl, but do not return unless you seek our wrath.
Ha! You should not threaten your betters.
It must be valuable indeed. Show me.
You think a man such as I believes in the afterlife? This world is dying, and I shall take what I want! You will never realize the strength required to make such a decision!
What do you want now?
Then you disturb me. Leave.
You are barely tolerated by us. Why should we give one of our most prized possessions to you?
Right?! I determine what is right around here. You are treading on dangerous ground.
Yes, indeed you are. I don't tolerate frightened curs that have no backbone. And what we don't tolerate, we destroy. Kill him.
Would you be willing to fight me over her?
Fine. We shall settle this with no weapons. Knock me out, and I'll let you take the woman and leave. I knock you out, you leave without her.
This will be interesting, but not very sporting. Very well, let's do it.
Hmm, you fight better then I expected. I haven't had a good beating since my father slapped me around the room. You deserve the Shady Sands woman. Take her and leave. I wouldn't come back.
Take your miserable hide and leave. If you ever return, I will not be so gentle.
What do you want?
We don't like those kind of people. We can't have that here. Kill him.
You? Want to join us? Whatever for?
The Raiders only accept the meanest and toughest SOBs around. You have to be bloodthirsty, violent, extreme. I don't think you can handle that. Can you?
Then you had better leave. I would not return.
I grow tired of these women. Kill them.
You have proved my point. Only the Raiders posses the will to survive! You do not. Kill him.
You have proved my point. Only the Raiders posses the will to survive! You do not. Kill her.
Scum! You will pay for that!
What do you want now?
You must fend for yourself.
How dare you return to my sight? Kill him!
How dare you return to my sight? Kill her!
Well go get some more booze and women for our party.
You're no Raider, you deserve no honor.
We don't like those kind of people. We can't have that here. Kill her.

voice_info.appearance: You see Garret.
sample_lines: You shouldn't be here during the day. It makes Set unhappy. Come back at night
You had better leave now.
You need to leave here . . . immediately.

npc_lines.text: You shouldn't be here during the day. It makes Set unhappy. Come back at night
You had better leave now.
You need to leave here . . . immediately.
I hope not, for your sake. Set was not too happy to have to use you. It might be a good idea to leave Necropolis . . . soon
I told you to leave.
Whatever.
Perhaps. Hmm. Here, take this as well.
Now leave.

voice_info.appearance: You see a chanter from the Children
sample_lines: Hello friend! Will you sing a song of Praise with me? . . . Once I was wandering blind, In a land that was so unkind . . .
He finds you when and where you least expect it! Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame! Praise the world!
What a wonderful joke! I used to have no sense of humor, but thanks to the Master, I am full of mirth! Praise the Master!

npc_lines.text: Hello friend! Will you sing a song of Praise with me? . . . Once I was wandering blind, In a land that was so unkind . . .
He finds you when and where you least expect it! Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame! Praise the world!
What a wonderful joke! I used to have no sense of humor, but thanks to the Master, I am full of mirth! Praise the Master!
The one who sits above. The one who sits below. The one who rests within. Praise the Master for such clarity of vision!
Oh, if only I were so fortunate! Perhaps one day the Master will let me kiss his body parts. Praise the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!
Hmm, that's not what I had in mind. You had better practice, my friend. Praise to the Master! Praise the Holy Flame!

voice_info.appearance: Hello! What can I do for you?
sample_lines: Hello! What can I do for you?
Aack!
Sorry, this company is already full.

npc_lines.text: Hello! What can I do for you?
Aack!
Sorry, this company is already full.
Sorry, but I don't think I can trust you.

voice_info.appearance: Stop!
sample_lines: You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
What manner of treason is this?!

npc_lines.text: You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
What manner of treason is this?!
Show me your pass, then.
Hurry on your task then, but be warned, I'm watching you.
Yes, little brother. What is it that you need from me?
Yes, little sister. What is it that you need from me?
I am sorry, but you will have to find the way to Unity yourself.
You are obviously a heathen! Pay for your sins!
He resides on Level 3, as he must. Why do you ask such a silly question?
You insult me! Die!
Praise to the Unity.
You sound like you do not believe what you say. Could this be true? Or have you left the path of righteousness?
When you become one of us, you will not fear such minor things. Begone.
What do you want this time? I have little time for your talk.
Just who are you? Let me see . . . Argh! An intruder . . .
Move along. Do your part for the Unity and stop bothering me!
Get going.
Move along. Do your part for the Unity.

voice_info.appearance: Die, you dog!
sample_lines: Hold, initiate! What do you have to report?
Hold! I recognize you -- you've visited the Brotherhood. Some may trust you, but I do not. State your business!
Hold! I recognize you and I do not trust you. I give you fair warning: if you make trouble for us, you will be shot dead. Now move!

npc_lines.text: Hold, initiate! What do you have to report?
Hold! I recognize you -- you've visited the Brotherhood. Some may trust you, but I do not. State your business!
Hold! I recognize you and I do not trust you. I give you fair warning: if you make trouble for us, you will be shot dead. Now move!
Hold! Who goes there! State your name and your business!
Halt! These lands belong to the Brotherhood of Steel. Leave now, or we will shoot you as a trespasser.
Very good. Carry on, Initiate.
I see. Carry on, Initiate.
There are reports of large mutant humans attacking travelers, so we're increasing our vigilance. Keep a close eye on the area and retreat to the compound if necessary. Initiate, dismissed!
These are troubled times, Initiate! Mutants are on the march, attacking caravans! We need information, and we need it now! Nothing to report is not good enough!
Get your sorry ass out of here, and bring us back some useful intelligence! Initiate, dismissed!
Oh yes, I heard about you. Not much of an IQ, but a helluva fighter. Too bad.
This is our land, and here, your business is our business. I repeat, state your business.
A friendly face? It won't be mine. I would recommend leaving.
As are we all. As long as you do not act against the Brotherhood, you will not be harmed, but tread carefully.
It depends on whether or not you consider us vermin. If you attack our enemies, you will be permitted to travel in our territory. If you offend us, you will die. Consider yourself warned.
That's a reasonable request. Fall in.
Water chip? I hope you're not serious! You'd be better off struggling on the surface than enslaving yourself to a single piece of machinery.
As are we. The most common theory is that they come from the Glow, but I doubt even mutants could survive there for long. If you find out something, let us know.
How dare you accuse me of such a thing! The Brotherhood of Steel has never forced anyuone to serve us against their will. That goes against everything we believe in. Get out of my sight!
We found a wrecked caravan about a day's journey to the west. We found one survivor - poor girl. She claimed they were attacked by mutant humans with incredible strength.
We've heard enough reports that we're . . . concerned. I would walk cautiously, if I were you.
I'm going to have to teach you some manners, boy. This should make for some light entertainment.
I'm going to have to teach you some manners, girl. This should make for some light entertainment.
Your mind is completely gone. Poor creature.
What do you want?
Then I suggest you leave.

voice_info.appearance: The Raider is too frightened of Garl to speak to you anymore.
sample_lines: Well met.
Hi.
I'm waiting for Garl to crush Shady Sands. I want some loot.

npc_lines.text: Well met.
Hi.
I'm waiting for Garl to crush Shady Sands. I want some loot.
Welcome, friend.
I'm glad that you could return for a visit.
So, you think you're tough, huh? Mess with me and we'll both find out.
I don't like your looks.
Go away!
What do you want?
Oh. You must be looking for a job. Go and see Garl in the big room and leave us alone.
Then do it elsewhere.
Nah. I ain't seen her. Why are you asking?
Ah, OK.
Really? What does she look like?
Yeah, she's here. She's in the big house. You know, if we tell Garl, then he would want a piece of the bounty. You might want to think about that.
You don't sound like you mean it. I think that you are up to something. And if you are telling the truth, then I'll bag the reward for myself.
I . . . I can't say any more or Garl will kill me.
Bite me!
I don't like your looks. You'd better get away from me.
What? Go away!

What? Go away!

voice_info.appearance: Stop!
sample_lines: You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
What manner of treason is this?!

npc_lines.text: You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
What manner of treason is this?!
Show me your pass, then.
Hurry on your task then, but be warned -- I'm watching you.
Yes, little brother. What is it that you need from me?
Yes, little sister. What is it that you need from me?
I am not one to guide you on the path to Unity. Leave!
You are obviously a heathen! Pay for your sins!
Here is here. Why do you ask?
You insult me! Die!
Praise to the Unity.
You sound like you do not believe what you say. Could this be true? Or have you left the path of righteous?
When you become one of us, you will not fear such minor things. Begone.
What do you want this time? I have little time for your talk.
You are obviously an intruder!
Get out of my face.
I don't have time for you. Stop bothering me.

voice_info.appearance: Command, this is Guardhouse. All clear. Out.
sample_lines: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

npc_lines.text: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

voice_info.appearance: You see a ghoul guard.
sample_lines: Go away! You're not wanted here.
I'm on duty. If you want to see Set, you gotta do it inside.
The door is locked. You'll have to come back later when it's dark.

npc_lines.text: Go away! You're not wanted here.
I'm on duty. If you want to see Set, you gotta do it inside.
The door is locked. You'll have to come back later when it's dark.
I told you to leave. Your kind is not wanted here.
The doors don't open until dark.
I wish I could help you, but Set would tan my ass if I did. You know how it is . . . always gotta do what the big guy says.

voice_info.appearance: You see a ghoul guard.
sample_lines: We're going to take you to Set. I think he'll want to talk to you, personally.
You shouldn't be here . . .
That doesn't sound right. You'd better come along with me.

npc_lines.text: We're going to take you to Set. I think he'll want to talk to you, personally.
You shouldn't be here . . .
That doesn't sound right. You'd better come along with me.
I don't think you want to go to that room.
I think you'd better be leaving.
We are here to make sure that people that don't belong in Set's room don't go into it. Not for Set's safety, actually, but for theirs. Anything else?
Nah. Thanks.

voice_info.appearance: You see the Ghoul Manager.
sample_lines: Whatta you doing here?
Whad' you say?
That's what I thought you say. Getta outta my house.

npc_lines.text: Whatta you doing here?
Whad' you say?
That's what I thought you say. Getta outta my house.
Oh, nonna dat around here. Maybe uppa da temple or atta water place. Getta going.
Ack! Donna you be exploring any my stuff. Getta out! I mean it.
Donna be in my face likka dat. I runna dis show.
Ack! OK, I concede. I leave.
You no biggie to order me like dat. Take some of dis and shove it!

voice_info.appearance: You see a ghoul refugee.
sample_lines: Please don't kill me.
You . . . You're just gonna kill me, anyway!
Ah, oh. OK.

npc_lines.text: Please don't kill me.
You . . . You're just gonna kill me, anyway!
Ah, oh. OK.
You're gonna kill me!
Ah, didn't you just tell me to shut up?
The super mutants attacked. We were slaughtered. They had guns and bombs, even some steam trucks. They killed my friends. The mutants just butchered us, like you're probably gonna do to me.
The super mutants attacked. We were slaughtered. They had guns and bombs, even some steam trucks. They killed my friends. The mutants just butchered us.
I don't know.
I heard they was pissed that some human killed their men here.
No.
I heard some of the sewer ghouls might have survived, but I don't like it down there.
Yeah, that's it.
I hid until most of the mutants left.
Some big thing that moved on wheels but without any brahmin.
Hey, then why did you ask about it?
You again? What do you want now?
Nope. Well, I did hear that more super mutants were coming. I don't know when.
Make it elsewhere then. I gotta keep low.

voice_info.appearance: You see Gideon, a normal looking human. He is wearing a crown.
sample_lines: Jason is a living god! Only the nullified may pass!
The walls also have minds . . . I saw you . . . tomorrow?
Jason? Who's Jason?

gideon.description: His hands are glowing with a strange energy.

npc_lines.text: Jason is a living god! Only the nullified may pass!
The walls also have minds . . . I saw you . . . tomorrow?
Jason? Who's Jason?
Yes, the walls are alive with those that have gone before.
Meeting of the soul . . . melded with, to protect, the Master of all.
There is only peace and joining . . . the price . . . the pain . . . one must be blind . . . nulled.
I will anoint you . . . I must give what I must not.
You cannot kill the genius of . . . the all . . .  you . . . hehf!
Those who have gone before . . . must stop your journey.

voice_info.appearance: Hey!
sample_lines: What?
I'm on duty. Make it quick.
No. Go away.

gizguard.description: Human male dressed in protective leather clothing

npc_lines.text: What?
I'm on duty. Make it quick.
No. Go away.
Gizmo's a fair man. Pay's good, work's easy. Don't make trouble and everyone will be happy.
Get outta here, you moron.

voice_info.appearance: You see a rotund midget.
sample_lines: What you down here for?
I know you . . . right?
Um . . . okay.

npc_lines.text: What you down here for?
I know you . . . right?
Um . . . okay.
Yes, yes, almost done.
Body parts almost ready to go to Hub.
Iguana man Bob send you . . . he happy, lots of good meat . . .
For Bob to sell . . . to eat . . . why you ask what we use for?
Me have trouble thinking, too . . . what we talk about?
I don't talk to you any more.
Yes . . . Doc Morbid has best human bodies around. None better.
I go back to work now.

voice_info.appearance: What do you want?
sample_lines: Nothing.
You could say that.
Yeah, yeah, that's great. What's the job entail and what's it worth to ya?

npc_lines.text: Nothing.
You could say that.
Yeah, yeah, that's great. What's the job entail and what's it worth to ya?

Well, the Regulators keep them from attacking us outright, but it's all they can do to keep our little community safe. They try to sneak in at night to kill our citizens, or to, to kidnap our children . . . and . . . [He stops a moment to compose himself before continuing] Just last week one of them burst through the north gate in the middle of the night with dynamite strapped to his body to blow up the Regulator's barracks . . . no doubt to weaken us enough so that they could launch a full scale attack.
What happened to him?
That sounds a bit extreme, doesn't it?
Luckily, the Regulators killed him before he could complete his plan. I saw his body myself.
I'll give you 2000 caps to kill their leader! I want that bitch's head!
Sounds good to me.
Uh, right. I want no part of this sickness.
It was the middle of the night, as I told you. I was asleep. Luckily, the Regulators usually catch these barbarians before they even make it inside our town.
Yeah, that's pretty lucky. Pretty convenient, too.
I don't like how this all sounds. Count me out.
I might just ignore that remark if you've come here to solve my problem for me.
What problem is that?
Have you ever dealt with a vicious, murdering band of thieves before?
Not another backwater town with a gang problem! This is ridiculous!
What would be convenient would be to put an end to their foulness once and for all!
Let me guess - you want them dead.
How can I help?

voice_info.appearance: You see Gunther.
sample_lines: Welcome to my humble house.  What can I do for you?
Sure, what else would you like to know?
It is a sprawling city, the largest I have seen in my life.  The center of the town lies to the south, with the other areas branching off in each direction from there.

npc_lines.text: Welcome to my humble house.  What can I do for you?
Sure, what else would you like to know?
It is a sprawling city, the largest I have seen in my life.  The center of the town lies to the south, with the other areas branching off in each direction from there.
I get everything that I need from Mitch down by the Maltese Falcon.  Just head on south from here.

I occasionaly do a stint on one of the caravans that head out from here.  If you're looking for that kind of work, just talk to one of the trading houses.  I'm partial to the Far Go Traders, but I've worked with all of them.
Well, I buy most of my stuff from Beth over in the Weapon Store.  Got a pretty good selection.
I've heard there is some guy over in Old Town that deals in stuff with a little more punch.
Probably not, she's sweet on her bodyguard Sid.  But, you might want to try Butch, he runs the Far Go Traders - which owns her store.
I get by.  I hire on with the caravans when I'm a little short on cash, and work for the farmers down south a bit.
Well, you probably passed Deputy Fry on your way down here.  His boss is Sheriff Greene, and you'll find him in the Police Station most of the time.
I'm sorry, but you're not making any sense.  Maybe Dr. Thorndyke with the Children can help you.

voice_info.appearance: Sorry, no boxing today.
sample_lines: Sorry, no boxing today.
You might try signing up with Gizmo. I hear he's always looking for new meat to toss in the ring.
Try again tomorrow. Saul will be boxing then.

npc_lines.text: Sorry, no boxing today.
You might try signing up with Gizmo. I hear he's always looking for new meat to toss in the ring.
Try again tomorrow. Saul will be boxing then.
You just missed it. Try again in a couple of days. Saul boxes every three days.
Saul is the local champion. Saul is the current favorite of Gizmo.
So! Want to lay a bet on the fight?
Sorry, but today's match is already over.
Who do you want to bet on, Saul or the challenger? Odds favor Saul winning. Cost is 25 caps to bet; you get 50 if you win betting on Saul, 100 if you win betting on the challenger!
All right, I guess.
Sorry, I don't have the time. Maybe later.
Saul, the fastest fist in Junktown! He's a marvel of manly musculature! A pulsating power puncher!
He's a nice guy, too.

Gizmo, the casino owner, employs Saul. He occasionally likes to watch a match or two, but mostly it's good money - people will bet a lot on a fight. And nobody has to get killed, unlike those death matches they supposedly have in the Hub.
Well, it's just a rumor. But they say there's an underground fighting ring there where you can pay to watch people fight to the death. Not my kind of fight.
Hey, what are you doing?
Please quit it.
Uh, no. Never mind. Forget I said anything.
Well, well, looks like you're a winner! Here's your caps.
Come back when you have enough caps to bet!
Would you like to wait here until the fight starts at 2:00?
Okay, but if you miss, the fight, you forfeit your bet!
Please don't disturb me while the match is in progress.
Well, you can't win them all, my friend. Better luck next time.
Well, you can't win them all, my friend. Better luck next time.
Sorry, one bet per fight.

voice_info.appearance: You see Gwen, a desert bandit.
sample_lines: I am Gwen. I'm one of Garl's advisors. Who are you?
As an advisor, I make sure that no low-lifes cause any trouble for Garl.
Hmpf. If you're nobody special then I won't bother talking to you. Go away.

npc_lines.text: I am Gwen. I'm one of Garl's advisors. Who are you?
As an advisor, I make sure that no low-lifes cause any trouble for Garl.
Hmpf. If you're nobody special then I won't bother talking to you. Go away.
I keep idiots like you from bothering Garl.  Go away!
I have ways to make certain undesirables are no longer here.
It's been so long since I've had a good fight. Too bad you are going to lose. Here is proof of my skills!
You'll regret that remark.  It will be your last!
If that is the best you can do, then I will be doing the world a favor by killing you.
Me and this army!
You annoy me. Leave before I become truly angry.

voice_info.appearance: You see Harry, the Super Mutant.
sample_lines: You're not taking me anywhere!

npc_lines.text: You're not taking me anywhere!

voice_info.appearance: You see Beth, owner of the Weapon Shop.
sample_lines: Hi there.  How can I help you?
Well, I'm not one to gossip, but I heard that Decker's death is somehow related to the assassination hit on Jain.
Well, I usually don't talk behind people's backs, but I know someone who knows someone that says that they saw three extremely large robed figures go into the Maltese Falcon right before the murders.

npc_lines.text: Hi there.  How can I help you?
Well, I'm not one to gossip, but I heard that Decker's death is somehow related to the assassination hit on Jain.
Well, I usually don't talk behind people's backs, but I know someone who knows someone that says that they saw three extremely large robed figures go into the Maltese Falcon right before the murders.

Well, I usually don't talk behind people's backs, but someone killed Jain, the High Priestess of the Children of the Cathedral. I don't care for them myself, but I don't know what she could have done to deserve that.
Well, I usually don't talk behind people's backs, but a merchant friend of mine saw a group of mutants wandering around in the desert up past the Brotherhood of Steel, far to the Northwest.
Well, I usually don't talk behind people's backs, but the Children of the Cathedral have been asking people where you are. I'd be careful. They're a strange bunch.
Well, I'm not one to gossip, but I heard that Decker's death is somehow related to the assassination hit on Jain.
There is something else. I know someone who knows someone that says that they saw three extremely large robed figures go into the Maltese Falcon right before the murders.
There is something else. Someone killed Jain, the High Priestess of the Children of the Cathedral. I don't care for them myself, but I don't know what she could have done to deserve that.
There is something else. A merchant friend of mine saw a group of mutants wandering around in the desert up past the Brotherhood of Steel, far to the Northwest.
There is something else. The Children of the Cathedral have been asking people where you are. I'd be careful. They're a strange bunch.
I'm sorry, what was that?
I'm sorry, I don't understand. Please come back when you are feeling better.
Well I'm not hiring but there's a job post in the center of the Merchant Market, you might want to check there.
No, nothing good at least. Give me a chance to do some digging. <She winks at you>. Anything else?
What else can I do for you?
Of course you can, don't be silly.
Why sure, I'd be happy to help. What did you need to know?
All right. Well it's been nice talking to you, have a nice day.
No, that's all. Was there something else you wanted to talk about?
Well come back soon.  Don't be a stranger.
Now there's someone you don't ever want to mess with, he scares me. He 'owns' the Maltese Falcon.
Sorry, it just reminds me of a friend that used to own it before him. Decker wanted it really bad, but my friend wouldn't sell. Two days later they found him dead in a back alley of Old Town.

My friend was a clean freak. He wouldn't come within a hundred yards of Old Town.  He was shot with a Magnum; no one in Old Town could afford one of those. Plus, he was shot once in the head and twice in the back. Does that sound like a robbery? My friend was just trying to get his life back.
You probably don't understand, but most of us look forward to the day when we own our own lives. When our lives don't belong to the merchants or the money lenders.
Is there anything else I can do for you?
Well, excuse me. YOU asked.
He's the deadliest person in the Hub; most say that he runs this place, not the merchants or the police. If you ever cross him, watch out.
That gives him no right to kill anyone.
You make me sick, please leave. I'm sure he's missing your company.
Well, there are three main merchant groups. There's the Water Merchants, the Crimson Caravan, and the Far Go Traders. They also run the city council. What do you want to know about?
They're in charge of all the water. Greedy people, I wouldn't want to work for them.  Their pay is the worst and the jobs are just as bad.
What else would you like to know about?

No. From what I've heard, a while back a group of merchants seized control of the water tower and proclaimed that they were the water merchants and people had to get water from them. The merchant war raged on for years until a man named Roy Greene - yeah, Justin's Grandfather, that's it - helped to negotiate an agreement that ended the war.
Well he set up the city council and set a limit on the price of water. Personally I think they should have beat the tar out of them - oh, sorry. I mean they should have showed them who's boss.
Sorry I tend to get carried away with myself. Was there anything else you wanted to know about?
The Crimson Caravan are a bunch of crazy people. They will do any job, no matter what the risk. I'm surprised they aren't missing more caravans than they are.
They will pass right through an area known to be attacked by raiders. They charge a lot so they can hire extra hands. The pay's great but you have to be alive to spend it, right?
Actually all the merchants have had a few caravans disappear. The Far Go Traders are just unlucky, I suppose.

The Far Go Traders pay well and their jobs aren't too deadly. Butch owns this shop, a good man. They're fair and let me do as I please with the place; I like working with them.  Plus you get a discount on anything you buy here if you work for Butch.
Personally I don't think so. I think it was the Deathclaw or maybe the Brotherhood of Steel.
Some people think the Water Merchants are responsible, but I don't think so.  I think it was that darn Deathclaw, or maybe the people over at the Brotherhood of Steel.
Well, I thought that it was destroying the caravans, but I guess not.  It's still out there though. There are too many rumors floating around for it not to exist.
I think that's what's taking the caravans. It could also be the Brotherhood of Steel; they're a strange bunch. Some people think it's the Water Merchants, but they're wrong.
Sure.
Because, like I've been telling everyone, they've had a few caravans disappear too.  Nothing like what's happening to the Far Go Traders, but they are being affected.
Excuse you! You're awfully quick to judge, are you afraid of the truth?
There are six representatives two from each of the main merchant groups. Everything needs at least four votes to be passed. They can never agree on anything.

Good thought, but I highly doubt it. They've been sabotaging each other for years, but this is not their style. They wouldn't spend that much money to take out the caravans. Plus all the caravans are very heavily guarded. You would think someone would escape. They don't have the man power or the cash to pull that off. There would have been at least one survivor.

Bad luck? I don't know, maybe they're traveling along different routes than the others. Maybe because they aren't as heavily guarded as the Crimson Caravan but . . . they might have better cargo than the Water Merchants. Who knows. There doesn't seem to be any clear difference between the three.
Excuse me! You're free to leave at any time. If you didn't want the answer you shouldn't have asked.

The Deathclaw is the most evil thing to rise out of the ashes after the War.  Some say it's a powerful ghost from the war that haunts the land. It's no ghost, it's as real as you and me. It's 20 feet tall with teeth as big as your arm.  It's some kind of demon that found it's way here when the world was engulfed in fire.
Well, I know this old mutant in Old Town named Harold. He's seen it. He's the 'only' one that's seen it and lived.
Uncle Slappy over in Old Town talks about it sometimes, but he's just a crazy old fool.
You'll see!
Yeah, pretty amazing isn't it. It's down to the southwest somewhere. There's an old mutant in Old Town named Harold who actually saw this thing in its lair. Nicest Skag I know.
Well, um. I don't remember, but who ever it was wouldn't lie . . . I mean, it might be true! You should be careful just the same.
Why, you don't know? [whispering] I heard that they make human sacrifices and do all sorts of other terrible things!
Like you don't know. You're obviously one of them, walking around in that metal suit. You're all a bunch of sick people.
Uhh . . . well, yeah . . . umm You . . . I . . . Is there anything else you needed?
You never know what a person's really like behind closed doors.  You've got to be careful with who you associate yourself with.  Was there anything else you needed?
You're a . . . ?  I mean. I didn't mean . . . Umm . . . Lovely day we're having. Don't you think so? So, was there anything else I can do for you?
Sure, whatever you say. Was there anything else that I can do for you?
Oh, that's right. You're working for Butch, you get the 15% discount.
Did you hear? He's dead! I'm overjoyed! That's the best thing that's ever happened to this city.
I already told you. He's dead! Let's just forget about him, his name brings back bad memories.

You did it? Really? I love you! [Beth looks over at Sid] Don't even think about it wise guy . . .  Here, to show my gratitude . . . [Beth gives you six stimpaks.] It's not much, but I really appreciate it!
You did it? Really? You're the best! You have no idea how happy I was to hear that he was dead. Here take these . . . [Beth gives you six stimpaks.] It's not much, but I really appreciate it!
Goodbye.

Oh yes. You ought to stay as far away from the Maltese Falcon as you possibly can. Decker and his greasy lapdog Kane are bad news. They'll eat you alive if you're not careful. I'd also give Lorenzo at the Friendly Lending company a wide berth.

voice_info.appearance: You see a guard for the Children.
sample_lines: What do you want?
I'm a hired hand. If anyone bothers these space cadets, I kill em. You got a problem with that?
Something called a Holy Flame. Don't listen to this bullshit, it'll rot your brain!

npc_lines.text: What do you want?
I'm a hired hand. If anyone bothers these space cadets, I kill em. You got a problem with that?
Something called a Holy Flame. Don't listen to this bullshit, it'll rot your brain!
Water chip? Do you mean like ice chips? Up in the mountains, maybe.
Yeah, I heard about him. He's a real bastard, but he pays his bills. Phillips worked for him a few times.
Yeah, this is the only one I'd want in a fire fight. What can I do for you?
Sorry pal, but I'm on duty. No small talk.
Get the Hell out of my face before I kill you.
Way to go, Rocket Scientist! Who else could I be, Doc Morbid? Jeez!
The priest bitch. Who else did you think? Jeez!
I hate to admit it pal, but I've been out of the loop for weeks. You better ask someone else.
Room and board and not much else. These religious types are cheap!
Then let's solve it!
Fine. Because nobody likes a problem around here.
It's gotta be a scam. Nobody's really dumb enough to believe all this religious shit. Could they?
Yeah. It's a good thing that they aren't paying me to agree with them. Holy flame, my ass!

I dunno. I can tell you one thing, whatever you can say about the religion, they're not amateurs. They came in and organized this place like clockwork. This isn't just another band of mindless zombies.
Jeez, I thought only Vaults used that sort of crap!
Watch your mouth, asshole. These people may believe in peace and love, but I don't!
No problem.
Nah. The higher you climb, the worse the radiation gets.
Uh, if you like psychotic, stone cold ruthless bastards, then he's the man.
My partner. The guy who's guarding Jain.
It depends on how much risk you like. My life's been kinda busy lately, so I came here to lie low. But if you like action, sure. Just don't screw up or you're dead, that's all.
I hear the Water Merchants are always packing the best shit. But people will say anything about the Water Merchants. It ain't here among this crowd, that's for damn sure.
I been trying to get a good read on these guys for weeks. At first I thought they were fools, but now I ain't sure. They're organized, and they've got a plan. I can smell it!
I hear Decker's got some action, but man, it's shitty work and if you screw up, you're as good as dead.
Water purification chip? You don't use well water? Good lord! I heard tell of a Vault near Shady Sands where you might find one, but that place is completely caved in. I don't think I can help you.
Hey, you!
Hey! What do you think you're doing!
None of your business! Get outta here!
Good! Now get outta here!
Get lost! If you pull this sort of shit again, I'll kill you personally!

voice_info.appearance: You see the Bar Tender.
sample_lines: You've got to have the money to play, pal.
You've got to have the money to play, lady.

npc_lines.text: You've got to have the money to play, pal.
You've got to have the money to play, lady.

voice_info.appearance: You see Heather of the Follower's Scouts.
sample_lines: What are you doing here?
Really? And what might you be looking for?
Thank you, but I am already spoken for. I think it is time for you to leave.

npc_lines.text: What are you doing here?
Really? And what might you be looking for?
Thank you, but I am already spoken for. I think it is time for you to leave.
Yes, the spy. I have heard of that bothersome pest. I really wish we could catch him.
I bet it was the braggart Neil that said as much. I'll have to have a talk with him later.
I am almost sure of it. I just need some proof.
Thank you. You don't know how much this means to me. Once you get proof, kill him.
What is there not to know? He has access to the Children. He works during the night when most are asleep. It has to be him.
I am truly sorry that you think that way. I cannot have someone think I am a spy. I will remove you from service.
He has access to the Children during the night. No one ever sees him on duty. It must be him.
I am not certain as to who it is. I think it may either be a guard or a scholar. They keep sneaking into the Children's Cathedral at night.
Not really. Just that I think it is a male and probably a scholar or guard.
True. We scouts do many raids on the Children, and to much loss lately. This spy costs us dearly.
Why would one of us do that?
Sounds like a good thought. I've noticed Peter never gets attacked much in the raids. I think he may be the one.
You think that it is me?
Then wonder somewhere else. I must get back to work.
I think he thinks I am the spy. But I'm not.
Because I am the new scout. I've only been here for about a year and the trouble started about five months ago.
Then look elsewhere. This is no place for you.
If you need information, look to Nicole. She thinks she knows everything.
I can be persuaded to tell you something that's going on. For a price.
Three hundred caps and the information is yours.
There will be a raid on the south end of the Children's stronghold. Now go.
Trying to cheat me? I'll show you!
I'm sorry you feel that way. But, good day to you.
I need to get by somehow. Now, do you want in or not?
Nothing. Now leave.

voice_info.appearance: You see an Elder of the Brotherhood.
sample_lines: Greetings Initiate. I need to speak with you. (He motions for you to come closer.)
Good. First go talk to Maxson if you haven't already. Report back to me when you've checked the northern territory. After that, we'll decide what to do with Maxson.
Have you explored the entire northern territory?

npc_lines.text: Greetings Initiate. I need to speak with you. (He motions for you to come closer.)
Good. First go talk to Maxson if you haven't already. Report back to me when you've checked the northern territory. After that, we'll decide what to do with Maxson.
Have you explored the entire northern territory?
And what do you have to report?
I didn't think so. You weren't gone for very long. Now, get back out there and don't come back until you have a FULL report.
I will inform the Elders. We will wait for Maxson's word on what to do. Go inform him on what you've found. Thanks for your help, Initiate.
Then you will make time to hear me out.
I understand. If you do travel up into that area and find anything, please, let me know.
Good work with the mutants. We already heard that you destroyed their production facility. Thanks for taking care of that problem for us.
Err? What kind of response is Err? Leave! Now!
And what did these mutants look like?
As you may know, our Head Scribe, Vree, has done an autopsy on a creature very similar to what you have just described. Do you believe these are the same?
What threat do you assume these "mutants" pose?
Frankly, your report has not shown us any proof that they are a threat to us. What proof can you give that they have hostile intentions.
So, by these actions they are taking, it is feasable that they will eventually come here?
I don't believe that shows hostility. They could simply be protecting themselves from attack. Even we have to deal with the occasional attack.
What do you suggest? A preemptive strike at their military base?
So be it. You shall have three Paladins of my choosing to meet you at the Military Base to help you get inside. Elders, thank you for your time. Best of luck to you Initiate.
So be it. You shall have two Paladins of my choosing to meet you at the Boneyard Cathedral. Elders, thank you for your time. Best of luck to you Initiate.
Obviously we made a mistake. Elders, I am sorry for wasting your time. Would someone please remove this mental abomination?

voice_info.appearance: You see Daren Hightower.
sample_lines: Who are you?!?  And who let you in?
I have no friends.  What is your message?
Tell me somthing I don't know, you moron!

npc_lines.text: Who are you?!?  And who let you in?
I have no friends.  What is your message?
Tell me somthing I don't know, you moron!
I don't know any Bob, but I'll take the 100 caps and you can leave.
Think nothing of it.  I always enjoy strangers coming into my home and giving me money.  Leon, show this fool the door! Come back again, and my guards will have your head!
Leon, show this fool the door!  Come back again, and my guards will have your head!
Guards!  Assassin!

voice_info.appearance: You see the Bar Tender.
sample_lines: Place your bets.
Sorry, better luck next time.
Winner! (You push.)

npc_lines.text: Place your bets.
Sorry, better luck next time.
Winner! (You push.)
Winner! (You get double your money.)
Winner! (You get triple your money.)
You've got to have the money to play, pal.
You've got to have the money to play, lady.

voice_info.appearance: You see the Bar Tender.
sample_lines: You've got to have the money to play, pal.
You've got to have the money to play, lady.

npc_lines.text: You've got to have the money to play, pal.
You've got to have the money to play, lady.

voice_info.appearance: You see George, the door guard.
sample_lines: Can I help you?
Mr. Hightower doesn't see just anyone.
Ok.  Go on in.

npc_lines.text: Can I help you?
Mr. Hightower doesn't see just anyone.
Ok.  Go on in.
I know all of Mr. Hightower's associates and I've never seen you before, so you'd better leave.  Now.
Oh, man are you in trouble!  Mr. H hates it when his appointments are late.  I'll let him chew you out himself. Go on in.
You're not getting in here.  Beat it, skag!

voice_info.appearance: You see Leon, a guard.
sample_lines: What is your business here?
Ok.  But I'm watching you.  He's in his office.
I don't like your attitude.  I'm going to have to ask you to leave.

npc_lines.text: What is your business here?
Ok.  But I'm watching you.  He's in his office.
I don't like your attitude.  I'm going to have to ask you to leave.
Whatever it is, you can tell me.  Mr. H is busy right now.
You can tell me, or you can leave.
Again?  What a fool Decker is.  Well?... I guess he's not as big a fool as the guys he hires for these jobs.  See here, check out my gun.
[Leon shows you the side of his gun where 5 deep scratch marks are visible.]
Each one of these marks is for a past attempt on Hightower's life.  I bagged each and every one of them.  Tell me... do you know what this fool Decker hired looks like?
Thank you for the advance warning, but Mr. Hightower doesn't like strangers hangin' around.  I'm going to have to ask you to leave.
Mr. Hightower is not taking any visitors.  Now leave!
Ok, buddy.  Let's go. [Leon grabs you by the arm.]

voice_info.appearance: You see Rick, a guard.
sample_lines: Whadda' ya' want?
Get back over to the Eastside, you hop head!
Make it quick.  I'm not supposed to be talking on the job.

npc_lines.text: Whadda' ya' want?
Get back over to the Eastside, you hop head!
Make it quick.  I'm not supposed to be talking on the job.
You'd better watch your step and your mouth, punk!
If you don't know, you probably shouldn't be here.  This is the Heights.  Mister Hightower lives here and he only sees people on appointment.
I'm here to make sure nobody messes with Mr. Hightower.
No.
I don't like your attitude.  You'd better leave.

After sundown nobody is allowed in this area.  The other guards won't even give you a warning.  If they catch you they'll attack.  You'd better get back downtown while your head is still attached to your neck.
Man, you are rock-stupid, aren't you?  Take a hike!

voice_info.appearance: You see a flower child.
sample_lines: Would you like a flower, mister?
Would you like a flower, madam?
Do you want the flower or don't you!

npc_lines.text: Would you like a flower, mister?
Would you like a flower, madam?
Do you want the flower or don't you!

It's a Unity Rose. It's the color of the Holy Flame, and represents the peace and harmony we'll have when the Children of the Cathedral helps everyone in the whole world become friendly and strong!  Uh, do you want one?
It's free. We don't believe in money. The Holy Flame takes care of all of our needs! It's so wonderful! You should join us in our Cathedral of Happiness! Uh, do you want one?
Thank you, oh thank you! I gave away a flower! Isn't that great
You're mean! I hate you! I hope you get eaten by the Holy Flame!
They sure do! Have one! I gave away a flower! Isn't that great
You're stupid! I hope the Holy Flame kills you before you can say anymore stupid things. Mother Jain, watch out for the stupid man!

We're the Children of the Cathedral. We've been commanded by the Holy Flame itself to feed the hungry and heal the sick. We're going to spread peace and unity everywhereand everything will be soooo good! Here, have your flower!
I don't think you want a flower at all. You're being mean to me!
Roses won't do that, silly! Only people can change the world. And with the Holy Flame as our master, we'll be sure to make everything nice and special! So would you like a flower
That's the fire that cleansed the world, and if we obey it, it'll never do it again! It wants us be smart and peaceful and unified and stuff! So would you like a flower?
It's a wonderful place near the ocean, where people spend all their time praising the Holy Flame and being good. And everyone there is kind, except maybe Father Lasher. Uhwould you like a flower?

voice_info.appearance: You see Jacob, the arms dealer.
sample_lines: Hi!  Welcome to Jake's.  I've got some great merchandise in stock.  Feel free to look around.

I deal with high end arms.  The best stuff you can find this side of the Brotherhood, and since the Brotherhood doesn't deal with outsiders, I've gotta' say I'm the best.  I have a Sniper Rifle, and y
Man, you do like the rare stuff!  Where were you when I was selling some depleted uranium rounds a few years back?  I don't do chips, though.  Ain't a market in it.  Anything else?

npc_lines.text: Hi!  Welcome to Jake's.  I've got some great merchandise in stock.  Feel free to look around.

I deal with high end arms.  The best stuff you can find this side of the Brotherhood, and since the Brotherhood doesn't deal with outsiders, I've gotta' say I'm the best.  I have a Sniper Rifle, and you would be hard pressed to find Flame Thrower fuel anywhere else in the wastes.  On yeah... I've got a Geiger counter, too.  Very rare.
Man, you do like the rare stuff!  Where were you when I was selling some depleted uranium rounds a few years back?  I don't do chips, though.  Ain't a market in it.  Anything else?

Well, I've been around.  Used to be with the Union of Atomic Workers.  Sort of like the Brotherhood, but less friendly.  They wanted to keep to themselves, and I... well, I wanted to see the world and be my own boss, so I left.

Ahh, the DKS is a fine long range weapon.  It was originally .308, but we rechambered it for the more common .223 round.  We tuned the barrel, too.  Most importantly, check out this trigger.  Smooth, huh?  The trigger breaks perfectly now.  Overall, this is a good choice for hunting any type of animal...

What do you need a Gieger counter for!? [Laughs] Though it's been 80 years or so since the bombs fell, there's still radiation around, you goof.  You can't see it, never could, but it's there.  Heck I'm willin' to bet you got some counts on you now.  Everyone that lives in the wastes has a few RAD counts.

Well, some call it the Phantom Death, 'cause that's what it is.  You can't see it, you can't hear it, you can't even smell it.  It basically builds up in your system.  You never feel it until it's too late.  The more trips you make to Hot Spots, the more it builds up and it will never leave your system.  Ever.  The Rads just keep building up.  Well... unless you can get a hold of some Rad-Away.

It's pretty simple, actually.  You use it and it tells you how many Rads you have.  As long as you keep your Rad count under 100, you should be fine.  Go above 100 and you're in some trouble.  The worst part is you won't even know you've been sucking up Rads until a few days later.  Get over 1000 and you're cooked - unless you get a hold of a whole lot of Rad-Away.
I don't want any trouble.  If you want to do business then let's do it.  If not, get out.

I don't carry it.  Any I find I keep for myself.  Right up the street here, there's a guy that may be able to help you.  His name is Vance.  Don't ask too many questions of him.  Let's just say this is his area of expertise.  Just tell him Jacob sent you and he should do you up just fine.
Here's what I've got.
Bye.

The mutants wiped 'em out about ten years ago, so I guess I made the right decision. I eventually settled down here.  The cops don't like my trade and I've been rousted more than once, but I'm a helluva lot more honest than most of the merchants here.
Hey, how's it going my friend?  Lookin' to buy somethin'?
Hey, how's it going my friend?  Lookin' to buy somethin'?

Well, you might try the Gun Runners over in the Boneyard.  They'll probably have something to suit your needs. I've heard the guys at the Brotherhood of Steel pack some pretty powerful hardware too, so you might check them out.

voice_info.appearance: You see a burly bounty hunter with a button that reads, 'I'm Christopher and you're meat.'
sample_lines: What do you want?
We don't appreciate wise guys here. Buzz off.
That joke wasn't even funny the first time. You're about to discover why I'm one of the most fearsome bounty hunters in the wasteland. And I won't even get paid for it.

npc_lines.text: What do you want?
We don't appreciate wise guys here. Buzz off.
That joke wasn't even funny the first time. You're about to discover why I'm one of the most fearsome bounty hunters in the wasteland. And I won't even get paid for it.
None of your business.
Well, go poke around somewhere else.

voice_info.appearance: You see a Hub guard.
sample_lines: Can I help you?
Man, you're dumber than a bag of hammers, aren't you?  Get outta' here
You're in the south end of the Hub.  If you look around you'll find the Water Merchants and a small hospital.

npc_lines.text: Can I help you?
Man, you're dumber than a bag of hammers, aren't you?  Get outta' here
You're in the south end of the Hub.  If you look around you'll find the Water Merchants and a small hospital.
Those bastards.  They think they own the damn Hub just because they have control of the Water Tower.
The Children of the Cathedral run a small hospital here in the Hub.  They seem like a decent bunch.

voice_info.appearance: You see a short, stocky man.
sample_lines: We don't like your kind in these parts.
Hello, stranger. You look like you're new here. What's your name?
Well, then, neither are you.

npc_lines.text: We don't like your kind in these parts.
Hello, stranger. You look like you're new here. What's your name?
Well, then, neither are you.
Good to meet you. I'm Ian.
Sorry, but I don't have time to waste on morons.

I was a guard for the merchants of the Hub. However, I was shot during a raid by bandits. I've been staying here, since the people have helped me recover. Still, my knowledge of the outside world and my experience make me useful here. Shady Sands is my home now. Occasionally, I even get to visit Junktown or the Hub to do some trading, since I'm the only person here who has ever really left town.
Shady Sands is a small but self-sufficient community. The only trouble here is with the bandits and the Radscorpions.
There are several. They come from various groups. They steal our food and occasionally shoot a few people. Seth organized the guards to help fight them off.

Radscorpions are very dangerous. They have a poisonous stinger in the tail, and they are very quick. Aradesh has been trying to find a way to get rid of them. If you feel brave, you could talk to Aradesh about them.
Thanks. It's been healing up well, thanks to Razlo.
Seth is a very brave fighter. He occasionally goes to the Radscorpion caves to kill a few Radscorpions, but they always wind up coming back. There are just too many for him to fight.
What can I help you with?
There are three groups: the Khans, the Vipers, and the Jackals. They pretty much hate each other, but they all raid Shady Sands.

The Hub is a big trading center far south of Shady Sands. It's run by several different caravan groups of merchants: the Water Merchants, the Crimson Caravan, and the Far Go Traders. Junktown is a little south and a ways west. It's smaller, but still a good place to drop in for a drink. It's overseen by a fellow by the name of Killian Darkwater, the local shopkeeper, sheriff, and mayor.
I may not be a very good fighter any more, but I'm good enough to best the likes of you!
Well, since you ask, all right. See you around.
No thanks. I'm needed here.
Let's go. It'll be good to get back into action!
Hmm. Tempting offer, since this place gets boring. Tell ya what. Standard rates. 100 caps, and you've got a deal.
All right, I'll help you out in exchange for my share of loot.
What distance do you want me at?
No, I don't think so. Come back when you have some caps.
I'm a good shot with just about any sort of pistol, and I can use a submachine gun, too. I also know how to handle a knife.
Sure thing.
Can I do something for you before I go?

voice_info.appearance: You see Irwin.
sample_lines: Oh boy, can't you leave me alone? I have enough problems on my hands already.
Hmm... I don't know. It takes a different caliber of hero than you. Listen, why don't you come back when you have a little more experience under your belt?
This is a tragedy, believe me. Nothing is the way it used to be. I have a small farm outside town and a few days ago a bunch of Raiders appeared out of nowhere and now use my home as their camp. They

npc_lines.text: Oh boy, can't you leave me alone? I have enough problems on my hands already.
Hmm... I don't know. It takes a different caliber of hero than you. Listen, why don't you come back when you have a little more experience under your belt?

This is a tragedy, believe me. Nothing is the way it used to be. I have a small farm outside town and a few days ago a bunch of Raiders appeared out of nowhere and now use my home as their camp. They killed Pugsley, my donkey and they threatened to kill me if I ever dare to come back.
Really, you would do that? You know, I don't dare to go there any more. Why don't you come back and let me know when it is safe to go back home again?
Listen freak, I told you to let me alone in the first place. Now beat it!
I knew you would chicken out. Everyone does when it comes to the Raiders.
So, have you been able to teach those Raiders a lesson? Is my home safe again?
Oh, thank you so much. I am sorry I don't have any riches to give to you, but here, take this rifle for saving my home.
You're trying to fool me, right? Please don't play with me. Come back and let me know when it is really safe to get back into my home, will you?
Look, I don't have time for idiots.  Come back when you've got some smarts.

voice_info.appearance: You see a thin, angry-looking man.
sample_lines: What?
Yeah, what do you want?
Oh, great. You don't know how gratified that makes me. Go away.

npc_lines.text: What?
Yeah, what do you want?
Oh, great. You don't know how gratified that makes me. Go away.
Thanks. What can I do for ya?
What?!? I don't have time for this.
Yeah, I sing at the Hub sometimes, and I've visited the Brotherhood of Steel and Adytum with the caravans. Why do you ask?
The Hub? Oh, it's just a short distance down south of Junktown. What else?
The Brotherhood is a couple days west and a little bit north of here. Don't go there, though. They won't let you in unless you're with a caravan. You need anything else?
Hmm. Head southwest of the Hub. Adytum is part of the Boneyard. It's a small, semi-industrial town. I didn't like it much there. What else do you want?
Hey, thanks. It's hard being a starving artist. You got anything you need to know, you just ask.
I appreciate the thought and all, but you're strapped worse than I am.
Ah, I picked it up here and there. Learned a little from an old singer at the Hub, and got some music from the scavs in Adytum, in the Boneyard. You know. Just takes some practice.

voice_info.appearance: You see Jain
sample_lines: Relax, I didn't mean it!

npc_lines.text: Relax, I didn't mean it!

voice_info.appearance: You see Jake of the Followers.
sample_lines: Welcome, my friend! How might I help you today?
You want to help. I don't think you are good enough to help me out. Go talk to Neil.
I would love to fight you, but I am much too busy helping Nicole right now.

npc_lines.text: Welcome, my friend! How might I help you today?
You want to help. I don't think you are good enough to help me out. Go talk to Neil.
I would love to fight you, but I am much too busy helping Nicole right now.
Hey. Just because I don't want to fight doesn't mean I'm a wimp. I just don't feel like it.
Some of us will use our brains to get further in this world. A lot can be settled with peace and thinking.
That's it. I'm not going to talk to you anymore.
That's better. Now. I have a problem with a spy around here. Will you help me?
I just said we have a spy around here. I think it may be one of the guards that is the spy. Though it could be a scout. Those are the only two groups that have access to the Children.
Thank you very much. Now go!
Nothing really. The only things I really know about is that a lot of low level information is getting to the Children. This is not good. Heather thinks it is either Neil or Peter.
I can't let you leave then.
I will then. Good bye!
We are having trouble with some of our information slipping out to the Children. I think it is a spy.
Currently, I can't tell you anything. Good day.
I am trying to sleep. Don't bother me.
Hurry up and find that vile scum!
I knew it was Heather all along. She was deceitful from the start. I should have told everyone what I thought at first.
I never did learn anything from you. Your training was useless.
Hmm. I see. Thank you.

voice_info.appearance: You see one of Shady Sands' guards.
sample_lines: Welcome, stranger. We don't see your kind often.
Not so fast! This is a small community. We don't see strangers often, and we don't really need them if you get my meaning. If you don't have a good reason to be here, you'd better just keep moving.
I wasn't saying that you was gonna. You'd just better leave us alone.

npc_lines.text: Welcome, stranger. We don't see your kind often.
Not so fast! This is a small community. We don't see strangers often, and we don't really need them if you get my meaning. If you don't have a good reason to be here, you'd better just keep moving.
I wasn't saying that you was gonna. You'd just better leave us alone.
Look, Shady Sands don't need your kind from the Hub, or Junktown, or wherever you come from. We do pretty good by ourselves.
The last trader from the Hub sold us a malfunctioning irrigation pump. We've had it with your dirty deals.
Yeah, right. So you say. Just don't get into any trouble, Ok?
Well, maybe you aren't. You do seem a little different to me. I'll tell you what. You should go talk to Aradesh. He is in the center of town.

voice_info.appearance: The man tosses about fitfully.
sample_lines: Thank you so much for helping me. My name is Jarvis, and I'm Seth's younger brother. Please, if there's anything you need to know, just ask.
Hello again. Can I help you with something?
Seth's a very good fighter. He's very determined. A little too much, sometimes. Still, he's devoted to the welfare of our village.

npc_lines.text: Thank you so much for helping me. My name is Jarvis, and I'm Seth's younger brother. Please, if there's anything you need to know, just ask.
Hello again. Can I help you with something?
Seth's a very good fighter. He's very determined. A little too much, sometimes. Still, he's devoted to the welfare of our village.
Well, Shady Sands was founded by a great ancestor of our current leader, Aradesh. He could tell you more of the story. We have a well and irrigation, so we do well for ourselves.

voice_info.appearance: You see Jasmine.
sample_lines: Welcome to the Circle of Thieves. I'm Jasmine. I'm here to help make your infiltration of the Daren Hightower estate as painless as possible. Hightower's estate is located in the Heights. It has a min
Well done, lad.  Here's your reward.  [Jasmine gives you 3000 bucks]
Well done, miss.  Here's your reward.  [Jasmine gives you 3000 bucks]

npc_lines.text: Welcome to the Circle of Thieves. I'm Jasmine. I'm here to help make your infiltration of the Daren Hightower estate as painless as possible. Hightower's estate is located in the Heights. It has a minimum of two guards on duty at all times. The necklace is probably in a strongbox, which often have some minor traps, so be careful. Here are some lockpicks and a couple of flares to make your job a little easier.. And a bottle of Nuka-Cola.  Try not to kill Mr. Hightower.  He's one of our "favorite" people. You got all that?
Well done, lad.  Here's your reward.  [Jasmine gives you 3000 bucks]
Well done, miss.  Here's your reward.  [Jasmine gives you 3000 bucks]
By the way, here's a little something extra to help you out in your future felonious forays.
Well, he's been our benefactor on many occasions. If you kill him, someone smarter may take his place. We wouldn't like that.
Pfah! A real thief lives on her wits. We're being generous with you. Now scat!
They're our corporate sponsor. Loxley got thirsty, and they "donated" several dozen bottles to us. Real nice of them to help us out.
Hmm, don't think I like the attitude. Oh well, nobody's perfect.
Fine. I think I can speak for Mr. Loxley when I say that I hope we never cross paths again. Get out of here.
Good luck. Diamonds are my second favorite thing in the world!
Right. Runk. Sure.
Pfah! A real thief lives on her wits. We're being generous with you miss. Now scat!
[Jasmine hands you a set of Electronic Lockpicks]

voice_info.appearance: You see a young man with sharp features.
sample_lines: Hey, are you from really far away? Have you had a lot of adventures?
Oh. I thought someone who'd been through the wastes outside would be, well, smarter. Never mind.

Miles says that now that you got those parts, he can get the farms working, so that we don't have to sell bullets to the Hub. I never thought much about it until Smitty pointed out that the bullets he

npc_lines.text: Hey, are you from really far away? Have you had a lot of adventures?
Oh. I thought someone who'd been through the wastes outside would be, well, smarter. Never mind.

Miles says that now that you got those parts, he can get the farms working, so that we don't have to sell bullets to the Hub. I never thought much about it until Smitty pointed out that the bullets he made were
sold to the Hub, who sold them to the gangs. I guess you found a good solution.

I never thought that we would be able to stop fighting the gangs. My father told me how you got them to promise to leave us alone. You know, I thought I always wanted to go adventuring, but I think that I like . . . well, the
feeling of security here now. No more worrying about the gangs suddenly attacking and wondering who's going to be killed.
Lorraine says that there was a Vault south of here, where a lot of my grandparents lived. What's it like living in a Vault?
Oh. Well, you must have had some adventures after leaving, right?
Huh. The Hub merchants talk about radscorpions and stuff.
Really? What kinds of monsters have you fought?
Yeah, the Hub guards said that there are lots of radioactive mutant things living in the desert. Monster hunting must be a real blast!
I wish that I could go adventuring sometime.
I never though about that. I rather like having clean water and a place to stay.
I thought that living in the wasteland would be . . . you know . . . rugged, and dangerous, and everything. But I suppose we have enough to keep us busy here, with the gangs and all.
What, are you some kind of weirdo or something? Caleb never should have let you in the gates!
That's cool. All we have here is this stupid well and those underground farms that Miles keeps trying to get working.
Yeah, I noticed that you don't have a bedroll or anything. It must get pretty dirty and uncomfortable out there.
Hello again. Have any interesting stories to tell?
Well, if you do anything interesting, tell me all about it!
Leave me alone!
Thank goodness you're here! Please help me get out of here!
Thank you!
Please don't leave me!
I thought that it would be fun to leave Adytum and explore the world. But the Rippers caught me and have been holding me here. Please, help me!
I hope we get out of here soon!

voice_info.appearance: We offer healing of the body to heal the spirit. Can I help you?
sample_lines: We offer healing of the body to heal the spirit. Can I help you?
That is fine, my child. We will examine you now.
Blessed are the meek of mind. There is nothing wrong with you my child. Run along and play.

npc_lines.text: We offer healing of the body to heal the spirit. Can I help you?
That is fine, my child. We will examine you now.
Blessed are the meek of mind. There is nothing wrong with you my child. Run along and play.
You have been healed. Be more careful in the future.
You are wounded.
I see you are poisoned.
Hmm, some radiation poisoning. Unfortunately, we cannot cure that.
The Children do not haggle. Now, will you accept our price?
Thank you, my son. Let us pray for your healing
Thank you, my daughter. Let us pray for your healing.
There you go. Peace and blessings of the Children with you.
You do not have enough money. If you donate all you can, we will heal you. Is this acceptable?
If you donate all you can, we will heal you. Is this acceptable?
You have more than enough to make the donation. You need schooling in math, my child.
We are the Children of the Cathedral. We live and work amongst those unfortunates living in the wasteland. If you ever get to the Boneyard, stop by the cathedral.
We are the healers and teachers of peace. We heal the body to heal the spirit. All we ask is a small donation to pay for our healing supplies.
We did not ask you. I can tell you are tired of listening to our beliefs. If you need anything else, we will be here.
