It is the most holy of ideas. We are working towards ultimate peace in the wasteland. All creatures shall live as one.
They donated this house to us, in order that we might spread the word and perform our duty as healers.
Whatever that heathen soul feels is no concern of the Children. We are here to do our duty, and it shall be done.
Why are you doing this? We will do you no harm!
You do not have any condition that needs assistance.

voice_info.appearance: You see Jennifer.
sample_lines: Good day, Initiate. How may I help you?
Maxson, the High Elder, can be found on the Fourth Floor. If you take the other elevator down to level four, he should be either in the Council Room or the Elders's rooms.
You can ask one of the guards on that level; they should know where he is at the moment.

npc_lines.text: Good day, Initiate. How may I help you?
Maxson, the High Elder, can be found on the Fourth Floor. If you take the other elevator down to level four, he should be either in the Council Room or the Elders's rooms.
You can ask one of the guards on that level; they should know where he is at the moment.
You should talk to Talus. He might be able to help you, or at least tell you who to talk to.
During the day, Talus is normally supervising in the training hall. Do you know where that is?
The training hall is right around the corner. Just go down this corridor, make a left, go through the door at the end of the corridor and it will be through the door on your right.
Excuse me? Is there something wrong?
I'm sorry, I don't think I can help you. You should go see the doctor. She's on the second level.
Of course there are. Two of our five Elders are women, our master scribe is a woman, and we have many other women in all the different ranks.
The women of the Brotherhood are also called Brothers. We don't call the women Sisters. This is the Brotherhood of Steel, after all, not the Brother and Sisterhood of Steel.
I do not know. That has been our name all of my life. I'm sure there is a reason for it.
That is strange. I've never really put much thought into it. We've been the Brotherhood of Steel all of my life. Our ancestors must have had a reason for naming it so.
So, is there anything else I can help you with?
No, we're very strict when it comes to tradition. I don't think it could ever be changed. It doesn't bother me at all to be addressed as a Brother. That is curious, though.
I think I'll have a talk with Vree. She might be able to give some insight as to why our ancestors decided to call us the Brotherhood of Steel.
Vree's the Master Scribe. She is the one you should talk to if you have any technical questions, but don't disturb her during her meditations at night.
She almost always stays in her room, which is also occupied by the mainframe on the third floor.
Hole? How dare you talk like that about the Brotherhood. You are a member of our order now, and should be proud to be a member of the Brotherhood of Steel.
Well, I guess we all do sometimes.
Maxson, the High Elder. He's on the fourth floor.
Well, you are cute . . . but I don't think so. I don't think it would be a good idea to get involved with an outsider, anyways. You are cute, though, and somewhat attractive.
I don't know if it's because you're an outsider or because of your extreme . . . lack of tact? So, 'honey', is there anything else I can do for you?
That's . . . pretty funny. You are joking, I hope? Actually . . . don't answer that. I don't think I want to know.
I'm sorry. It's just that you outsiders have such a strange way of talking to people sometimes. Is there anything I can help you with?
Are you for real? I haven't heard such a pitiful line in all my life!
Well, yes, you are a member of the Brotherhood, but the Elders have put a hold on all training of new Initiates.

There are rumors about some kind of army. I think the Elders want to concentrate their resources on the ones that are already far enough along in their training to make a difference if we do have a big battle on our hands.
We strongly believe that training a few fighters extremely well is better than giving mediocre training to a bunch of fighters. Saving lives is one of our primary objectives.
You could probably get quite a bit out of the training just by watching. Brother Thomas is the best trainer we have ever had at the Brotherhood.
Well, I'm only repeating what I was told. If you talk to Thomas or Talus they might be able to make an exception.

voice_info.appearance: You see Jeremiah, a messenger for the Children.
sample_lines: Excuse me, brother. You startled me. How may I serve the Master?
Ah, yes, a super mutant in training. I will return to my tasks.
If you do not know, it is none of your concern. If you are inquiring about something you should not know, then I will have to report you to our supervisors. You should know better.

npc_lines.text: Excuse me, brother. You startled me. How may I serve the Master?
Ah, yes, a super mutant in training. I will return to my tasks.
If you do not know, it is none of your concern. If you are inquiring about something you should not know, then I will have to report you to our supervisors. You should know better.
Transferring the reports, of course.
Very well, then. Peace be with you.
I apologize. How may I be of service?
Guards!!!
It is obvious you do not belong here. Who are you?
I transfer the human purity reports for the surrounding areas. But you should know this. [looking suspicious] Who are you?
That's rather odd... I've never heard of you.
Please forgive me. I apologize for questioning you. Please carry on about your business, and if I can be of any service let me know.
I do not know who you are, and you do not belong here. Guards!!!
Who are you and what are you doing down here?
You are not allowed in this area. Only Servitors and higher allowed down here. Return to the Cathedral proper.
Morpheus would not send a slag like you on such a mission. Guards!!
You idiot! You are not allowed in this area. Return to the Cathedral proper at once!
I transfer records for the Master. That is all you need to know, my child. Now, you must leave.
How did you get in here?! What are you doing sneaking around?
No, you may not ask me any questions. Now leave.
Stop! You have no business being here!
No, I have not seen anyone. What did he look like?
Um... I... I... You don't actually think it's m... me?  How ridiculous. I've never!
Yes, my brother. How may I be of service?
Yes, my sister. How may I be of service?
I transfer the human purity reports for the surrounding areas.

Why, yes. I am the one who brings the Master the news of new, untainted humans untouched by radiation. I was the one who brought the Master the final news of a possible Lost Vault. It may still have pure-straing humans in it.
You act very strangely. I do not believe that you are who you say you are. Guards!
You ask too many questions.  I do not believe that you are who you say you are. Guards!
You ask too many questions. Who are you?
Excuse me, sister. You startled me. How may I serve the Master?

voice_info.appearance: You see a traveller.
sample_lines: What do you want, stranger?
I'm a scout.
I'm on the watch for raiders and monsters.

npc_lines.text: What do you want, stranger?
I'm a scout.
I'm on the watch for raiders and monsters.
That would be Junktown. It's not far from here.

voice_info.appearance: You see a caravan driver.
sample_lines: Yes? How can I be of service?
This is the Hub.  It is a trade center for the wastes.  Its the biggest city I know of, you can find just about any thing you could want here.  And if you're lookin for work this is the place to be.
[Laughs] Yes. I guess you could say that.  After a while they all start to look the same.  But believe me theyre not.

npc_lines.text: Yes? How can I be of service?

This is the Hub.  It is a trade center for the wastes.  Its the biggest city I know of, you can find just about any thing you could want here.  And if you're lookin for work this is the place to be. It seems like just about everyone here is lookin ta hire you for somethin be it legal or not.
[Laughs] Yes. I guess you could say that.  After a while they all start to look the same.  But believe me theyre not.
Youre an idiot.  Get outta here you skag.
A Water Chip? I never even heard of one of those.
These are the caravans that Im guarding.  The merchants cart goods to just about all corners of the wastes, Junktown, The Brotherhood, Shady Sands, and numerous other places.
Well...Lots of stuff. General stuff people need to live, Food, Water, lots of Water.  Since water probably is the most scarcest commodity in the wastes.
You could just about ask any one here in the Hub.  Or you can check one of the job bulletin boards there are a few of them around the Hub.
Im a security guard hired by the Merchants who own the goods in these carts.  Dangerous job, but it pays well.  Just the other night one of my coworkers was killed while watching over the Caravans.

voice_info.appearance: What do you want?
sample_lines: What do you want?
I might . . . Have you ever dealt with a vicious murdering band of thieves before?
Uh . . . You've dealt with gangs before ?

npc_lines.text: What do you want?
I might . . . Have you ever dealt with a vicious murdering band of thieves before?
Uh . . . You've dealt with gangs before ?

Good, then you know how ruthless and bloodthirsty they can be. The Blades are the worst of them all, I'm afraid. We're a humble, god fearing town that is only trying to survive, and these . . . these . . . monsters . . . prey on us . . . [He whispers under his breath] and our children . . .

Well, the Regulators keep them from attacking us outright, but it's all they can do to keep our little community safe. They try to sneak in at night to kill our citizens, or to, to kidnap our children . . . and . . . [He stops a moment to compose himself before continuing] Just last week one of them burst through the north gate in the middle of the night with dynamite strapped to his body to blow up the Regulator's barracks . . . no doubt to weaken us enough so that they could launch a full scale attack.
Luckily, the Regulators killed him before he could complete his plan. I saw his body myself.
I'll give you 2000 caps to kill their leader! I want that bitch's head!
They'll fall apart without her . . . her . . . vile influence.
She had my son kidnapped, tortured and killed. They left him impaled on a post right outside the gates.
Thank the gods. Finally, my son shall be avenged. The Blades camp is to the north of here. Come back when you've done the job.
It was the middle of the night, as I told you. I was asleep. Luckily, the Regulators usually catch these barbarians before they even make it inside our town.
Get out of here then! If you won't help Adytum, Adytum has no need for you!
I have no time for idiots. Get out of here.
I might just ignore that remark if you've come here to solve my problem for me.
Have you ever dealt with a vicious, murdering band of thieves before?
What would be convenient would be to put an end to their foulness once and for all!
What?! You again? What do you want now?
[He looks at you warily.] . . . The Blades camp is to the north of here. Come back when you've done the job, and I'll pay you 2000 caps.
Why haven't you taken care of it yet?
Well, work faster. Don't bother me again until you've ended her miserable life!
Have you done it?! Is she dead? Is she dead?
Thank the gods!!! Here's your money. You'll always be welcome in Adytum, my son.
Finally she knows the taste of hell fire! Bless you, my son. [He wipes away a tear]. Here's an extra 500 caps for putting in the extra effort. You'll always be welcome here.
Have you done it?!? Is she dead? Is she dead?
I've had enough of your impudence! Is she dead or not?!
[As he listens to the holodisk he begins to shake and turn red. You think he might drop dead on the spot from sheer hate.] I'll kill all of you fucking bastards!
Yeah, what do you want?

voice_info.appearance: You see the haggard shape of Bob.
sample_lines: Please don't kill me! I swear I'll get you your money.!
Ack! You must be Dumb Fred, Merciless Killer of the Dirt. Please don't kill me!
Here. Here. Take this. It's all I have.

npc_lines.text: Please don't kill me! I swear I'll get you your money.!
Ack! You must be Dumb Fred, Merciless Killer of the Dirt. Please don't kill me!
Here. Here. Take this. It's all I have.
You mean you're not here to kill me?
Geez, I thought you were from the Casino. Sure as sand in the desert, I owe them a lot of money.
They cheat. I played a little slots and some poker. But I'm a better player than that. I swear those machines are rigged. I lost a lot of money.
Some goons. They say they work for the Casino Boss, but I never saw him. One was called Izo, I think, and the other was some big Guido looking guy. Damn cheaters.

Oh, not too much. A couple thousand. I only played for four or five hours. Well, maybe a little longer. They gave me some markers, and I don't have enough here to cover it. I gotta get back to the Hub and get some cash. I'm afraid they'll beat me up if I try to leave.
Hey, what are you doing in my room? Are you from the Casino?
Oh gosh. I thought you were from the Casino. You scared me.
Well, I got into some trouble there. I owe them a lot of money.
Oh, it's you again. You scared me for a moment. You haven't seen anyone from the Casino around here, have you?
Good, good. I just need a couple more days, and I'll make their money back and much more. I'm a better gambler than they think.
Ack! Ohmygawd! I'm in trouble! Bye.
Go ahead, shoot. Oh, bad choice of words, Bob. Bad choice of words.

voice_info.appearance: He looks like an experienced guardsman.
sample_lines: You'd better put that away. Junktown is a friendly place, friend, and we want to keep it that way.
Your weapon, idiot. Killian won't take your arms away, but you'd better damn well keep them in your holster.

You'd better behave, since it's the law, and I enforce the law. Put your weapon away, don't draw it unless in self-defense, and you won't have a problem with us guards. Disobey the law, and we will re

jtgengrd.description: Human male dressed in protective leather clothing

npc_lines.text: You'd better put that away. Junktown is a friendly place, friend, and we want to keep it that way.
Your weapon, idiot. Killian won't take your arms away, but you'd better damn well keep them in your holster.

You'd better behave, since it's the law, and I enforce the law. Put your weapon away, don't draw it unless in self-defense, and you won't have a problem with us guards. Disobey the law, and we will return you to the lawless wasteland - dead or alive.
Well, uh, fine with me. But you'd better be careful.

Good you asked. No weapons can be drawn except in self-defense. If you start a fight, it's your fault. Other than that, it's your right to go around armed. Just don't pull a knife or gun without just cause. Have a good day.
Hey you, no weapons! And I don't care if your momma dropped you on your head as a kid. No weapons.
Hey! You! What are you doing sneaking around?
Whatever you're doing, don't do it in this town.
Well, uh, ok. Whatever. Just don't do anything out of line.

voice_info.appearance: You see a raider who seems crazed.
sample_lines: That's it! Don't come any closer. I'll off her. I swear.
What? You just want to kill me, don't you? Just remember, this is your fault.
Any why not? She's just a whore.

npc_lines.text: That's it! Don't come any closer. I'll off her. I swear.
What? You just want to kill me, don't you? Just remember, this is your fault.
Any why not? She's just a whore.
No. No way. Not this bitch.
What world do you live in? Out here in the real world, blood flows, man. Blood flows, and it's gonna spill all over this room if you don't get out of here.
Geez, that's funny. Who says I want help?
I gotta think about this. Give me a moment.
Yeah. Don't try anything, or she gets it.
Oh, big man. Let's see you try. But first . . .
Oh, big woman. Let's see you try. But first . . .
Stay back . . . I don't want to hurt her, but I will.
Try it, and she dies first. Now, what were you saying?
What hole?
I'll keep talking as long as you do, but try anything tricky, and she'll take the fall.
I don't have to do anything. You got to do it, and you ain't doing so hot.
She laughed at me. They all laughed at me. I'll make 'em pay, I swear.
Maybe. I dunno.
You sound like an all right kind of guy. No one ever wanted to help me before. I think we can talk some more.
You sound like an all right kind of gal. No one ever wanted to help me before. I think we can talk some more.
Just leave me alone. I hate you! You are the devil. I won't listen to you.
There you go again, threatening me. Die!!
I won't listen to you. You're just going to trick me with your words. I don't believe you. Go away.
You might have a point. Prove it to me.
Where do we go from here?
I want some money, and I want to get out of here peacefully. No one follows me.
You lied to me!
Ok. I want $100. Then we walk out of here. No one follows me, and I'll let her go when we get to the edge of town.
Then I guess she gets it.
That's ok, I guess.
I don't like it. What stops you from just shooting me in the back when I walk out of here?
No way! I don't trust you!
All right. We'll see what happens, won't we.
I want my money. I want $200.
You seem like a liar and a cheat to me.
No! Don't tell me what to do! You can't tell me what to do!
Yeah, I'm gonna show you.

voice_info.appearance: You see Julianna.
sample_lines: Hello.
I'm Julianna.
I do what Caleb asks. But I am really only able to do a little farming. I don't have the skills to help Smitty or Miles out.

npc_lines.text: Hello.
I'm Julianna.
I do what Caleb asks. But I am really only able to do a little farming. I don't have the skills to help Smitty or Miles out.
We survive, and the Regulators make sure that nothing happens to hurt us. Mostly by not letting us out of here.
Well, Miles does chemistry, and he makes bullets and things. Smitty is a craftsman who builds things like pots and knives.
You have a message from Romero? What is it?
No . . . it can't be true . . . I . . .
Did he do nothing else?
How romantic! Oh, I must see him somehow! If only . . . perhaps . . . maybe Lorraine can bring him a message . . .
Oh! Thank you so much for your help! We have decided to live here now, with the Followers, in peace. Thank you for supporting our love.

voice_info.appearance: You see Sheriff Justin Greene.
sample_lines: Awe, it's the slayer of the innocents. I've heard of you, and you're lucky I have a badge stopping me from blowing you away on the spot. I suggest you leave our town--Right now. And stay away from our
Hello sir! The name's Justin Greene. I'm the sheriff of this fine city. Is there something I can do for you this fine day?
Hello ma'am! The name's Justin Greene. I'm the sheriff of this fine city. Is there something I can do for you this fine day?

npc_lines.text: Awe, it's the slayer of the innocents. I've heard of you, and you're lucky I have a badge stopping me from blowing you away on the spot. I suggest you leave our town--Right now. And stay away from our children.
Hello sir! The name's Justin Greene. I'm the sheriff of this fine city. Is there something I can do for you this fine day?
Hello ma'am! The name's Justin Greene. I'm the sheriff of this fine city. Is there something I can do for you this fine day?
Well, spit it out!
Well, thank you. We try our best. It's really tough in a city this size, but we do the best we can with what we've got. It's hard when the thugs have better firepower than you do.
Thanks again.
We couldn't have that. But, if you ever change your mind, please let me know. It's a dangerous place out there and someone has to stand up for what's right.

Excellent! I had already heard from other sources about his plan. You're the final confirmation I needed to take action against him. This is going to be rough, and I can use any help I can get. I can pay you 1300 scripts. 300 now, and the rest when we're all done. What do you say?

You're too late...Damn! I knew he was responsible, I only wish I knew in time to stop him. In any case, you're the final witness I needed to act. We'll have to "take him out." This is going to be rough, and I can use any help I can get. I can pay you 1300 scripts. 300 now, and the rest when we're all done. What do you say?
You're too late...How do I know you're not responsible? Decker's not likely to let someone know about his plans and live.
I just got word that she's already dead...wait a minute. How do I know that you're not the one responsible? Decker's not likely to let someone know about his plans and live.

No way. You seem trustworthy, but I can't be sure that you won't leave us when it gets hot. This way, one of us has to survive to be sure you get paid. This way, it might add a 'little' bit of insurance.
Great! Here's the first part of your payment.  [The Sheriff hands you 300 caps]
I'm really sorry to hear that. If you change your mind, let me know, but I can't wait very long.
Great!  Here's the first part of your payment.  [The Sheriff gives you 300 caps]
What? Do you expect me to stand around and let him kill innocent people? I've a responsibility to this city, which I don't expect you to understand.

I'm sorry. Decker's been playing us all against each other for years. I don't know who to trust any more. I really could use your help, though. It'll be rough, but I'll pay you 1300 scripts. 300 now and 1000 when we're done.
I know a rat when I smell one! You're lucky I don't have any proof, and I suggest you leave town before I find some.

That's very strange. I've never heard of Decker coming out of his office. He must be getting braver. That damn, murdering...argh! I'll get him yet! I'll tell you what, you help us out, and I'll pay you 1300 scripts-- 300 now and 1000 when we're all done. What do you say?

That's the biggest pile of Brahmin shit I've ever heard. Decker never leaves his office. I knew there was something not right about you. You're lucky I don't have any proof, and I suggest you leave town before I find some!
Okay, let's go...
Ready to go take out Decker?
I can't believe Decker's finally dead. I never thought I'd see the day.
Have you changed your mind? We could still use you to get rid of that disease we talked about.
We're watching you.
Hello again, sir. What can I do for you today?
Hello again, ma'am. What can I do for you today?
Hello. How can I help you?
Yes?
Just sleep if off, okay?
You're kidding!  Well... uh... did... did he ask you personally?

Man, that was one hell of a battle!  You did well in there.  Now that Decker and Kane are gone the rest of the Underground will fall very shortly.  Without leadership, organizations like that can't last.  Nobody around here is smart enough to take up the reigns.
Well, here's the rest of your reward.  Thanks again for your help.  This city owes you a debt of gratitidue.  [The Sheriff hands you 1000 caps]
We can leave as soon as you're ready.
Let me know when you're ready. We'll wait for you, but don't take too long.

voice_info.appearance: You see Kane.
sample_lines: I guess the reports must have been wrong, beat it.  We don't hire skags.
It's not skag work. You'll need to do 'it' quick and clean.  The boss'll give you details, but it's more money than you'll make in a month working for the caravans, but only if you're good enough. We
I'm sure you're familiar with our sort of business, so let me just say it would be in your best interest to keep this to yourself.  Shall we?

npc_lines.text: I guess the reports must have been wrong, beat it.  We don't hire skags.

It's not skag work. You'll need to do 'it' quick and clean.  The boss'll give you details, but it's more money than you'll make in a month working for the caravans, but only if you're good enough. We don't take kindly to failures, if you know what I mean.
I'm sure you're familiar with our sort of business, so let me just say it would be in your best interest to keep this to yourself.  Shall we?
I hope for your sake that that was an attempt at humor.  Do not cross us, you will regret it.
I don't think you understood me. Let me clarify.  If you don't watch your manners, you will find yourself dead, tough guy.
I don't think you understood me. Let me clarify. If you don't watch your manners, you will find yourself dead, tough gal.
Oh, please do.  We'll be holding our breath.
But of course, good day.
Don't need the money?  Surely you're jesting, but from what I've heard about you, you might enjoy the work I had in mind for you.
It's... Would you like to accompany me down stairs?  There are too many ears around.
I've heard of you.  They say you're one mean son of a bitch.  If you're looking for some work, I might be able to set you up with someone.  Are you interested?
I've heard of you.  They say you're one mean bitch.  If you're looking for some work, I might be able to set you up with someone.  Are you interested?
I've heard of you.  You're the one that took out Killian in Junktown, nice going.  Gizmo must have paid you well for that one. What brings you to the Hub, looking for some work?
I've heard of you.  You're the one that took out Gizmo over in Junktown.  Killian must have paid you a good sum for that job.  Are you here for some work, maybe?
I've heard of you.  You're the bitch that took out Killian and Gizmo.  Now that's the way to solve a problem... So, what brings you to the Maltese Falcon?  Looking for some work?
I've heard of you.  You're the bastard that took out Killian and Gizmo.  Now that's the way to solve a problem... So, what brings you to the Maltese Falcon?  Looking for some work?
I've heard of you.  You're making quite a name for yourself. What brings you to the Hub?
A water chip?  Never heard of it, we only sell drinks.  Go see Bob's Iguana Bits, if you're hungry.
Do I look like a merchant? Stop wasting my time.
You might want to check with the Water Merchants.  They're south of the Merchant Market.  You can't miss them.  They surround a big water tower.
Cleansing? That's quite nice of you, but 'evil' is very subjective. What or who you might consider to be evil could very well be the opposite to someone else.
I certainly hope so.  We have enough problems in the world without having a blind fanatic running around killing everyone.
A pity.  A blind fanatic is a dangerous person indeed.  I hope your stay here in the Hub is not long. We don't take kindly to murders that aren't auth... to murders of any sort.  Good day.
No.
Moron? Do you have any idea who you are talking to? For your sake I hope not. I don't 'run' the Maltese Falcon but I AM the one in charge. What do you want before I lose my temper.
We'll see. Have 'nice' day.
If you don't know, you shouldn't ask.  It can be bad for your health.
In regards to what?
Don't push your luck, buddy, or you'll meet Decker in a bag.  This way, and watch yourself.  I'll be watching.
Don't push your luck, lady, or you'll meet Decker in a bag. This way, and watch yourself. I'll be watching
I think it 'does' concern me and I don't think I'll be showing you anything... that's if you're lucky. Now get lost.
Sorry, but anything you have to tell Decker can be told to me.  I'm his right hand man and there's nothing that goes on here that we both aren't fully aware of.
Well, then you're not going to see him.
Who sent you?
Beth who?
Get out of my face.  I don't have time for your games.
Then you'll see no one.
Tell our friendly Sheriff Greene that Decker's schedule is looking a bit busy and that he should try back in a few months.  I'm sorry, but I think you should leave... for good.
I don't think she sent you here.  Please leave.
Did he now?  Are they ready to come under our protection?  Are you one of them?
Are you?  Well you came to the wrong place then, the Hub is anything but honest.  Go back to whatever hole you crawled out of.  You'll be happier there.
I agree.  Well then, follow me and we'll see how useful you are to us.  Just keep in mind that it would be in your best interest to keep anything that is said to you to yourself.
That might be.  Are you a member of their 'Thieves Circle?'
Well, I'm sorry, but we don't work with your little friends.  We barely tolerate their existence and we would never work with them.
Well then.  You might be useful after all.  Just keep in mind that it would be in your best interest to keep anything that is said to you, to yourself
He might. What kind of work were you looking for?
Why don't you try the merchants.  I hear they pay reasonably well.
No, I think we're fine.  Have a nice day.

Now, that's what I like to hear.  I think we might be friends after all.  Let me show you down. Just keep in mind that it would be in your best interest to keep anything that is said to you, to yourself
Good.  Follow me, but keep in mind that it would be in your best interest to keep anything that is said to you, to yourself.
Sure he did, goodbye... Oh, and by the way.  Don't ever lie to me again, I don't like it when people lie to me. Not many people live to hear this advise.
A man of action. I like that, even if you are screwed up in the head.
A woman of action. I like that. Even if you are screwed up in the head.
Yeah, what do you want?  It better be good.
I understand that you are responsible for the death of a merchant and his wife. I don't know what quarrels you had with them and I don't care.
That is not what you should be concerned about. No one makes a hit one anyone without our okay. I think it would be best if you left our city, while you still can.
I'm afraid you do and if you know what's best for you, you should leave this city while you still can.
I didn't think you wanted the job.  I hope it was just a misunderstanding. I'll pay you half, and be grateful that I'm giving you anything. [Kane gives you 1500 hubbucks]
We'll see.  Downstairs, Decker wants to talk to you.
You will get nothing.
I don't know what game you're playing but if you know what's best for you, you should leave this city while you still can.
You said you didn't want the job.  I'm surprised you came back here.  You made a bad mistake to do it on your own.  I suggest you get out of town while you still can.

I understand that you are responsible for the death of Jain, the High Priestess. I don't know what quarrels you had with her and I don't care, but we're very grateful nevertheless. (Kane gives you 1000 hubbucks)
That is none of your concern and I'm afraid we can not deal with you.  You've violated our laws but because of the problem you eliminated for us we will not kill you, but I think you should leave.
I'm afraid you do, lying can be a very unhealthy habit.  You've violated our laws but because of the problem you eliminated for us we will not kill you, but I think you should leave.
I don't know what game you're playing, but I'm not amused. You've violated our laws but because of the problem you eliminated for us we will not kill you, but I think you should leave.

The merchant and his wife live over to the west from here.  They're on the corner of Barter Street and Thunder Ave. in the Heights, he'll probably have guards. Try to be quiet about it and be sure you aren't seen, but if anyone does happen to see you make sure they don't live to tell anyone about it.  Once you've finished your little errand come back here. One more thing.  Don't even think about going to the police, that's the worst mistake you could ever make. If you can, try not attract their attention when doing your work, they can be quite a pain sometimes. [Kane gives you 500 caps]
Good work.  Here're your scripts for the completion of the first job. [Kane hands you 2500 hubbucks].

Nice work on the merchant.  I'm expecting the same results on your next job.  Here's your last payment for the first job and the first payment for the second. (Kane hands you 3500 Hubbucks). I'm sure you already know, but the Children of the Cathedral are down south just north of the water merchants. Again, no 'live' witnesses.
Were you in a hurry to get out of here?  You didn't get your scripts.  Here's your money, initial payment and the completion bonus for the first job. (Kane hands you 3000 Hubbucks)
Hey, good work!  You forgot to pick up your initial payment for the job, so here it is with the completion fee.  You've proven yourself to be quite useful.
(Kane hands you 5000 hubbucks)
Here's your starting pay. (Kane hands you 1000 Hubbucks) I'm sure you already know, but the Children of the Cathedral are south, just north of the water merchants.  Again, no 'live' witnesses.
Damn, this is a lot of cash.  Decker really wanted that bitch dead, here're your scripts. (Kane gives you 4000 Hubbucks) You've proven yourself to be quite useful.
What the hell do you want?  I thought you didn't want to meet with Decker.
We don't hire skags.  Now leave before I become annoyed with you.
That depends on the message.
Are you now?  That should prove to be quite amusing.
You're an idiot.
What are you some kind of freak?  Get the hell out of here!
Oh, I'll be sure to tell him.  I'm sure he will be very interested to hear that...  praying did you say? You have my 'word', he'll get the message.
I thought I told you to get lost! My patience is wearing thin!  Are you going to tell me why you wanted to see Decker or not?
When you're off the chems come and see me.
I'll let you see him, but you better watch your mouth... after you?
No you don't.  Goodbye.
That's a secret you'll be taking to the grave.  Decker will never talk to a skag like you.
Then I suggest you leave.
Yes?
You can want all you like, now take a hike.
Hello again.
Why isn't 'it' done yet.  You better get it done.  I don't want to see you again until you have some good news, otherwise we'll have a problem.  You better not disappoint us.
Well... are you going to do the job or not?  They're right over here (Kane points again at your PIPBoy town map display.)  You better hurry up, the boss is expecting this to be done soon.
WHAT THE HELL... (Kane looks around then whispers.)  What the hell are you doing here?  You better finish the other one off, and there better not be 'any' witnesses.
You haven't finished your little job. (whispering) You know what's at stake here. You do it and you get rich and we're all happy.  Fail and no one's going to be happy.
You won't? Now that's a shame.  We can't have people giving their word and then breaking it. I'm sorry we couldn't work together.  Have a 'nice' day.
Oh, I'll have it.  Don't worry.
(Kane gives you a deadly look.) Well then... I'll try to get you in to see him sometime soon.  I'll be sure to show you to him 'piece' by 'piece'.
I'm sorry you feel that way.  I hope you 'enjoy' the rest of your stay here in our wonderful city.
(Kane stares at you for a few seconds) All right.  I'll give you one last chance to see him.  Follow me.
(Kane stares at you for a few seconds) You missed your chance.  Beat it.
What the hell are you doing back here?!?!  You must be an even bigger idiot than I thought.  I knew Decker shouldn't have hired an unknown.

[Kane lowers his voice]  You cocked up the mission, you moron!  You were supposed to kill both of the Hightowers, not wound them for Christ sake!  The second you left the Heights they ran off with their guards.  Believe me, they didn't waste time packing either.  God knows where they are now!
Sorry doesn't cut it.  You've put Decker at an unacceptable risk.  You can consider yourself an enemy of the Underground from now on.  I don't ever want to see your face in here again.

voice_info.appearance: You see a slender young woman with a smudged face and dark clothing.
sample_lines: You're not from around here. Who're you?
And what, may I ask, are you doing in the Boneyards?
You learn to be careful out here. So what are you doing here?

npc_lines.text: You're not from around here. Who're you?
And what, may I ask, are you doing in the Boneyards?
You learn to be careful out here. So what are you doing here?
All right, fair enough. I'm called Katja. What's it matter to you?
You might, but you're on my home turf, not vice-versa. So put up or shut up.
A water purification chip? Sorry, don't know anything about that. Don't see much of that kind of tech here in the Boneyards, except maybe the stuff Miles works on.
Just a traveler. I've heard that one before. Nobody comes to the Boneyard except those Hub merchants and people looking for a quick death at the hands of the gangs. What are you really here for?
Damn straight. But that's a two-way street.
Maybe. You definitely aren't one of those gangland shiv-shovers. What do you want?
Miles lives in Adytum. He's a scientist, mostly working with chemistry. If anyone could scrounge up a water chip or make a replacement, it would be him.

Adytum is my original home. A little too boring for me, though. It's a fenced-off and self-sufficient town in the south end of the Boneyard, but not as far as the Cathedral. We trade sometimes with the Hub.
I've dealt with them before. They're not too bad, as far as gangs go. They have a hide-out in an old club, with some outposts. If you're careful you might even be able to get some of them to talk.

The Rippers are just plain ferocious. They're an inbred bunch that delights in torture and murder. I stay away from them, and you should, too. They actually put fuckin' land mines around their fortress.

The Gun Runners used to be a real gang, but they went soft. They started setting up a deal where they trade weapons that they get from their victims or buy from the Hub. Since nobody here is up for the trip to the Hub personally, they do pretty good business, even though their prices are high.

The Followers of the Apocalypse are a group of peace-preachers who live in a large library near the heart of the Boneyard. Why they haven't been wiped out yet I can't say. They are lousy combatants and have no understanding of the real world, but other than that they are polite and well-educated.

The Boneyard is a pretty hostile place. I've never had the opportunity to leave, though I suppose I'd take it. Let's see . . . just south of here you have the Cathedral. There's some sort of cult there, but I stay away from them. Something sinister is going on there. Also, I've heard about the trading center called the Hub, and caravans occasionally show up, but I've never been there.
No kidding. If you're looking for another hand, I'll sign on. Better than spending the rest of my existence in this hellhole, right?
This area's overrun with the three gangs - the Blades, Rippers, and Gun Runners - as well as serving as home for the Followers and for my own home, Adytum.
All right, looks like we've got a little ass-kicking to do!

Look, 90% of the people in this city fall into one or more of three categories - rapists, murderers, or thieves. I'm a thief and you actually seem polite, so that makes me wonder, okay? Call it a survival instinct.
Okay, but make it quick.
Huh. Guess I can't argue with that logic. So waddya want?
What distance do you want me at?
What's up?
You again? What're you back for now?
I learned how to be a scrapper from my time in the Boneyard. I'm good with knives and submachine guns. My favorite is throwing knives, of course.
All right, although I don't feel right without a good knife.
What do you want now?
I'm sorry but I just don't understand you.  Good bye.

voice_info.appearance: You see Deputy Kenny.
sample_lines: There you are.  I've been waiting for you to return.  We heard the Sheriff was killed during the battle.  It's hard to believe he's really gone.  He was like a father to me.

The Sheriff gave me instructions to carry out in the event that he did not return from the mission.  He asked me to give you the remainder of your reward.  I believe it was 1000 caps.  [The Deputy han
This city owes you a debt of thanks.  I only wish the Sheriff could be here to thank you himself.  Goodbye.

npc_lines.text: There you are.  I've been waiting for you to return.  We heard the Sheriff was killed during the battle.  It's hard to believe he's really gone.  He was like a father to me.

The Sheriff gave me instructions to carry out in the event that he did not return from the mission.  He asked me to give you the remainder of your reward.  I believe it was 1000 caps.  [The Deputy hands you 1000 caps]
This city owes you a debt of thanks.  I only wish the Sheriff could be here to thank you himself.  Goodbye.

voice_info.appearance: You see Keri.
sample_lines: So, that old bastard gave you the okay to work for us, eh?  Well you must be one tough bitch. I'm impressed, but we'll see how you do.  We leave only twice a month, on the 3rd and 17th.  Can you handl

So, that old bastard gave you the okay to work for us, eh?  Well you must have balls of steel. I'm impressed, but we'll see how you do.  We leave only twice a month, on the 3rd and 17th.  Can you hand
I'll still give your sorry ass a job, if you're interested?

npc_lines.text: So, that old bastard gave you the okay to work for us, eh?  Well you must be one tough bitch. I'm impressed, but we'll see how you do.  We leave only twice a month, on the 3rd and 17th.  Can you handle that? We go to all the local hot spots:  the Brotherhood of Steel, Junktown, Necropolis, and the Boneyard.

So, that old bastard gave you the okay to work for us, eh?  Well you must have balls of steel. I'm impressed, but we'll see how you do.  We leave only twice a month, on the 3rd and 17th.  Can you handle that? We go to all the local hot spots:  the Brotherhood of Steel, Junktown, Necropolis, and the Boneyard.
I'll still give your sorry ass a job, if you're interested?

Ha, I thought you were a coward!  Well if you brave'n up, stop by and I might still give you a job. We leave on the 3rd and 17th, you can just show up that day if you like.  We can always use more guns.
Whatever.  If you get the urge for some action come back and I'll hook you up on the next caravan out.
Hey!  I know you can get some good chems here, but I'm not supposed to hire you unless your sober.
Well now I hate to say it but I've heard of you.  Are you as tough in private as in public?  Let's see (She leads you around a corner)
(On the way back she slips you a few things.)
Well, you can last for QUITE a while.
Well, you are' interesting and very' different from most people show me what you've got tough guy. (She leads you around a corner)
Hey Pops, looks like we've got a thief here! What do you have to say for yourself, you scum?
Well I know how easy it is to be tempted to steal, but Hell, I'll give you a chance.  Don't show your face around here again and I won't call the cops.  Now beat it.
Oh we'll make sure of that, won't we Pops?
Intriguing, but you're not my type.
Good. Like I said before we pay 600 scripts. Which route did you want to take?
Lock and load! We're out of this joint!
Let me know if anything cool happens, Dad's making me stay around the warehouse.
Great! The other psychopaths are ready.  We'll leave right away.
Cool, it'll just take a few minutes to get the psychos together.
Brotherhood of Steel, here we come! Well I'm not going with you, but you know what I mean.
Okay, get out of my face already.  Those Brotherhood fanatics are waiting for you.
I hope you like mountains!  You're going right into them.  You should see lots of action there.
Ready to go, and you'll be heading straight though the mountains!  It should be a blast!
Junktown's pretty tame.  I prefer the more dangerous routes.
I hear there's some crazy doctor there, you should check him out.  His name's Doc Morbid.
Junktown's a short trip, you should be back soon.
Watch your ass, Necropolis isn't a very friendly place.
Set's the leader of the town. At least he was the last time I was there.
That town's full of skags!  Well, I better get you going.
LA's pretty cool.  You'll like it, but just be sure not to leave the caravan until it arrives.  It's not to safe, for the caravans that is.
Hope you get a chance to see it, there's also a cool church just a few miles to the south of it. The people are whacked, though.
I'm told the Boneyard used to be a place called LA.  I don't know what the person's initials stand for, but it's a cool place.
You did good on that last job. Are you looking for another one?
Ready to go?  We're leaving today.

voice_info.appearance: You see huge mutant.
sample_lines: You should not be here. This area off limits to Children.
You too stupid to be a Child. You must be intruder!
This prisoner cell block. Here we hold humans until you dip them. Good stuff, huh?

npc_lines.text: You should not be here. This area off limits to Children.
You too stupid to be a Child. You must be intruder!
This prisoner cell block. Here we hold humans until you dip them. Good stuff, huh?
You need to leave.

voice_info.appearance: You see Kyle.
sample_lines: Ahh...So you're the one, huh?
Nothing. It's just that no one has ever made it back from the Ancient Order.
Heh, heh. I guess they just wanted to get rid of ya, huh? Well, the jokes on them.

npc_lines.text: Ahh...So you're the one, huh?
Nothing. It's just that no one has ever made it back from the Ancient Order.
Heh, heh. I guess they just wanted to get rid of ya, huh? Well, the jokes on them.
I fix stuff, run maintenance checks, that sort of crap.
Power armor and anything else that needs fixin'.
I'd give ya this power armor right here, but it's missing it's Systolic Motivator. It's useless without it.
Well, they've got more than enough up in the supply room, but Michael and his damn forms say that this particular suit isn't up to specs. Damn bureaucrats.
You see this eye-piece right here? I had to re-solder it in place, and it don't look as pretty as it needs to for inspection, I guess.
Get the hell out of here, buddy.
Whoa, wait a minute there, fella, that would take a good coupla hours. I'd loan you a manual and my tools, but you'd hafta repair it yourself.
Heh, well, Rhombus has a couple of 'em. I wouldn't ask him for one, though. Only "the Honored" are supposed to wear these here power suits. Besides, I think he has an unnatural attachment to them.
I don't think so. Don't even know what one is.
The moniker's Kyle. I've never met a myth before.
To hear Maxson's stories you'd think it was the ninth level of hell.
Not General Maxson, his grandfather, Roger Maxson. I heard you brought back a disk that told what happened to the guys who rebelled against him and went down there to recover the lost technology.
Yeah, lousy bastards. I can't believe they sent you down there like that.
Hey, initiate, got anything for me?
No shit. And here I thought you was smart. I told ya that guy had official forms for brains.

Wella... I got to give you credit for that. But I think you blew your chances with getting it from the supply room. You'll just have to find another way to get it. Or find yourself Power Armor somewares else.
Hello, were you able to get that part?
Great! Here just let me install this into the unit.
OK you're all set to go. Here take this manual. If you have any kind of aptitude with repairing things you should have no problem. Good Luck.
After all that? Okay, just let me know when you want me to put it in. Then you can get started on repairing it.
Well, I don't know what to tell you. I guess you need to polish up your repair skills a little. I'll keep the unit here for ya.
Hello agin. Can I help you?

voice_info.appearance: You see a weary traveler.
sample_lines: Just stay where you are. We've heard about you in Shady Sands and we want no part of you.
Yeah? What d'ya want this time?
Hello, stranger. What brings you out in the wastes? Where are you from?

npc_lines.text: Just stay where you are. We've heard about you in Shady Sands and we want no part of you.
Yeah? What d'ya want this time?
Hello, stranger. What brings you out in the wastes? Where are you from?
I ain't your friend. And if you make a wrong move, I'll spill your innards. You got that?
Fine. But I'll remember this.
Up yours.
That was then, this is now. What have you done for us lately? I think you better leave before I get ornery.
We like it too. Especially when you're not in it. Now get!
Man, you musta spent too much time in the Glow!
I don't know what a water chip is. Sorry.
The raiders got her. I'm part of one of the search parties. I think she's at the raider camp south of Shady Sands, but the Khans have the place sealed up like a fortress.
Uh, yeah, but we're handling it a little better since the Khans got their bloody nose. I understand we have you to thank for that. We're grateful.
We're doing okay.
I haven't a clue. Idiot.
Okay, I'll trust you. I'm from Shady Sands. We're a community not far from here.
Well, you keep your secrets, I'll keep mine. Good bye.
Maybe it is. A pity, though.
I've been to Junktown. I think it's southwest of here, but I've been traveling for so many days it's hard to tell.
Yeah, right. All the Vaults were destroyed, as far as I know. Tell me another one.
That's not what I was asking . . . oh, never mind!
That's not an answer. They call you assassin, thief, grave-robber. They say you'll kill anyone who gets in your path. Is it true?
They call you assassin, thief, grave-robber. They say you'll kill anyone who gets in your path. Is it true?
Okay, I'll do it. But if you keep acting like a raider, you'll die like a raider.
I'll give you the benefit of the doubt, for now. But a man's only as good as his reputation, and yours could use some work. I hope you'll do something about it before we meet again.
Just heading back to town. You wanna come along? I could use the company.
A little bit of scavenging. We've found a few abandoned raider bases that haven't been picked clean; I suspect they've been attacking each other. We can always use more ammo and chems.
I'm going to regret this.
Get out of my sight before I come to my senses.
We're still seeing a few; they must be migrating from the high desert or the Glow. But it's a lot better now than it was last year, thanks to you.
Sure. Let's go.
Man, I must be out of my mind. But I'll take you. Let's go.
Have a good suicide, friend. And for what it's worth, good luck.
I'm heading out. You take care of yourself.
Well, I don't have much, but what's mine is yours.
Not that I can think of. I'm heading out. You take care of yourself.
We will. I'm heading out. You take care of yourself.
Well, okay. Let's go.
I won't lead a possible enemy home. If you do make your way to Shady Sands, keep your nose clean.
Small. We make our living herding Brahmin. It's pretty rough country around here, and pasture land is rather precious.
In a Brahmin herding backwater? You've gotta be crazy! There's probably not a working piece of electronics within two hundred miles.
You got a point. I think we should play things cautious and go our separate ways. If I were you, I'd do something about those stories. Unless you like people hating and mistrusting you.
I should kill you right now. You cross my path again, and I will. Now get.
Let's go.
Let me guess, someone told you about my snoring. Oh well. You take care of yourself.
It is. Well, I'm heading out. You take care of yourself.
Just you stay where you are. I don't know if you're in league with those mutants, but if you are, I'll kill you.
The mutants overran Shady Sands. Must of use are dead. I guess it's only a matter of time before they get the rest of us.
I don't care what you say, what you ask. We're all dead! All of us! And I thought the raiders and the rad scorpions were bad . . . they were nothing! Ha! Ha ha ha!

voice_info.appearance: You see a heavily muscled, scarred man with a mustache.
sample_lines: Can I help you, stranger?
Hey! You! We know about you, you monster!

Plenty, so long as you stay on our good side. We got Killian Darkwaters' store, where you can do some trading. And there's Gizmo's Casino, if you're a gambler. Or if you just want a drink, you can hea

npc_lines.text: Can I help you, stranger?
Hey! You! We know about you, you monster!

Plenty, so long as you stay on our good side. We got Killian Darkwaters' store, where you can do some trading. And there's Gizmo's Casino, if you're a gambler. Or if you just want a drink, you can head on over to the Skum Pitt. Just don't get too rowdy.

Well, you'd best keep yourself under control. We're a free town but we don't tolerate stepping on other people's toes. Don't cause any problems and you won't give cause for me and my men to come down on you.
Look, buddy, my job here is to keep the peace, and if I have to break a few heads to do it, then a few people are going to be hurting. So just watch it.

Me and my men here work for Killian Darkwater. We keep some order in this town, dealing with all of the murderers, thieves, and other scumbags who come in from the desert. If you want my advice, you'll also stay away from Gizmo. That fathead runs a crooked operation, but we just haven't been able to prove anything. He and his lackeys, the Skulz, are going to take the fall sometime soon, if Killian has anything to say about it.
Hey, it's our job. But it's good to know that someone appreciates it. Thanks.

Got to do it all proper like. We know that Gizmo runs a rigged operation and all, but we need hard evidence to bring him down. Same with the Skulz; they rough someone up, we bring one or two of 'em in, but nothing changes. We just don't have any direct evidence tying them to any of the killings or muggings.

Hell, if you think you can get some dirt on either of them, we'd appreciate the help. Killian's the one to talk to if you want to talk about Gizmo. But if you can get some info on the Skulz, just come back to me and me and the boys will take care of them.
Thanks. Watch your back.
I'm the head of the guards here in Junktown. Name's Lars. For that matter, who are you, stranger?
Good day, traveler. Do you need something?
What?
Yes, I'm in charge of the guards here. What do you have for me?
So, you have some info on the Skulz, eh? What can you tell me?
That's great and all, but I can't just jail them all on one person's say-so. I need hard evidence or inside testimony.
Excellent. I'll pick her up for a few questions, and I'm sure that I'll get all the information that I need to put them away.
Look, this isn't a game. People are getting hurt here. If you find some real evidence, come back, but otherwise, don't waste my time!

If you're not averse to a little skullduggery, I need someone to get some hard evidence on the Skulz, proving that they're involved in illegal activities here. Or you can talk to Killian; he might have some work for you.
Thanks for your assistance. Junktown's a little safer now, because of your help.
Move along there, fella.
You ready to help take down Gizmo?
All right, let's do it.
Well, you'd best wait here so you don't get caught in the crossfire.
What? Hmm. We'll see about that. I'll send some men over to ambush them when they try it. You gonna be there?

Wanderer, you just screwed up. We needed evidence so that we could take down Gizmo all nice and legal-like. Look, off the record, I'm happy to have that fat fuck out of the picture, but we can't condone murder. You better leave Junktown and never come back.
We don't like your kind here. You've got about fifteen seconds before I blow your head off.
Hello again! What can I do for you?

voice_info.appearance: You see a Knight.
sample_lines: Hello Initiate. I'm Larry, how may I help you?
Uh, okay...

Uh, yea. These things are great. It's range is... well, as far as you can see. (Larry continues to talk for what seems like hours, but you seem to pick a few things up about the use of energy weapons.

npc_lines.text: Hello Initiate. I'm Larry, how may I help you?
Uh, okay...

Uh, yea. These things are great. It's range is... well, as far as you can see. (Larry continues to talk for what seems like hours, but you seem to pick a few things up about the use of energy weapons.)

Huh? But she knows these aren't ready yet... Oh, she must have meant show. Yea, I can show you. You see it runs off of energy cells that are constructed out of... (Larry goes on for what seems hours but you seem to pick a few things up about energy weapons.)
Sure she did. I think you should leave outsider.

voice_info.appearance: You see Lasher of the Children.
sample_lines: I know who you are. You are a wicked, evil man and you must be punished.
I know who you are. You are the devil in womans form, but your shape will not save you.

I know who you are. Your wickedness precedes you. You send the souls of children to Hades, before they can be cleansed of their perfidy. It is a black evil that you do, and you must be punished for it

npc_lines.text: I know who you are. You are a wicked, evil man and you must be punished.
I know who you are. You are the devil in womans form, but your shape will not save you.

I know who you are. Your wickedness precedes you. You send the souls of children to Hades, before they can be cleansed of their perfidy. It is a black evil that you do, and you must be punished for it.
I know who you are. You are walking death, a plague in human form. Where you step, blood flows like a river. But such iniquities can be ended by a righteous soul!
How dare you disturb me! Dont you know how important my position is? Get out!
You are unwise to draw your weapon on me. The Masters shield is upon me, and I may not be touched without retribution!
Why have you come, initiate? You know that I do not like to be disturbed.
How dare you enter my sanctuary with a weapon in your hand! Oaf! Get out!
Who do you think you are, entering my sanctum with a drawn weapon. Get out!
My quarters are not open to those who have not been consecrated. I must ask you to leave at once.
That is a privilege reserved for only the most faithful servants. Only baptism is a higher honor.
I see no reason to converse with a fool. Away with you.
You should speak to Father Morpheus. He is in the tower, but it is unlikely that the Nightkin will allow you to pass.
The rod is a holy instrument, through which I instruct my charges. Pain clears the mind of evil thoughts and allows them to better comprehend the glory of the Master.

I instruct the children. It is my duty. All children are wicked beasts. It is my duty to force them into evolve into human beings. Perhaps you have heard that I do not tolerate frivolity. This is true. I want my charges to suffer as much as possible.
You filthy brainless abomination! How dare you defile my presence! Get out! Out! Now!
You are a woman, and therefore you are always troubled. It is an endemic condition of your breed. Tell me your problem, madam, and I will resolve it for you.
If your heart was not so full of wickedness, sir, you would be at ease. A righteous heart knows no cares. Tell me your problem, but be quick!

Learn to embrace pain as your closest friend, for pain is the most instructive force in the universe. Break yourself until you can exist no longer as an individual, then remake yourself into the Masters tool. That is the solution to all of your problems.
Beasts chatter without meaning. Human beings think first, and then they talk. You must evolve into a human being before I will wish to speak you. Be gone.
Your words are true. Very well, I will help you. But be quick.
There comes a time when you must find the answers to lifes questions yourself, and that time is now. Begone!
That is not my duty. Now begone.

I have not consulted him, but I am certain he is pleased with the righteous souls I have brought him. It is difficult work, but I do it well. Unfortunately, it is also quite time consuming, which is why I must order to you to leave right now.
A flatterers tongue is in the mouth of a devil! A devil such as you! Get out of my sight!
You foul mouthed beast! Begone! Learn some manners before you return.
A reasonable request. Take this symbol. Show it to the Nightkin when you wish to pass.
I cannot help you with that. Begone.
He is our leader. He is close to the Masters counsels and knows many of his purposes. Is that all?

They serve the Master. They bring the pain of healing to the world. Angels in the Night, who redeem the world by bloodshed. Curiosity is a foolhardy emotion, but doubly so when it comes to the Nightkin. That is your only warning. I have much to do now. Away with you.
Your courtesy does you credit. Perhaps you are worthy to talk with Morpheus. If the Nightkin stops you, show them this symbol. Now, away with you!
You are a fool if you think petty subterfuge will defeat the Nightkin. Get out of here!

Decadence and ease prevents evolution, evolution that is necessary for survival in a harsh world. Fortunately, I am a hard man who cares nothing for seductive pleasures. I see that you disagree with me. I do not care about your opinion. Get out of here!

Mutation is nothing to fear. Every birth is a mutation of our parents DNA. We are all mutants. The only thing that matters is that the mutant is guided on a moral and productive path. This is my job. And this also ends this discussion. Leave me now.

I deal out pain. If the animal is worthy and can learn from it, it evolves into a righteous soul. If it does not, it does not deserve to exist. On rare occasions, the animal is removed the genetic pool, although not as often as I would like. This happens more often with failed grown animals.
You are an evil girl. You would do well to tread carefully here. The Nightkin do not enjoy rivals. Now begone!
You are an evil man. You would do well to tread carefully here. The Nightkin do not enjoy rivals. Now begone!

Righteousness is attained through struggle, trauma, and recovery. We are animals who must be continuously be broken until we accept the Masters truth without hesitation. Now that you have heard the truth, seek it with the body of your experiences. Get out of here.
Your tongue is a wicked thing that is beyond redemption. Get out of my sight!
The Cathedral teaches many things which an undisciplined mind is incapable of comprehending. Now I have other duties to perform. Away with you!
As do I. It appears we have many things in common, but unfortunately, you irritate me beyond my ability to tolerate. Get out of here. Now.
It is not my place to judge. You must persuade the Nightkin. Good luck. You will need it.
You were not particularly welcome here in the first place. Good riddance to you.

Once I did, but many of methods were abandoned in favor of the loud noises you hear in the Auditorium amphitheater. It is a source of bitterness for me. Fortunately, I can still instruct the children. Now if you will excuse me, I have to prepare for their lessons.
Uh it is of course, a rare event, and the animal is given every chance to evolve. Now leave here! Leave here at once!
This may be of some use to you. Take this symbol. Show it to the Nightkin when you wish to pass. It will allow you to see Father Morpheus.

voice_info.appearance: You see Laura.
sample_lines: Well, as I said . . .
I said . . .
Well, as I said before . . .

npc_lines.text: Well, as I said . . .
I said . . .
Well, as I said before . . .
As I said before . . .
Well, I'm quite certain I told you this already, but . . .
Okay! I already told you this . . .
Ah, once more? Well, I said . . .
Again? I already said this . . .
Oh dear, this is most disturbing. I simply will not say it again.
Are you . . . Okay! Okay! Are you deaf? Read my lips, I'm not gonna to say this again.
I believe that's quite enough. I'll not say it again.
Not listening, huh?  Too bad, I'm not gonna say it again.
Oh, those are dreadful people. I'm not going to talk about them at all!
Nicole probably told you about us. We're trying to knock some sense into those thick-skulled, gun-toting, violence-mongering nitwits . . . Oh, present company excepted, of course.
Well, I don't know who you're talking about.
She leads the Followers. Pretty strong-willed. I trust her.
The others are all so nice! It's wonderful here. We belong, we do good work . . .
Oh, they're like a . . . blight on the world. Most are a waste and a few are just plain evil.
Adytum, isn't that a town west of here?
Adytum's a bit west from here. And the people there . . . well, they're a little paranoid, so don't expect a hospitable welcome.
Oh, he's wonderful. He leads us. You should talk to him!
He preaches peace and enlightenment and all that crap, but he's scum. No two ways about it.
Oh, I can't begin to describe him. Morpheus leads us. He can do justice to your question.
Ah yes, the Master, he's the god these nuts worship. Personally, I don't think he's a god, just somebody into manipulating everyone.
Nightkin? I don't know what you're talking about.
They're the big, ugly enforcers of the Master and Morpheus.
The what?
What, you couldn't figure out that's the Master?
It's the big place at the north end of the church, where Morpheus does all his ceremonies. I've been there, it's wonderful!
It's at the north end of the church. I've watched Morpheus perform his little circus act there.
Oh, you cannot go there. That's where Morpheus contemplates.
That's where Morpheus and his cronies hang out. No one's allowed up there, though.
They have proven themselves to the Church. The rest of us aspire to that.
Oh yeah, these are the guys who've survived torture and who knows what else. Totally brainwashed and will do anything they're told.
They are the high priests.
Ah, those are the high priests. So far I think there's only 13, but I'm not really sure.
That's not important.
That's not important.
I'm sorry. I simply don't have time for this.
We don't have time to talk about that! Just keep to business.
I'm not sure why you want to talk about that.
Keep to the subject at hand, friend.

voice_info.appearance: You see the ghoul leader.
sample_lines: Thank you for not shooting first. Can I help you with anything?
Ahh, if you like you may rest here, we will not harm you.
I am the leader of a simple people who have left the surface because of the others.

npc_lines.text: Thank you for not shooting first. Can I help you with anything?
Ahh, if you like you may rest here, we will not harm you.
I am the leader of a simple people who have left the surface because of the others.
The surface of Necropolis and the water is controlled by Set and his Ghouls. We are a much more peaceful group - which disgusts Set.
Set is a Ghoul like us, but has assumed a certain amount of power in the above ground world. He is an oaf.
He does not speak of it, however Set is afraid of not having enough people to defend Necropolis if it ever needed it. So, he gives us what water we need.
Up until recently we pumped our water from the ground, with a pump in the Watershed.
Since our pump stopped working, we have been getting our water from a place under the ground. I have heard that a water computer is being used to purify the water.
The watershed is to the north. You'll need to take the sewers to get there.
You aren't thinking of taking the Water Chip from us are you?
If you take the Water Chip from us, then we will all die. With our water pump broken we need it to survive.
If that is the case then I can't let you leave my presence alive.
I do not think that I believe you.
That may be difficult. The parts needed to fix the pump were lost in the sewers under the watershed.
The sewers there are filled with monsters, and none of my people that I have sent to retrieve them have come back. Are you willing to retrieve the parts, so that the Water Pump can be fixed?
Thank you. When you get the parts, return here. It is possible that I can help you further.
Have you found the parts for the Water Pump yet?
Well I wish you luck then.
You have returned. Do you have the parts needed to repair the Water Pump?
Well it looks like you may need some help with the parts. Here are some books that we have found littered around. They may help you. Now please take the parts to the water shed and repair the pump.
Unfortunately I will be able to help you no further. Good luck with the Water Pump. Please take the parts to the water shed and repair the pump.
Have you fixed the Water Pump yet?
Yes those are the parts I was talking about. Thank the flow that you already have them.
As I already told you, they can be found in the sewers underneath the Water shed. Go east from here, and then north. You will find the Watershed in that direction.
Well thank you for that service. Was there something else you wanted to know?
It is where all the water is stored and handed out to us.
Lately I have heard rumors that someone has taken over the control of the Watershed. However, our rations are still being delivered for some reason.
Thank you for repairing the Water Pump, and I hope all is well with your people when you return with what you have found.
You have fixed the Water Pump and the flow has returned from the deep. However, I see you have not found what you are looking for.
I have heard that it is located deeply below the Watershed. I wish you luck in searching for it.
I see that you have what you came here to find. You realize that we will die if you take the Water Chip from us.
I am tired of putting up with your snide remarks. I do not wish to speak with you any further.
We once had a pump located in the Watershed that pumped the flow from the deep. However, it was broken and the parts needed to fix it were lost in the sewers directly below the Watershed.

voice_info.appearance: You see a shifty looking character.
sample_lines: So'a, whatcha doin' in the Hub?
Not really sure big fella.  I'll see ya around.
No sweat off my back.  Just seein' if I could be neighborly like. [Lemmy turns away]

npc_lines.text: So'a, whatcha doin' in the Hub?
Not really sure big fella.  I'll see ya around.
No sweat off my back.  Just seein' if I could be neighborly like. [Lemmy turns away]
Well, you look like a businessman.  And I'm a businessman, and I thought we could, ah, discuss, ah, business.
Well, we all got needs.  I might be able to help with some of 'em.  So what sort of needs do you got?
I do a little bit of this, and a little bit of that.  I get things and information for people, whatever they might need or be lookin' for.
Not a problem.  If there's anything else you might be wanting, you come and talk to Lemmy first.

So, you're lookin' for information, huh?  Being a respectable businessman, I gots overhead, so I'll need a few caps to tell you what you need to know.  Now that we got that straight, whattcha' wanna' know about?
So, you think I might know a little more about those Water Chip things, huh?  Well, you might be right.  It's gonna' cost you, though.  I think 500 bottle caps oughta' do it.
Now, now.  I wouldn't be the man I am if I gave information away for less than it's worth.  Come back when you've got the caps.
Trying to intimidate poor old Lemmy, huh?  Well, I's not afraid of the likes of you. I'll just be seein' you around.
[Lemmy takes your money]
Well, that's fair enough.  I'll take that instead.
Ok, Ok, Ok, see I was just kidding about paying for the info.  Good joke, huh?

Well, so here's what I know about the Water Chips.  The thing I've heard is that they all used to come from the Vaults.  So if I was lookin' for one, I'd find out where the rest of these Vaults were. I'm not sure where all the Vaults are exactly, but I've heard that there are about 4 around here somewhere's.
Sure, what else do you want to know about?
Now, normally I don't mind selling information, but you're not gonna' get anything outta' Lemmy about Mr. Decker.
Missing caravans, huh?  Well, I might be knowin' a bit about those.  It's gonna cost you 300 caps, though.
Well, I'm not really that sure, but what I's heard is that it ain't what everybody thinks. Some new guy is getting into the action with some kind of mutants or something.  But don't quote me on that.
Now, you might be insinuating that Lemmy ain't a stand-up guy.  Well, you's right.  But Lemmy is an ALIVE type of guy.

Stuff for needs, huh?  Well, I knows a guy over in Old Town that can probably fix you up with some stuff like that.  But you know what?  He needs to know who you are before you show up at his doorstep.
Exactly.  So I'm thinking... only for you of course... 1000 caps so youse can talks to this guy without him blowing your head off first.
Well, what you gotta' do is find your way over to Old Town.  Over there is a guy named Vance.  Just talk to him.  Like I said, I'll let him know you're coming.
Sorry man, got things to do.  Nice chattin' with you, though.
Well, you've come back to talk to your old firend Lemmy, huh?  What's it I can help you with?
Well, you look like a businesswoman.  And I'm a in business, so I thought we could, ah, discuss, ah, business.

voice_info.appearance: Just because you've got a weapon drawn doesn't mean that I'm gonna give you what you want . . .
sample_lines: I don't know who you are, but I'll give you a fair warning: anyone who messes with the Khans, dies messy.
You are an enemy of the Khans! You attack our warriors and take our women! Give me a reason why I shouldn't cut out your heart!
Are you one of them? One of the mutants?

npc_lines.text: I don't know who you are, but I'll give you a fair warning: anyone who messes with the Khans, dies messy.
You are an enemy of the Khans! You attack our warriors and take our women! Give me a reason why I shouldn't cut out your heart!
Are you one of them? One of the mutants?
Perhaps. If you wish to fight, I'll fight. If you wish to go in peace, you have my word as a Khan that I will not attack.
You are too strong for me, and I am tired by many days in the wastes. I do not wish to die. Though it shames me, I surrender.
I agree. I give my word that you may go in peace, provided that you do not provoke me. Do not trouble me again.
I don't want anything that belongs to a coward, including your life! Get out of my sight!
You stupid animal. I shall enjoy killing you.
I shall enjoy hearing them. Farewell, brother!
Really? Then I must have it for my own!
I am tired and weary from a journey many days longer than I expected. Rad scorpions killed my companions. I long for the comforts of the camp and the healing caress of our women.
They have destroyed Shady Sands. They kill anyone in their path. I never dreamt such ferocity existed. We are all doomed . . .
Murdering dog!
No, but it is hard to tell. I have heard that they cloak themselves in night, that they cloud men's minds, and take the form of beautiful women! We are all doomed!
That is good. I long to avenge our dead, and even the dead of Shady Sands. Any mutant that crosses my path will die! Go forth, friend! Go forth and kill! Death to the mutants!
You will die for those words!

voice_info.appearance: You see Lorenzo.
sample_lines: You're overdue on your loan. Please pay it now or I will become very upset.  I dislike being upset.
Hi. So you've come to pay off your loan?

Well, if it isn't a potential customer! I'm Lorenzo the Munificent, at your service. I give out loans. Only ten percent daily interest, a maximum of ten days to repay. You won't find a more generous l

npc_lines.text: You're overdue on your loan. Please pay it now or I will become very upset.  I dislike being upset.
Hi. So you've come to pay off your loan?

Well, if it isn't a potential customer! I'm Lorenzo the Munificent, at your service. I give out loans. Only ten percent daily interest, a maximum of ten days to repay. You won't find a more generous lending institution anywhere in the Hub!
Well, I suppose. What do you need to know about?
Sorry. I don't do rumors. Don't ask me again.
I warned you I don't do rumors. If you think I was just blowing smoke, you're wrong. Get out of here and don't come back, punk.
Sorry pal, but I don't do more than one loan at a time. You want more, you gotta start paying. This is a business, not a charity.
Fine. A pleasure doing business. Anything else?
Idiot! You don't have enough to pay it off! Maybe you were thinking of something else
Sure! Feel free to drop on by. We're always willing to help.
Why don't you go run along and runk somewhere else. Get out of here! And don't come back.
Hey, no threats! We're all civilized around here. Guido, Leone, why don't you show this gentleman how civilized we can be.
Hey, no threats! We're all civilized around here. Guido, Leone, why don't you show this lady how civilized we can be.
You're lucky, friend.

Fine.  You have no loans outstanding with us. We lend in units of two hundred Hub Bucks, with a maximum of one thousand Hub Bucks.  Remember, though, I'm not gonna lend you the big bucks until you've proven you can repay the smaller loans.
Guido, Leone, why don't you show him what ripping off really means. Start with his arms.
Sorry pal, but idiots are too big of a credit risk. Get out of here.
Deathclaw. It's got to be the Deathclaw. No one's safe anymore!
He's a great guy. A good source of jobs to pay off my loans. Tell him I sent you, you might get a bonus!
They're great guys! It's true we have the occasional misunderstanding, but I think they're a credit to their species [sotto voce] whichever one that is
I can't say I'm too impressed. I run an honest, respectable business, and they accuse me of being a thief! The nerve of those people. They think a vow of poverty gives them the right to judge me!
I'm just a respectable businessman, that's all. We Giovannis have been respectable businessmen since the days before the holocaust  now that's tradition!
You should try Mr. Decker. Exciting work at great prices! The best in town! And he's just across the street! You can't get better convenience than that!
Forget it, you're too big of a credit risk. Get outta my sight and don't come back.
Fine. One thousand bucks.  You've got 10 days to repay it.
Fine. Eight hundred bucks.  You've got 10 days to repay it.
Fine. Six hundred bucks.  You've got 10 days to repay it.
Fine. Four hundred bucks.  You've got 10 days to repay it.
Fine. Two hundred bucks.  You've got 10 days to repay it.
Too bad. Feel free to employ our services at a later time.
Man, some of the stories they say about that thing are just well, they're something!
Well maybe not a bonus. But he's a great guy, trust me on that one!
Can you believe someone accused me of extortion? Fortunately, my good friend Decker set them straight!
I'll bet their leader, this Morpheus character, he's not broke! No sir! I'll bet that over in the Boneyard, he's just living it up!
You don't show us respect, you get hurt. How much more respectability can a man ask for?
Adventure, danger. You can really make a killing!
See you around, pal!
I'm sorry, but I don't have the time for this.  If you can't pay the full amount, give me what money you do have and our business relationship will be terminated permanently.
[You give Lorenzo all of your caps]
You're full of crap!  You've been holding out on me!  I'm gonna to beat that money out of you!
What a pity.  I guess we'll just have to put some caps into you instead.  Guido!  Leone!
All right.  I suppose this will have to do.  You do realize I can never deal with you again?  If I see you in here again I will be forced to exact a much more severe penalty upon you.
You make me sick.  Give me the money and get out!  Don't ever let me see you in here again!
You don't have enough!

voice_info.appearance: You see a young woman with dark hair.
sample_lines: Hi. Are you new here?
I suppose. What do you need to know about?
I'm Lorraine.

npc_lines.text: Hi. Are you new here?
I suppose. What do you need to know about?
I'm Lorraine.
I'm a Scav. I work with Sammael to collect stuff from the ruins, so that we can use it to build or trade.
Nice talking to you.

Well you got the Deathclaws out there, plus the Regulators take a percentage off the top, plus some for protection here in Adytum. Guess people don't have the upfront cash, or the guts to stare a Deathclaw in the eye.
