Oh, there's half a dozen of us. Sammael was the first one, and he's still the best.
Oh, she wound up falling for some Blade a while ago. Poor dear can't leave the town, of course, and Caleb would kill the young lad on sight. Very tragic.
We only scavenge after dark. And we're very good at what we do. Sammael's got a little test that he likes to throw out at people, before he lets them become Scavs.
Sammael has the person hide somewhere within Adytum during the day. If he can't find the student in an hour, then he lets the person join the next scavenger party.
Come now, isn't there the faintest trace of a romantic in you? Really, it's too bad. Unrequited love and all of that. Tragic.
Hmpf. Shows what you know. Tell that to Sammael. If you can find him.
Yes, although it can be rough. It's very dangerous, especially if you're caught.
Wow, I think you're a little beyond my help.
This used to be a big city, called Los Angeles. But the bombs hit really hard. Now, there's just the Angel's Boneyard. We Adytowners are just trying to survive in the wreckage.
Well, supposedly it was somewhere south of here, but I don't know really. I think everyone left because it was broken.
I'm not really sure. I think they came from somewhere up north of here.
Who do you want to know about?
Zimmerman watches over our town. He makes sure that everyone gets fed, and that everybody has a job to do.
Caleb is the leader of the Regulators. It's his job to protect Adytum. He seems to enjoy it a litte more than he should.

Ah, our resident chemist. Miles makes bullets, and he also built the water distiller that makes sure we get clean water from the well. He's working on an underground farm right now, but he's missing some parts.
Tine runs the shop. It's in the bunker near the gate. He trades with the Hub merchants for us.
Hmm. Smitty is a tinker of sorts. He's good at repair work. He casts bullets and fixes broken stuff around town.

voice_info.appearance: You see Gideon, a normal looking human. He is wearing a crown.
sample_lines: There is no place like home, no place like home, no place like home . . . [pacing back and forth]

lucy.description: Her head glows with a strange energy.

npc_lines.text: There is no place like home, no place like home, no place like home . . . [pacing back and forth]

voice_info.appearance: You see a caravan driver.
sample_lines: Yes? How can I be of service?
Too long in the wastes, unh? That's too bad.
This is the Hub.  It is a trade center for the wastes.  Its the biggest city I know of, you can find just about any thing you could want here.  And if you're lookin for work this is the place to be.

npc_lines.text: Yes? How can I be of service?
Too long in the wastes, unh? That's too bad.

This is the Hub.  It is a trade center for the wastes.  Its the biggest city I know of, you can find just about any thing you could want here.  And if you're lookin for work this is the place to be. It seems like just about everyone here is lookin ta hire you for somethin be it legal or not.
A Water Chip?  Wow.  You got me on that one.  Ive never heard of one of those.  Maybe you should check the General store downtown, they may be able to help you.
Hum...Lots of stuff.  General stuff people need to live, Food, Water, lots of Water.  Water is probably the scarcest commodity in the wastes.
You could just about ask any one here in the Hub.  Or you can check one of the job bulletin boards.  There are a few of them around the Hub.  Definitely more jobs than people here.
[Laughs] Yes. I guess you could say that.  After a while they all start to look the same.  But believe me theyre not.

These are the caravans.  We cart goods to just about all corners of the wastes.  Junktown, The Brotherhood, Shady Sands, and numerous other places.  We just got in and its been a long trip.  The Group across the street is getting ready to depart.

voice_info.appearance: You see Lyle.
sample_lines: We're doing all right here. But I hope that you find the water chip soon. Everybody's on edge and we don't have much time.
Not so good. Ever since I had one of my water rations stolen the other day, things have been going downhill. Everybody is getting scared and nobody knows what to do.
Yeah, I hope so too.

npc_lines.text: We're doing all right here. But I hope that you find the water chip soon. Everybody's on edge and we don't have much time.
Not so good. Ever since I had one of my water rations stolen the other day, things have been going downhill. Everybody is getting scared and nobody knows what to do.
Yeah, I hope so too.
Thanks. I sure hope you can get to the bottom of this. And please hurry and find a new water chip. This craziness wouldn't have happened at all if we had a working chip!

voice_info.appearance: You see a strong, stout man with a bushy beard.
sample_lines: Well, I'm MacRae.  I help the Blades some against the Deathclaws and that Regulator bunch.  Teach'em a bit about protectin 'emselves against those nasties.
Well m' specialty is fightin with my fists, and takin a punch or two more than the guy throwin 'em at me.
Well if that's how you be feeling, you can just turn yourself around and walk away.

npc_lines.text: Well, I'm MacRae.  I help the Blades some against the Deathclaws and that Regulator bunch.  Teach'em a bit about protectin 'emselves against those nasties.
Well m' specialty is fightin with my fists, and takin a punch or two more than the guy throwin 'em at me.
Well if that's how you be feeling, you can just turn yourself around and walk away.
I was thinkin the Deathclaws were the spawn of an unnatural act, but 'em Regulators are evil.  Come once a month or so and they shows their ugly faces and drag a father away from is wee ones.
[MacRae claps you on the back] Thanks to you, the Blades are going to live a better life.  So, what can an old Scotsman do for ya?
Well it's been a wee bit quiet since the Blades helped out Adytum with the Regulators.  Me teaching services haven't been in such demand.
Well I guess I do have the time.  Might as well start right now. [MacRae starts showing you some fighting stances, and ways to take punches like a true Scotsman.]
You be a quick learner.  Hope that helps you in your travels.

Well I used to be helpin the Blades out by teachin them a few things about protectin themselves against the DeathClaws and the Regulators.  Now with you takin care of all that, things have been a wee bit on the boring side lately.

voice_info.appearance: You see a mad scientist. He is working diligently on something.
sample_lines: Good evening, brother. What brings you to our little corner of heaven?
Good evening, sister. What brings you to our little corner of heaven?
You, again? And why are you disturbing the Master's glorious future this time?

npc_lines.text: Good evening, brother. What brings you to our little corner of heaven?
Good evening, sister. What brings you to our little corner of heaven?
You, again? And why are you disturbing the Master's glorious future this time?
It's not going well. I've been injecting the FEV directly into the pineal gland, but I'm not getting the results I'd hoped for.
I beg your forgiveness, sir. How may I be of service?
I beg your forgiveness, ma'am. How may I be of service?

The Master's truth is revealed, resulting in increased psychic ability. [shakes his head] But the poor souls become terminally insane and must be sequestered and nullified to keep them from harming themselves or others.
In a room northwest of here. Is there anything else I can help you with?
I have no time for your tomfoolery!
What an intriguing idea! I must try it at once!
Vincent! Prepare our newest volunteer!
What? That's the most ludicrous thing I've ever heard! [looks at you suspiciously] Who are you, really?
Ah ha! An interloper! Just as I suspected. Vincent!
Who are you? And why are you wearing that suit? [to himself] I haven't seen one of those in a long time.
Oh, you know, when we got that last batch of pure-strain humans in... I think there is still one in the holding pens. Why do you ask?
[shakes his head] Alas, the poor souls become terminally insane and must be sequestered and nullified to keep them from harming themselves or others.

voice_info.appearance: You see the Ghoul Manager.
sample_lines: Whatta you doing here?
Whad you say?
That's what I thought you say. Getta outta my house.

npc_lines.text: Whatta you doing here?
Whad you say?
That's what I thought you say. Getta outta my house.
Oh nonna dat around here. Maybe uppa da temple or atta water place. Getta going.
Ack! Donna you be exploring any my stuff. Getta out! I mean it.
Donna be in my face, likka dat. I runna dis show.
Ack! OK, I concede. I leave.
You no biggie to order me like dat. Take some of dis and shove it!
I don wanna talk to you.
I'm a ghoul. Haven't you ever seen a ghoul before?
Musta been a pansie undergrounder. They letta you live so's you  could pester me. Now getta outta my house.
Well now you have. Getta outta here!

voice_info.appearance: You see Marcelles.
sample_lines: Thank god you're here! Some crazy guy has Sinthia held hostage. He's threatening to kill her! You've got to help.
Oh, geez, I hope you can do it. He's in her room. Help her!
You are an incredibly cold person. She could die without your help.

marcelle.description: Human female wearing protective leather armor.

npc_lines.text: Thank god you're here! Some crazy guy has Sinthia held hostage. He's threatening to kill her! You've got to help.
Oh, geez, I hope you can do it. He's in her room. Help her!
You are an incredibly cold person. She could die without your help.
Help Sinthia. She's in trouble.
Thank you for helping Sinthia. She's usually not a problem. You deserve a good night's sleep. On me. But don't ask for another freebie.
No problem. Room #1. Follow me.
You should have saved Sinthia. It's your fault she died. I hope you are happy with yourself.
Welcome to the Crash House. How can I help you, stranger?
Yeah, we serve your kind, too. It'll be $25 for the night. A week will cost you $150.
Yeah, you too. Have a good day.
Okay, thanks. Your room is room #1. Follow me. Don't be shooting any guns in here, okay?
You need some money before I can rent you a room.
Then you should try the Skum Pitt. I heard you can get a lot of water in your booze there.
I don't know about that, but I will rent you a room. It's a good place to rest and heal up. $25 for a day, or a week is $150. Most people go for the weekly rate. You should, if you ask me.
I'm just a hotel manager, bub. Don't ask too much of me.
I know you're $50 poorer. I don't do the gossip thing, okay? Come back if you want a room.
What do you think I am? A fool? If you're gonna bribe me, have enough money.
Welcome back, what can I do for you?
You're already renting room #1 from me. Do you want me to show you where it is?
You know the drill. One day is $25. One week is $150.
Sure. It's $25 a day, or $150 for the entire week.
Okay. Room #1 is yours. Have a nice stay.
Yeah, what do you want?
No. Go away.
I don't like your face. I don't think I'll be renting you a room.
No. Have a good night.
Okay. One night. $100.
Deal with it. Yes or no.
Good. Here you go. Room #1. Have a nice night, check out time is 11 o' clock.
You killed Killian, didn't you?
Get out! You're too dumb to realize what you did, but my life is hell now!
You son of a bitch. I can't believe you killed him. He was a good man, and now I get all sorts of hell . . . get out, and don't come back.
Yeah, whatever you say, but that's not what I heard. You'd better behave around here, or I'll get out ol' Betsy and ram some buckshot up your ass.

voice_info.appearance: You see a raider who seems crazed.
sample_lines: That's it! Don't come any closer. I'll off her. I swear.
What? You just want to kill me, don't you? Just remember, this is your fault.
Any why not? She's just a whore.

npc_lines.text: That's it! Don't come any closer. I'll off her. I swear.
What? You just want to kill me, don't you? Just remember, this is your fault.
Any why not? She's just a whore.
No. No way. Not this bitch.
What world do you live in? Out here in the real world, blood flows, man. Blood flows, and it's gonna spill all over this room if you don't get out of here.
Geez, that's funny. Who says I want help?
I gotta think about this. Give me a moment.
Yeah. Don't try anything, or she gets it.
Oh, big man. Let's see you try. But first . . .
Oh, big woman. Let's see you try. But first . . .
Stay back . . . I don't want to hurt her, but I will.
Try it, and she dies first. Now, what were you saying?
What hole?
I'll keep talking as long as you do, but try anything tricky, and she'll take the fall.
I don't have to do anything. You got to do it, and you ain't doing so hot.
She laughed at me. They all laughed at me. I'll make 'em pay, I swear.
Maybe. I dunno.
You sound like an all right kind of guy. No one ever wanted to help me before. I think we can talk some more.
You sound like an all right kind of gal. No one ever wanted to help me before. I think we can talk some more.
Just leave me alone. I hate you! You are the devil. I won't listen to you.
There you go again, threatening me. Die!!
I won't listen to you. You're just going to trick me with your words. I don't believe you. Go away.
You might have a point. Prove it to me.
Where do we go from here?
I want some money, and I want to get out of here peacefully. No one follows me.
You lied to me!
Ok. I want $100. Then we walk out of here. No one follows me, and I'll let her go when we get to the edge of town.
Then I guess she gets it.
That's ok, I guess.
I don't like it. What stops you from just shooting me in the back when I walk out of here?
No way! I don't trust you!
All right. We'll see what happens, won't we.
I want my money. I want $200.
You seem like a liar and a cheat to me.
No! Don't tell me what to do! You can't tell me what to do!
Yeah, I'm gonna show you.

voice_info.appearance: You see Dr. Solone, M.D.
sample_lines: Welcome. How might I help you today?
Yes, I see that you are suffering from some damage. This may take some time. Would you like me to try to mend your wounds?
There you go. That should have you all set. Please be more careful out there.

npc_lines.text: Welcome. How might I help you today?
Yes, I see that you are suffering from some damage. This may take some time. Would you like me to try to mend your wounds?
There you go. That should have you all set. Please be more careful out there.
I can teach you a little. But it will take several hours. Are you willing to stay?
You are a very good student. I hope you remain on our side. Good bye.
As you wish. Good luck out there.
I can teach you a little, but not much. It will take some time. Are you willing to stay?
You are an excellent student. Good luck to you.

voice_info.appearance: You see a caravan driver.
sample_lines: Yes? How can I be of service?
Too long in the wastes, unh? That's too bad.
This is the Hub.  It is a trade center for the wastes.  Its the biggest city I know of, you can find just about any thing you could want here.  And if you're lookin for work this is the place to be.

npc_lines.text: Yes? How can I be of service?
Too long in the wastes, unh? That's too bad.

This is the Hub.  It is a trade center for the wastes.  Its the biggest city I know of, you can find just about any thing you could want here.  And if you're lookin for work this is the place to be. It seems like just about everyone here is lookin ta hire you for somethin be it legal or not.
A Water Chip?  Wow.  You got me on that one.  Ive never heard of one of those.  Maybe you should check the General store downtown, they may be able to help you.

These are the caravans.  We cart goods to just about all corners of the wastes.  Junktown, The Brotherhood, Shady Sands, and numerous other places.  Necropolis and the Glow are the only areas we steer clear of.  Im headin this group and we will be leavin shortly.  The group across the street just arrived.
Hum...Lots of stuff.  General stuff people need to live, Food, Water, lots of Water.  Water is probably the scarcest commodity in the wastes.
You could just about ask any one here in the Hub.  Or you can check one of the job bulletin boards.  There are a few of them around the Hub.  Definitely more jobs than people here.
[Laughs] Yes. I guess you could say that.  After a while they all start to look the same.  But believe me theyre not.

voice_info.appearance: You see Mathia.
sample_lines: Hello, Initiate. So, you are the one who made it out of the Ancient Order alive.
The name is Mathia. I am officially Maxson's assistant, but I am also here to make sure no one messes with the old man.
No, no, not at all. He's a good guy. (Jokingly) Besides, I wouldn't bad mouth him while he is standing next to me.

npc_lines.text: Hello, Initiate. So, you are the one who made it out of the Ancient Order alive.
The name is Mathia. I am officially Maxson's assistant, but I am also here to make sure no one messes with the old man.
No, no, not at all. He's a good guy. (Jokingly) Besides, I wouldn't bad mouth him while he is standing next to me.
I take care of all the paper work. He could not do paper work to save his life. Also, if he clears a Weapons Upgrade for one of the Brothers, I process the order.
I can't believe an idiot like you is the one who made the Ancient Order run. Go figure.
Hello again Initiate. How can I help you?
Alright, let's go. (He grabs you by the arm)
Ok. Maxson has cleared a weapons upgrade for you. What would you like?
There you go. Glad you are on our side Initiate.
The Elders have called a meeting. They wish you to meet them in the conference room right away.
It's on this floor. The northeast corner, right behind the assembly hall.

voice_info.appearance: What do you want?
sample_lines: What do you want?
Hey, you gonna eat that dead rat?
What?

npc_lines.text: What do you want?
Hey, you gonna eat that dead rat?
What?
Have you seen my dog, Elvis? He's around here somewhere.
Hi.
Arrrr!
Grrrrr!
I'm gonna gnaw your bones!
Death! Death! Death!
Hey, did you hear that Set was offed?
Set's dead. Set's dead. Set's dead . . .
There's enough water to go around for everyone. Set makes sure of that.
I heard that the mutants got ran out of town.
Ever since the mutants left, it's been better.
Hello.

voice_info.appearance: I can't believe the things that you have done.
sample_lines: I can't believe the things that you have done.
Oh my, you're seriously wounded. Here, let me help you.
Ah. Yes. Here, I found these. Try them when you need a boost.

npc_lines.text: I can't believe the things that you have done.
Oh my, you're seriously wounded. Here, let me help you.
Ah. Yes. Here, I found these. Try them when you need a boost.
Good, keep up the good work. And let me know if you need anything.
What can I do for you?
I'm not authorized to give you any. Sorry.
Sorry, I can't give them to you.
Well, since you put it that way. But don't tell anyone that I let you have these. They cause cravings and they are dangerous to use.

Stimpaks are being rationed. You are welcome to what we have in the medical container on the wall. Take as many as you need, but use them sparingly. It will be a while before we can get you some more.
Hmm. Let's see if you are hurt.
You seem ok to me. Come back if you need some healing.
You look hurt. Here, let me help you.
If you need healing, come back here to me or use some of the stimpaks we have. You can get more stimpaks from the wall.
Lie down here, and we will start the healing process.
You are fully healed. Take care of yourself in the future, but come back if you need any more healing.
It's your body.
Ok, you should be feeling much better. Be careful out there.
I heard what you did, saving the Vault. Thank you.

voice_info.appearance: You see Michelle.
sample_lines: What are you doing here?
A moron. I think that you'd best get out of here. Otherwise, you may become target practice.
Nothing, eh? I think you're hiding something. Out with it before you see your guts.

npc_lines.text: What are you doing here?
A moron. I think that you'd best get out of here. Otherwise, you may become target practice.
Nothing, eh? I think you're hiding something. Out with it before you see your guts.
Everyone knows there are no such things as Martians. All real aliens are from Venus. Now, you die!
Sure, and I'm the Queen of Mexico.
If you're here to do that, then you'll need to try and find Razor. She'll let you know what we think of that.
Mock me, will you? I guess I should expect as much from a child. Oh, by the way. Here!
Fancy talk will only get you so far. Here, it will get you about six feet under.
If you are up to nothing, then we will put you up to something. I think 'target' makes a good something.
You looked. Now, what do you want? Think quick. It may mean the difference between walking out of here and becoming a permanent resident.
We never said anything about living. You would just reside here. Indefinitely. Enjoy your stay.
Not so fast. The only way someone leaves here is if they are a Blade, or in a bag.
Fat chance. But, he's a test. If you can find Razor, then you can talk to her about that.
Big enough to stuff your body parts in when we finish.
I am not Sleeping Beauty. I do not need to be awakened. Get out or die.
Hear you're out for the bastard's head. Give him an extra knife twist for me.
Welcome back. The Hole is open and ready to house you once more.

voice_info.appearance: You see Mike, the Old Town guard.
sample_lines: Yeah, whatta' you want?
Ha. Just another Junkie. Go crash somewhere else, Junkhead.
Yeah. You must be lost. Most people wouldn't be caught dead in this part of town. This is the Eastside, or some call it Old Town. The Wastes of the Wastes.

npc_lines.text: Yeah, whatta' you want?
Ha. Just another Junkie. Go crash somewhere else, Junkhead.
Yeah. You must be lost. Most people wouldn't be caught dead in this part of town. This is the Eastside, or some call it Old Town. The Wastes of the Wastes.
Water Chip? What are you? On dope? A chip made of water?

voice_info.appearance: You see Miles, the chemist of Adytum.
sample_lines: I don't believe we've met. I'm Miles. What can I do for you?
Well, enjoy your stay in our little town.
Yes, although Smitty is the one who actually casts the bullets. I just refill the brass casings.

npc_lines.text: I don't believe we've met. I'm Miles. What can I do for you?
Well, enjoy your stay in our little town.
Yes, although Smitty is the one who actually casts the bullets. I just refill the brass casings.
Any time.
Oh dear. I'm afraid I can't help you.
Yes, well, we have to make a living. Since the hydroponic farms aren't functioning, we have to buy food from the merchants, and bullets are the only thing we have to sell.

Really? That would be wonderful! We're just missing a few parts, but I'm sure that  if you could scrounge up the right pieces, we could be self-sufficient! Sammael might be able to give you some help.
Have you found the parts yet?
You'll need to talk to Sammael. You'll usually find him in a tent down by the farms during the day.
[Miles looks over the parts] Those are them, but it looks like Smitty is going to have to do a little work on them. Can you take them over to him?
Sure, I appreciate you finding them for us.
Oh. I almost forgot. Here is some stuff, for your trouble. [Miles hands you some caps and some stimpacks.]
Were you able to take the parts over to Smitty?
[Miles takes the fixed parts from you] Looks like Smitty did a great job on these. Thanks for the help, and here's some stuff for your trouble.
[Miles hands you some caps and some stimpacks.]

If you ever get back this way, you might want to look me and Smitty up. We might be able to help you out with some adjustments to some of your equipment. Smitty can work wonders with certain weapons, and I can help out with certain sorts of armor.

Looks like you found some Power Armor. I've heard of a chemical process that I could use to harden the surface of the armor. However, I'm missing some information which could give me the last few clues to the formula and reagents necessary.  I've heard the Librarian in the Hub, Mrs. Stapleton, has some journals and books that might be of use. If you could get those from there, I could probably test the process on your armor.
Well, if you ever change your mind, just go see Mrs. Stapleton and then head on back here.
Had a chance to get to the Hub yet and visit Mrs. Stapleton?

[Miles takes the books from you, and starts flipping through them.] Hmmmm. Yes, hmmmm. [He mumbles to himself for a few more minutes.] Well, I think I can figure it out, but it will take a full day for the bonding to occur. Is that acceptable?
Well, when you have the time, come back and I'll do the process on your armor.
[Miles takes your armor from you.]
[Miles hands your armor back to you, it seems to glint a little more than it did before.] Well, I think it worked! Hope it helps you out.
What happened to your power armor? I can only help you out if you have power armor.
Nothing I can do with that type of armor. Sorry.

voice_info.appearance: You see a battered man.
sample_lines: Thank you stranger! I don't know how many weeks, perhaps months, those thugs have had me here. I'm very grateful for your help, and I'm sure the Brotherhood of Steel is also.
You haven't heard of us? I'm really surprised. You must not leave the Hub very often. You should get out more. We're northwest of here, on the west side of the mountain range.
I really appreciate you helping me, but why are you trying to lie to me? Do you not think I know every member of our order?

npc_lines.text: Thank you stranger! I don't know how many weeks, perhaps months, those thugs have had me here. I'm very grateful for your help, and I'm sure the Brotherhood of Steel is also.
You haven't heard of us? I'm really surprised. You must not leave the Hub very often. You should get out more. We're northwest of here, on the west side of the mountain range.
I really appreciate you helping me, but why are you trying to lie to me? Do you not think I know every member of our order?
Thanks again! If you stop by the Brotherhood, I'd appreciate it if you could let Talus know I'm okay. I'm sure he's worried. Bye, and take care.

Oh, I'll be fine now, thanks. I have some friends here that I can stay with while I regain my strength. I'll try to send word to the Brotherhood to let them know that I am safe now, thanks to you. Bye

How Oh, I'm sorry. You must have passed that "test" the Elders made up. I completely forgot about that. Well, my thanks goes even deeper. I'm glad you never gave up. My life could have been in jeopardy at any moment. It must have taken you a while to hunt me down. This city is huge. The obstacles you must have overcome.
Oh Well, I'm still very grateful.
I guess so. that was some fine handy work you did.

Well, thanks again. I am going to stay with some friend of mine until I regain my strength. By the way, I'd watch it around here. I heard my hosts talking about some Thieves' Circle. I guess we're close to their territory or something. I think that might be why they were talking about moving to a different location. Bye.
Well, I'm glad your luck held out. I've heard some bad things about Old Town. The skags are creepy, I think it's something else.
Whatever you say. I'm just grateful to be free again. I don't take well to torture.
Maybe not. I've been having trouble remembering things. I think it was something they fed me.

voice_info.appearance: You see a dirty, grubby prisoner.
sample_lines: Your kind is repugnant. Do not speak to me.
Do not mock me.
I have no rights, and I could care less. Go away, and leave us alone.

npc_lines.text: Your kind is repugnant. Do not speak to me.
Do not mock me.
I have no rights, and I could care less. Go away, and leave us alone.
I refuse to tell you any information. Leave me alone.
Don't you remember that you tried that trick last week? I didn't fall for it then, and I'm not going to start now.
What? No cowl to hind behind? Your traitorous nature is self-evident.
You are cruel. Leave us alone.
I won't spill the beans about my people. You cannot force a man to betray himself, you can only force a man to stop living.
You're still mocking me.
From the mouth of a man comes the serpent's words.
Right, I could guess that. Go away, and leave us alone.

voice_info.appearance: You see a guard.
sample_lines: What is your business here?
I have no patience for jokes. If you do not leave this area now I will shoot you!
Ahh, very good. Customers are always welcome. Come in but please keep your weapons holstered. Go find Zack, he can set you up with anything you need.

npc_lines.text: What is your business here?
I have no patience for jokes. If you do not leave this area now I will shoot you!
Ahh, very good. Customers are always welcome. Come in but please keep your weapons holstered. Go find Zack, he can set you up with anything you need.
Oh, ok. Gabriel will talk to you. Go on in.
Yeah, I remember you.  Go on in.

voice_info.appearance: You see Gideon, a normal looking human. He is wearing a crown.
sample_lines: The asphalt shall run red! I will crush!
I will stop the motor! The master gave me the power . . .
Only the powerful can pass, but they will be kept from passing.

moore.description: A strange energy flares from his eyes.

npc_lines.text: The asphalt shall run red! I will crush!
I will stop the motor! The master gave me the power . . .
Only the powerful can pass, but they will be kept from passing.

voice_info.appearance: You see Doc Morbid.
sample_lines: I'm Doc Morbid, can I help you?
Well, ok, then. Do come back.
Well, if not today, then perhaps sometime in the near future.

npc_lines.text: I'm Doc Morbid, can I help you?
Well, ok, then. Do come back.
Well, if not today, then perhaps sometime in the near future.
Hmm, lets have a look.
You seem to be in nearly perfect health. That will be $10 for the examination.
I never joke. Especially when it comes to physical trauma. You will pay or I'll have to resort to other forms of compensation, many of which are much more painful then just paying my fee.
Have it your way. Cougar, Flash. Show our 'patient' to the lab.
Thank you for your business. Come again.
You do not have enough money. I have a very special way of dealing with debtors - I don't. Flash and Cougar, take our new found source of income to the lab for processing.
Ok, I have your test results:
No. I don't loan anyone, and I mean anyone, any amount of money. Go away, you pauper.
It's your life. Good-Bye.
Excellent. Let's begin. This might hurt a little . . .
There you go. Come back again!
Oh, back so soon. What can I help you with?
Please make it somewhere else, I'm busy.
Hmmm. I don't like your looks, stranger. But what can I do for you? I never, ever turn away a paying customer.
Oh, It's you again. I like your style, even if I don't like you. What can I help you with, now?
Oh, It's a customer! What can I help you with?
My business has dropped off recently. I'm happy to see any customers, these days. Not that I mind your company, of course.
Well, if you do need anything, please stop by. No one can beat my service!
Ahh, a repeat customer. Excellent these days! How can I help you?
I hope you have a good reason for disturbing me. My time is extremely valuable.
I don't find your humor funny. Please leave so I can return to my work.
Hmm. Well, you seem fine to me. Perhaps you need some rest. Try the Crash House, around the corner. Good night.
I'm sorry, I don't treat idiots at this time of night. Something about full moons and lunacy, I suppose. Have a good night.
You again. I hope you have another good reason for disturbing me . . .
I hope you have a good reason for disturbing me. My time is extremely valuable.
I don't find your humor funny. Please leave so I can return to my work.
Hmm. Well, you seem fine to me. Perhaps you need some rest. Try the Crash House, around the corner. Good night.
I'm sorry, I don't treat idiots at night. Something about full moons and lunacy, I suppose. Have a good night.
You again. I hope you have another good reason for disturbing me . . .
Trespasser! This is a private room!
Don't try to talk your way out of this one!
Why should I?
No! I won't let you shut down my operation! Gretch, get
Why?!
Fine. Have it your way!
I will take something from you. And then we will be even.
Excellent!
Now, half of what you have just seen is mine again.
Now, now. Watch your language.
Wh . . . what could you possibly mean?
[He looks shiftily from side to side] That proves nothing. Gretch is a little . . . slow in the head. No one listens to him around here. You had best leave.

voice_info.appearance: The robot is non-functional. The layer of dust on it suggests that it hasn't been active recently.
sample_lines: Unit #462 online. Self-test. Adjusting unit location data. Fixed. Rebuilding memory file. Fixed. Error - task incomplete.
[Click] Okey-dokey! Restarting task.
Unit #462 is a cleaning model. Must finish cleaning and maintenance of this level.

npc_lines.text: Unit #462 online. Self-test. Adjusting unit location data. Fixed. Rebuilding memory file. Fixed. Error - task incomplete.
[Click] Okey-dokey! Restarting task.
Unit #462 is a cleaning model. Must finish cleaning and maintenance of this level.
Vat Control Room. [Click] End of list.

voice_info.appearance: You see a Master Merchant
sample_lines: ...I don't care what they say.  We need new parts... Oh, yes.  Sorry. What can I do for you?
Sure, great.  You're hired.  Wait.  What position?  Oh, caravan guard right?  Yeah, sure. You can work for us.  You look okay.  Anything else?
Sorry, no time for nonsense!

npc_lines.text: ...I don't care what they say.  We need new parts... Oh, yes.  Sorry. What can I do for you?
Sure, great.  You're hired.  Wait.  What position?  Oh, caravan guard right?  Yeah, sure. You can work for us.  You look okay.  Anything else?
Sorry, no time for nonsense!

Water chip... hmm.  Oh, those old Vault purifying control chips.  Well, I'm sure I speak for the entire town when I say you won't find one here.  Without the proper equipment they're worthless.  Only a Vault, or maybe Necropolis would have any use for one.  Why do you ask?
Really? Well as you probably have heard, we supply a great deal of water throughout the area.  I am sure we could arrange to send a caravan up to your Vault for a fee.
Yeah, if you say so.
Then I'm sorry, I don't think I can help.
Can't trust me?!?  I'm routinely trusted to deliver water to people far more paranoid than yourself!  What do you think we are?  Terrorists?
Well, if you change your mind let me know. I'm very curious now.
Hello again.
Sure, great.  You're hired.  Wait.  What position?  Oh, caravan guard right?  Yeah, sure.  You can work for us.  You look okay.
We already went through this.  Are you willing to pay the price to have the water caravans start?

Well, it's just a guess really.  We tried to start a caravan route to Necropolis once, but they refused to trade with us.  Nobody in their right mind refuses water these days unless they have a reliable supply.  I figure they must have their own purifier or they would have died out a long time ago.  So are you looking to have us go up to your Vault?

Well, it is quite a distance away.  2000 caps should cover the initial caravan, and I'm sure your Vault will have stuff to trade to keep us going for a while.  However with our current reserves, I'm guessing that we will only be able to keep your Vault going for an extra 100 days or so.

Ok, I can start sending the caravans up to your Vault today.  Now you ought to know, the caravans are pretty visible going across the desert.   So, sending the caravans out that way is going to paint a pretty good picture for anyone that might be looking for your Vault.   Are you still sure you want them sent out that way?
That sounds fair enough.  The technology from the Vaults can fetch a pretty good price down here in the Hub.
Sorry but I can only accept full payment.
That sounds fair enough.  The technology from the Vaults can fetch a pretty good price down here in the Hub.
Sorry but I can only accept full payment.
Ok, they'll start off in a few hours.

voice_info.appearance: It's some kind of huge super mutant creature! And it has a very large gun!
sample_lines: Take him to Harry. He'll know what to do with him.
We should take her to Harry. He has plans for all the women.

npc_lines.text: Take him to Harry. He'll know what to do with him.
We should take her to Harry. He has plans for all the women.

voice_info.appearance: You see Neal, the bartender.
sample_lines: Welcome to the Skum Pitt. What can I do ya for?
Great. Whaddya want?
Okay, so whaddya wanna know?

npc_lines.text: Welcome to the Skum Pitt. What can I do ya for?
Great. Whaddya want?
Okay, so whaddya wanna know?
[Neal looks at you quizzically for a moment.] Haven't you ever seen a bar before, stranger? This is my place, the Skum Pitt. You buy drinks here. And you tip me.
Yeah, same to you, buddy.

Well, just over there to the west of us is Gizmo's casino. I'd be surprised if you didn't know about it; most of the people here are the ones who just finished losing their money there. Over in the other part of town you got Killian's general store, and Marcelles's Crash House. Killian's a good guy, runs a straight joint, carries everything you need. The Crash House is where you sleep it off when you've been in here for too long. [Neal chuckles.]
Fella's called Tycho. Apparently a ranger from back east or something. Pretty nasty fighter, from what I hear, but a straight-up character.
Oh, them. They're the Skulz. They're a local gang. All the riff-raff. Sometimes they start fights or cause a little trouble. Usually Killian keeps them in line, though.
That's not a trophy, it's an urn. It contains my wife's ashes - besides this bar, it is the most important thing in my life.
Anything else?
Thank you. You can't know what this means to me. You'll never pay for a drink in this bar again.
Some slime stole it. It wasn't a trophy, it was an urn. It contained my wife's ashes - besides this bar, it was the most important thing in my life.

voice_info.appearance: You see Neil, the head of the guard for the Followers.
sample_lines: Why are you here?
I am sorry, but I can't understand you. Now, what are you doing here?
If you are doing nothing, then I suggest that you leave. Now!

npc_lines.text: Why are you here?
I am sorry, but I can't understand you. Now, what are you doing here?
If you are doing nothing, then I suggest that you leave. Now!
You wish to help? Maybe I can use you.
You are simple enough to find this person that others are too smart to find. There is a spy around here who is giving our secrets to the Children. Find the spy. Kill the spy. Go.
I thought as much. Be off with you.
Figures that Jake doesn't think that I can get the job done right. He's the only one who could have sent you. Then you know about the spy.
My guards are no fools. They sent you to the right person. There is a leak in here, and we need to find out where it is and seal it.
The only thing that we know so far is that the person has to have access to the Children's Cathedral. I think it may be one of our scouts.
I am quite certain. They only have access to the halls of the Followers. They are not allowed outside.
That is why I am asking you to look around and see if you can find someone. Will you help?
Thank you. This means a lot to us.
Then I must detain you from warning anyone.
How he ever became second in command is beyond me. Since he was so scarce in words, I will fill you in. We have a leak who is feeding the Children some of our movement patterns.
You don't even know? I guess you wouldn't; most people in here don't. Someone is sneaking information of our movements to the Children. We need that person gone.
How much are you willing to offer?
Tough luck then.
What would you like to know?
Our leader is Nicole. Really nice person, but a bit flighty. Anything else you want to know?
The Children are not what they appear to be. They are hiding something. Something related to those Nightkin. Anything else?
There is the Children's healer, but I don't trust them. We also have a doctor or nurse on duty here at all times. Anything else?
I am truly sorry to hear that. Pieces be with you!
Who sent you?
A bit sure of yourself. I have no need for you. Talk to Nicole if you wish to offer your services.  Good night.
Then you will want to search out Nicole. She can help you better with that. Good evening.
Good job on finding and removing Heather. Her meddling nearly got everyone killed. I wish there was something more we could do.
How so?
That would be wonderful. Thank you.

voice_info.appearance: Stop!
sample_lines: You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
What manner of treason is this?!

npc_lines.text: You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little brother. Explain yourself.
You are not supposed to be armed in this area, little sister. Explain yourself.
What manner of treason is this?!
Show me your pass, then.
Hurry on your task then, but be warned -- I'm watching you.
Yes, little brother. What is it that you need from me?
Yes, little sister. What is it that you need from me?
I am not one to guide you on the path to Unity. Leave!
You are obviously a heathen! Pay for your sins!
Here is here. Why do you ask?
You insult me! Die!
Praise to the Unity.
You sound like you do not believe what you say. Could this be true? Or have you left the path of righteous?
When you become one of us, you will not fear such minor things. Begone.
What do you want this time? I have little time for your talk.
You are obviously an intruder!
Get out of my face.
I don't have time for you. Stop bothering me.

This is our Master's weapon of last resort. If we find an enemy we cannot defeat in battle, then we will destroy them with this. But I doubt this will ever happen. Even our Master does not want to unleash the dreaded power of the atom again!
You're welcome. Now be quiet, I need to concentrate on guarding this device.
Oh, yes, it is. We keep it in perfect working condition, ready to be detonated at a moment's notice. The Unity will not be defeated!
No. We are here to guard it from intruders. No one could access the device without us noticing. Besides, the nuclear arming key required to arm the device is not here.
Oh, sure, no problem. The Lieutenant keeps the key. He's at the Military Base, so he isn't even around here. That keeps the nuclear bomb from being set off under our beloved Master.
[The large mutant peers at you for a moment, with bushy eyebrows raised] I think you are asking too many questions.

voice_info.appearance: You! Stop right there and face the law!
sample_lines: You! Stop right there and face the law!
Thank you for returning the water-chip. It's really going to help morale, and keep people from breaking vault law.
Good to see you again. Is there anything that I can do for you?

npc_lines.text: You! Stop right there and face the law!
Thank you for returning the water-chip. It's really going to help morale, and keep people from breaking vault law.
Good to see you again. Is there anything that I can do for you?
Hmmm. I think you should be somewhere else besides here. Have a nice day.
I'm in charge of Vault security and law enforcement. You might not know it, but the Vault wouldn't run as well if it wasn't for me.
It is. Without proper adherence to the laws, the Vault would soon be a lawless place, with no direction. That would jeopardize the safety of us all.
Well, even if weapons are required on the outside world, don't display them in a threatening manner in here. Other than that, I can't think of anything in particular.
You see, I knew that would happen. People obeying law is the only thing that has saved the Vault from misery and destruction. Keep up the good work.
The Overseer has not authorized me to open the armory and get you more weapons. I'm sorry, but I can't help you.
Have a nice day.
To keep the weapons away from those who don't have access to them.
Life isn't fair, sometimes. But our law is. Have a nice day.
The Overseer, myself and my security team. That's it.
Yes, it is. I have to get back to work.
Yes, only people with need can get in.
I'm sorry, it's a good argument, but I can't let you in.
Hmm. Now that you mention it, it sounds like you do. Here, let me get the door for you.
Great. Your intelligence staggers me. I can't possibly think anymore.
Sorry, you've gotten all we can spare. Good day.
I don't like your kind. Rabble-rousers. You should be ashamed.
Watch your language, or I'll bring you in for failure to respect a law enforcement officer.
Hmm. Possibly. It should be my job to be impartial, but I might have stepped over the line this time. I'll try and do better in the future.
Hmm. No. Probably not harsh enough.
Good luck. I hope you can do the job.
You'd better not let me down.
Put your weapon away, right now.
What do you think you are doing with that in here?
Be careful what you call me. And don't draw a weapon inside. This is the Vault for god's sake.
You'd better not be practicing it in here. Me and you will have a serious problem if you do it again.
I knew that outside life would get you into trouble.

voice_info.appearance: You see Orfeo, a Senior Member of the Children of the Cathedral.
sample_lines: Ah. A new convert. Welcome.
Then we shall take care of that problem shortly.
We must first cleanse you from the impurities of the wastelands. Come.

npc_lines.text: Ah. A new convert. Welcome.
Then we shall take care of that problem shortly.
We must first cleanse you from the impurities of the wastelands. Come.

voice_info.appearance: You see the Overseer.
sample_lines: Ahh, you're here. Good. Well, only good that you're here. We've got a problem. A big one. The controller chip for our water purification system has given up the ghost. We can't make another one and th
One month . . . two . . . four . . . five . . . six . . .

npc_lines.text: Ahh, you're here. Good. Well, only good that you're here. We've got a problem. A big one. The controller chip for our water purification system has given up the ghost. We can't make another one and the process is too complicated for a work-around system. Simply put, we're running out of drinking water. No water, no Vault. Now we both know we've had our differences as you've grown up. You've got the wanderlust in you - desires for things the Vault just can't satisfy. And you know I think this just might be the last safe place anywhere so I'm always worried about those who want to take off on adventures. Hey, if everyone left, I'd be out of a job! Seriously, this is crucial to our survival. And frankly, I think you're the only hope we have. You need to go find us another controller chip.
One month . . . two . . . four . . . five . . . six . . .

voice_info.appearance: You see Lasher of the Children.
sample_lines: I know who you are. You are a wicked, evil man and you must be punished.
I know who you are. You are the devil in womans form, but your shape will not save you.

I know who you are. Your wickedness precedes you. You send the souls of children to Hades, before they can be cleansed of their perfidy. It is a black evil that you do, and you must be punished for it

npc_lines.text: I know who you are. You are a wicked, evil man and you must be punished.
I know who you are. You are the devil in womans form, but your shape will not save you.

I know who you are. Your wickedness precedes you. You send the souls of children to Hades, before they can be cleansed of their perfidy. It is a black evil that you do, and you must be punished for it.
I know who you are. You are walking death, a plague in human form. Where you step, blood flows like a river. But such iniquities can be ended by a righteous soul!
How dare you disturb me! Dont you know how important my position is? Get out!
You are unwise to draw your weapon on me. The Masters shield is upon me, and I may not be touched without retribution!
Why have you come, initiate? You know that I do not like to be disturbed.
How dare you enter my sanctuary with a weapon in your hand! Oaf! Get out!
Who do you think you are, entering my sanctum with a drawn weapon. Get out!
My quarters are not open to those who have not been consecrated. I must ask you to leave at once.
That is a privilege reserved for only the most faithful servants. Only baptism is a higher honor.
I see no reason to converse with a fool. Away with you.
You should speak to Father Morpheus. He is in the tower, but it is unlikely that the Nightkin will allow you to pass.
The rod is a holy instrument, through which I instruct my charges. Pain clears the mind of evil thoughts and allows them to better comprehend the glory of the Master.

I instruct the children. It is my duty. All children are wicked beasts. It is my duty to force them into evolve into human beings. Perhaps you have heard that I do not tolerate frivolity. This is true. I want my charges to suffer as much as possible.
You filthy brainless abomination! How dare you defile my presence! Get out! Out! Now!
You are a woman, and therefore you are always troubled. It is an endemic condition of your breed. Tell me your problem, madam, and I will resolve it for you.
If your heart was not so full of wickedness, sir, you would be at ease. A righteous heart knows no cares. Tell me your problem, but be quick!

Learn to embrace pain as your closest friend, for pain is the most instructive force in the universe. Break yourself until you can exist no longer as an individual, then remake yourself into the Masters tool. That is the solution to all of your problems.
Beasts chatter without meaning. Human beings think first, and then they talk. You must evolve into a human being before I will wish to speak you. Be gone.
Your words are true. Very well, I will help you. But be quick.
There comes a time when you must find the answers to lifes questions yourself, and that time is now. Begone!
That is not my duty. Now begone.

I have not consulted him, but I am certain he is pleased with the righteous souls I have brought him. It is difficult work, but I do it well. Unfortunately, it is also quite time consuming, which is why I must order to you to leave right now.
A flatterers tongue is in the mouth of a devil! A devil such as you! Get out of my sight!
You foul mouthed beast! Begone! Learn some manners before you return.
A reasonable request. Take this symbol. Show it to the Nightkin when you wish to pass.
I cannot help you with that. Begone.
He is our leader. He is close to the Masters counsels and knows many of his purposes. Is that all?

They serve the Master. They bring the pain of healing to the world. Angels in the Night, who redeem the world by bloodshed. Curiosity is a foolhardy emotion, but doubly so when it comes to the Nightkin. That is your only warning. I have much to do now. Away with you.
Your courtesy does you credit. Perhaps you are worthy to talk with Morpheus. If the Nightkin stops you, show them this symbol. Now, away with you!
You are a fool if you think petty subterfuge will defeat the Nightkin. Get out of here!

Decadence and ease prevents evolution, evolution that is necessary for survival in a harsh world. Fortunately, I am a hard man who cares nothing for seductive pleasures. I see that you disagree with me. I do not care about your opinion. Get out of here!

Mutation is nothing to fear. Every birth is a mutation of our parents DNA. We are all mutants. The only thing that matters is that the mutant is guided on a moral and productive path. This is my job. And this also ends this discussion. Leave me now.

I deal out pain. If the animal is worthy and can learn from it, it evolves into a righteous soul. If it does not, it does not deserve to exist. On rare occasions, the animal is removed the genetic pool, although not as often as I would like. This happens more often with failed grown animals.
You are an evil girl. You would do well to tread carefully here. The Nightkin do not enjoy rivals. Now begone!
You are an evil man. You would do well to tread carefully here. The Nightkin do not enjoy rivals. Now begone!

Righteousness is attained through struggle, trauma, and recovery. We are animals who must be continuously be broken until we accept the Masters truth without hesitation. Now that you have heard the truth, seek it with the body of your experiences. Get out of here.
Your tongue is a wicked thing that is beyond redemption. Get out of my sight!
The Cathedral teaches many things which an undisciplined mind is incapable of comprehending. Now I have other duties to perform. Away with you!
As do I. It appears we have many things in common, but unfortunately, you irritate me beyond my ability to tolerate. Get out of here. Now.
It is not my place to judge. You must persuade the Nightkin. Good luck. You will need it.
You were not particularly welcome here in the first place. Good riddance to you.

Once I did, but many of methods were abandoned in favor of the loud noises you hear in the Auditorium amphitheater. It is a source of bitterness for me. Fortunately, I can still instruct the children. Now if you will excuse me, I have to prepare for their lessons.
Uh it is of course, a rare event, and the animal is given every chance to evolve. Now leave here! Leave here at once!
This may be of some use to you. Take this symbol. Show it to the Nightkin when you wish to pass. It will allow you to see Father Morpheus.

voice_info.appearance: You see a man in studded leather armor with an odd assortment of knick-knacks.
sample_lines: Greetings, traveler. What brings you out this far?
I see. Much like myself, then.
It's not junk! It's trade goods!

npc_lines.text: Greetings, traveler. What brings you out this far?
I see. Much like myself, then.
It's not junk! It's trade goods!
Hmm. Haven't seen one of those before. What seems to be the trouble?
I wander from place to place, making a living with music and a little bit of tinkering work.

Using the coastline as a referent, you've got Shady Sands about a week inland, and Junktown a few days south of there. Hub's just another couple days south of Junktown. Avoid Necropolis to the east of those, though. Not worth the trouble.
I don't think I could help you with that. I never had much of a chance to study pre-war Vault technology.
Mostly a little electrical and mechanical tinkering. I helped Junktown with their lights and showed the people in Shady Sands a better design for their stoves.
Oh, mostly old folk songs and some Celtic music. It's a change of pace.
Shady Sands is a small, self-sufficient community led by Aradesh, a kind man and strong leader. They are peaceful and hard-working. They are probably the best chance for a new civilization here.
Shady Sands is a small farming community. They were led by a good man named Aradesh, but I've heard he's gone. It's a pity. Without him I don't know if they'll survive.
Junktown? A small trading city. Strange place until you get used to it. They are run by mayor Killian Darkwater, a hard but fair man.
Junktown? A small trading city. Strange place until you get used to it. They are run by Gizmo, a gambling mogul and crime-lord.
Junktown? A small trading city. Not too remarkable.
The Hub is a major trading center. It's said that you can find anything there, and I'd say that's not too far wrong.

Necropolis is the city of the dead. It's inhabited by ghouls, the descendants of humans who sought shelter in a Vault there. Story goes that the Vault failed somehow, so now the only inhabitants are carrion-eating monsters.
It was overrun by an army of mutants last I heard. I'd stay away from there, if I were you.
Possibly, but I for one wouldn't risk the ghouls. Latest word is they've some sort of powerful new leader.
Why, certainly. Would you like to hear it?
[Patrick sings songs and the two of you reminisce for several hours. You feel invigorated.]
Hello again. Can I help you?

voice_info.appearance: You see Knight Paul.
sample_lines: Ahhh, so youre the new initiate.  Welcome aboard.  What can I do for you?
Im Paul, head of Energy Weapons Development.
Laser, Plasma... you name it, Ive built it.. or at least re-built it.

npc_lines.text: Ahhh, so youre the new initiate.  Welcome aboard.  What can I do for you?
Im Paul, head of Energy Weapons Development.
Laser, Plasma... you name it, Ive built it.. or at least re-built it.
You would have to see Michael to be issued a weapon. He cant authorize you for one though, for that you would have to see Talus.
They are both on the first floor of the base.  Talus is usually in the training room and Michael does his duty just outside of the storage room.
Sure.  What can I help you with?
Yes. The latest in hand held laser technology. [He takes a small pistol from a work table and hands it to you]
That one wont do you much good.  Its still lacking the lenses and amplifier. [He takes the pistol back from you and puts it on the work table] If you really want one, go talk to Talus or Michael.
A Water Chip?  The ones from the old Vault-Tec shelters?
No. Those things were junk, they were prone to failure.  We dont deal with purifying our own water here.  We have water delivered by caravans from the Hub.
In the hands of a skilled warrior, it could cut a person in half. The beam will shear flesh faster then you can run your finger through sand.
No.  I only work on Energy weapons.  You should go see Kyle if you have questions about Power Armor.
Well, I cant help you with that.  Sorry.
Um.. please leave before you drool on something important.

voice_info.appearance: Get out of here!
sample_lines: I hope you're not going to kick me out of here.
Oh, well, if you want to stay a while, go right ahead. I think we are safe here.
Well, you gotta be careful these days. I hope you're having a better life than I am.

npc_lines.text: I hope you're not going to kick me out of here.
Oh, well, if you want to stay a while, go right ahead. I think we are safe here.
Well, you gotta be careful these days. I hope you're having a better life than I am.
Well, it's true. After what happened to my friends, I gotta protect my turf. I just hope you're not gonna kill me.
Gack!
No reason. Really.
I hope so, I really hope so.

voice_info.appearance: You see Peter, leader of the Follower Scouts.
sample_lines: What are you doing around here? Can't you see we are busy?
Great. I'm busy, and I get a moron tailing me. Go look for Jake if you need someone to talk to.
Sure. You can start by getting out of my way.

npc_lines.text: What are you doing around here? Can't you see we are busy?
Great. I'm busy, and I get a moron tailing me. Go look for Jake if you need someone to talk to.
Sure. You can start by getting out of my way.
Yes. You can get out of here.
Fine. It doesn't look like I will get rid of you any other way. It seems that we are having a security problem. You want to help, you find the problem.
Fine. Get out then!
Look, we have a breach in security. We need to find this breach and end it.
Do I look like a guide. Go talk to Jake if you are looking for a guide.

voice_info.appearance: You see Petrox, a desert bandit.
sample_lines: Greetings! I am Petrox. I am one of Garl's lead raiders. Who are you?
As a raider, I get to travel to many parts of the wasteland. In my travels, I get supplies for the camp.

Well, it's nice that you think that you are so important that you don't need a name to go around here. But, I will at least tell you a little about us. We are the toughest people in the wastelands. No

npc_lines.text: Greetings! I am Petrox. I am one of Garl's lead raiders. Who are you?
As a raider, I get to travel to many parts of the wasteland. In my travels, I get supplies for the camp.

Well, it's nice that you think that you are so important that you don't need a name to go around here. But, I will at least tell you a little about us. We are the toughest people in the wastelands. No one can stand against us. Not even those wimps from Shady Sands or Junktown.
I am sorry, but I don't have time to waste on those who are slow. Good bye.
We never steal. We just take the extra that others have and redistribute it among our hungry people.
I've been to many places in the wastelands. The closest places that I've been to are Shady Sands and Junktown. Not much happens in those places, but they are always full of information and supplies.
You are starting to become annoying now. I think I will end that slight problem.
Shady Sands is a fertile community. They are happy to, um, share their bounty with us.
Junktown is a little bit south of here. They have many good women.
Junktown is a little bit south of here. They have many good women. Say . . . I can show you around sometime, maybe we can get to know each other better . . . whaddya say?
Sure, maybe later.
I have told you all that I am permitted. Please go.

voice_info.appearance: You see a peasant.
sample_lines: Mebbe you can talk it to death.
It won't let us back into our house, that's why.
It was the 'pet' of a traveller. When the traveller died, this damn dog just plopped its furry ass down on my doorstep and wouldn't leave. It's been there for days.

npc_lines.text: Mebbe you can talk it to death.
It won't let us back into our house, that's why.
It was the 'pet' of a traveller. When the traveller died, this damn dog just plopped its furry ass down on my doorstep and wouldn't leave. It's been there for days.
I don't know. Some guy. He came from the east, he said. Like anyone could get past the deadlands to the east. He ran afoul of Gizmo, trying to interfere with Gizmo's business.
So, Gizmo had a couple of boys beat him up and throw him from the casino roof. The traveller broke his damnfool neck and died. The dog was pissed.
Oh, the guy was tall, dark-haired with a little graying around the edges. He was dressed all in black leather, like that's a good idea in the desert, and carried a shotgun.
He had some funny accent. The dog was his constant companion, followed him everywhere.

voice_info.appearance: You see a dirty, grubby prisoner.
sample_lines: Your kind is repugnant. Do not speak to me.
Do not mock me.
I have no rights, and I could care less. Go away, and leave us alone.

npc_lines.text: Your kind is repugnant. Do not speak to me.
Do not mock me.
I have no rights, and I could care less. Go away, and leave us alone.
I refuse to tell you any information. Leave me alone.
Don't you remember that you tried that trick last week? I didn't fall for it then, and I'm not going to start now.
What? No cowl to hind behind? Your traitorous nature is self-evident.
You are cruel. Leave us alone.
I won't spill the beans about my people. You cannot force a man to betray himself, you can only force a man to stop living.
You're still mocking me.
From the mouth of a man comes the serpent's words.
Right, I could guess that. Go away, and leave us alone.

voice_info.appearance: You see a ghoul prisoner.
sample_lines: Wha-what do you want.
Hey, I don't care about that, just get me outta here!
Great! Do it!

npc_lines.text: Wha-what do you want.
Hey, I don't care about that, just get me outta here!
Great! Do it!
I stole some water. Hey, I was thirsty! It wasn't like I hurt somebody.
I would've died without the water. It was only a cupful. Just enough to keep me alive. You gotta get me out of here! I'm going insane.
Please let me go.
Thanks for letting me out.

They pump it up from the wells below. There is a manhole in the cell next door that leads to the old vault. This is the source of the water. If it wasn't for those ones below, we would be a lot better off.
It's difficult to make the old tech work properly, sometimes. The glowing ones lash out whenever we go down there. Us ghouls just leave them alone. And the big mutants don't seem to care one bit.

voice_info.appearance: radio
sample_lines: [There is a squeal of static, then you hear a deep voice over the radio.] Command to patrol, command to patrol. What is your status? Over.
Understood, patrol. We are sending assistance now. Over.
Who is this? What is your purpose?

npc_lines.text: [There is a squeal of static, then you hear a deep voice over the radio.] Command to patrol, command to patrol. What is your status? Over.
Understood, patrol. We are sending assistance now. Over.
Who is this? What is your purpose?
Understood, patrol. What are your coordinates?
Understood, patrol. Command, out.
Understood, patrol. We are sending reinforcements.
Ah, that explains it. We are sending help now.
Roger, patrol. We're sending help now! Hold on!
[Squeal-snick-pop] Command here, go ahead patrol.
Intruders in the base! Sound the alert!
Roger Patrol, Command out.
[You dial the frequency of the radio to the security control channel] [Click!] Enter access number. [Click!]
Automatic security channel shutdown.

voice_info.appearance: You see Gideon, a normal looking human. He is wearing a crown.
sample_lines: Nullified? Are they somehow restricting your psychic powers by those devices you are wearing?
Never mind.
Stup.

rae.description: His hands are glowing with a strange energy.

npc_lines.text: Nullified? Are they somehow restricting your psychic powers by those devices you are wearing?
Never mind.
Stup.
What about the dogs of war?
Well, I need to join. Where can I pick up one of those snazzy nullifiers?
Thanks.
Obviously. Goodbye.
The blasphemous . . . decompose . . . death will be . . . salvation . . . strong!
Yeah, but I can cause them a whole lot of pain.

voice_info.appearance: The Raider is too frightened of Garl to speak to you any more.
sample_lines: What do you want?
Oh. You must be looking for a job. Go and see Garl in the big room and leave us alone.
Then do it elsewhere.

npc_lines.text: What do you want?
Oh. You must be looking for a job. Go and see Garl in the big room and leave us alone.
Then do it elsewhere.
Nah. I ain't seen her. Why are you asking?
Ah, ok.
Really? What does she look like?
Yeah, she's here. She's in the big house. You know, if we tell Garl, then he would want a piece of the bounty. You might want to think about that.
You don't sound like you mean it. I think that you are up to something. And if you are telling the truth, then I'll bag the reward for myself.
I . . . I can't say any more, or Garl will kill me.
Bite me!
I don't like your looks. You'd better get away from me.
What? Go away!

voice_info.appearance: You see a dejected prisoner of the Raiders.
sample_lines: Hey, you! Get me out of here!
I don't care. Get me out of here please!
My name is Jack. I'm from Junktown. These monsters killed the rest of my caravan and put me here.

npc_lines.text: Hey, you! Get me out of here!
I don't care. Get me out of here please!
My name is Jack. I'm from Junktown. These monsters killed the rest of my caravan and put me here.
Please, just help me out.
Ow! My leg. It's hurt. I think it might be broken. Please help me!

voice_info.appearance: You see Razlo.
sample_lines: I'm sorry but I can't help you.
You look distraught. Are you in need of assistance?
Tandi is gone? That is a terrible thing. I hope they find her.

npc_lines.text: I'm sorry but I can't help you.
You look distraught. Are you in need of assistance?
Tandi is gone? That is a terrible thing. I hope they find her.

Hmm, Tandi is gone? I find this hard to believe, but maybe she ran away with Seth. I know that they have been eyeing each other lately. Aradesh was always a little bit of a prude, perhaps it was too much for her finally.
How awful! If that is the case, I hope she is not hurt. Who is looking for her?
I hope she is found before it is too late.
If she is hurt, it could be bad. Here, take these . . . I hope that you won't need them.
I'm Razlo. Can I help you?
Hmmm. I think I've seen Brahmin with more brain cells then you. Well, let's see if you're wounded.
Well, you seem fine to me. Perhaps later, then?
Let's see here.
I have already given you as much as I can. Good luck.
Hmmm, I don't like your looks. I hope that you have come for business, and will be moving on shortly . . .
Hello, again. How can I be of service?
It was nice seeing you again. Have a good day.
Of course. It's you again. Now what?
Of course you do.
Can I help you?
Sorry, I can't cure any poisons. I don't have the proper ingredients to make a decent anti-venom.
Here, let's see.
Yep, just as I thought. Let me get the cure.
You seem fine, now. Be careful in the future.
Stop by again, but stay healthy next time.

Not too much. They seem to be extremely large versions of the north American Emperor scorpion. Contrary to my medical knowledge, their poison has grown more potent, not diluted, as I would expect. Seth has been hunting them, which helps some of my tests.
And how such a large creature can even be possible by natural evolution, or even radiation induced mutation is beyond me.
They seem to be sensitive to light. Nocturnal. If I could get a sample of their poison, especially the venom production sac located in their tail, I could create an anti-venom.
Doc Morbid in Junktown taught me some. And just because we live in stone huts, does not mean we are less intelligent or educated. Have a nice day.
Let me see the sac! Yes, I can do something with this.
Here, take this as a free sample. It seems to work well against radscorpion stings, of course, but it shows much potential as a general anti-venom and poison cure.
It's late. Come back in the morning.
Hnn?! What is that? Great, I get awakened by the great mumbling beast of the north. Come back in the morning.
Are you hurt?
You will be, if you keep me from my sleep. Now come back in the morning.
Great Brahmin! Why didn't you say so?
You're barely hurt. I suggest a good nights sleep and some rest; you will heal naturally over time.
You're barely hurt, you wimp. Come back in the morning.
Ouch, that does look a little painful. That will be $25.
Oh Great Brahmin! That is very, very serious. It will cost $50.
How can you still be walking?! This looks extremely serious. We'll need some special prayers for this one and a lot of luck. Not to mention $100.
You don't have enough money! I'm sorry, but my work ethic doesn't permit me to heal for free, you know. Come back when you have enough money.
Sorry, not today.
Why would I be able to help you kill radscorpions? I'm a doctor, not a warrior. For that you should see Aradesh, or even Tandi, or her boyfriend, Seth. Leave me.
If I had a sample of their poison, I could create a cure.
This will take a little bit of time. Come, relax in the back. You might have a slight headache from the junja juice, as well. Come, come . . .
I have already given you as much as I can. Good luck.
Let me see the sac! Yes, I can do something with this, as well as heal you for this great gift.
This will take a little bit of time. Come, relax in the back, while I work with the sac. You might have a slight headache from the junja juice, as well. Come, come . . .

voice_info.appearance: Hello, what can I do for you?
sample_lines: Hello, what can I do for you?
Razor's the name.  I'm the closest thing we have to a leader.
Gang?  We're hardly a gang. But I am the leader here.

npc_lines.text: Hello, what can I do for you?
Razor's the name.  I'm the closest thing we have to a leader.
Gang?  We're hardly a gang. But I am the leader here.

That's Adytum. It's a slave labor camp run by a group called the Regulators, but they tell everyone it's a "town". They come here and take our people to work them until they die. Then they come and take more of us.
So.  What brought you to this corner of the wastes?
We are just people tryin' to survive.  Adytum put us in this position.  They keep us down  and use our friends and families like animals. We don't even have a way to defend ourselves.
I wish we were a gang.  At least then we'd have decent weapons to defend our selves with.
Well, I can't help you with that.
We need better weapons.  The Gun Runners, a little ways from here, have weapons, but we can't get to them.

The Regulators .  They are the ones that really run Adytum. Not Zimmerman.  They come here and drag our people back to Adytum as slaves. They kill us when we try to fight them off.  Sometimes they just come and kill a couple of us to bring to Zimmerman , so they can say we tried to break into their town, or some other ridiculous story. Those sons of bitches even killed Zimmerman's son!

There's a Death Claw nest between us and them.  We have never even spoken with any of the Gun Runners.  The Regulators have the fire power to clear out the Death Claws, but they don't for some reason.

Josh lived here with me... a... I...I mean us.  He knew the truth behind what was going on.  The Regulators told him if he ever tried to contact his father or return to Adytum that they would kill him.

Late one night he tried to sneak into town to tell his father what was really going on.  I was monitoring the Regulators radio transmissions the night that .. they.. he got ...caught. [She looks down and shakes her head slowly.] Here, it's all on this holodisk.
It's not like any of us can even get close to Adytum. We'd be shot dead before we even reached the gates.
You would risk your life to help us?
Thank you.  This really could help us.  Good luck. [She hands you the holodisk.]
Very well. I hope you make the right decision.
The Gun Runners are over to the east  and then north of here.  But be careful - Death Claws are not to be taken lightly.  I've seen a Death Claw tear a man in half with one swipe.
I'm sorry you feel that way.  I think it would be best if you leave.
Can I help you?
Gang?  We're hardly a gang.  But I am the one they all come to for direction.
(Looking a little nervous) What? Did he...
WHAT!!!  THOSE FUCKING PIECE OF SHIT BASTARDS! I"LL KILL THEM, I"LL SEND THEM ALL TO HELL!!
... the Regulators.  They were the ones that killed Josh!  I never would do any thing to hurt Josh.  It's the Regulators who are running Adytum, not Zimmerman.

Josh lived here with me... a... I...I mean us.  He knew the truth behind what was going on.  The Regulators told him if he ever tried to contact his father or return to Adytum that they would kill him. They laughed at him... they were so sure he couldn't get to his father....
How's our plan coming along?
I'm not so sure it would help without the threat of violence to back it up. What we really need are some weapons from the Gun Runners.
They're a little to the east of here, but there's a Death Claw nest between us and them.  We have never even spoken with any of the Gun Runners.
I hope that you can find a way to help us. Goodbye.
What's wrong?
....Now we have no choice but to get those weapons from the Gun Runners. Will you help us?
Thank you. May the Gods be with you on your journey.
Thank you for all your help. We're going to invade Adytum, we could use someone like you on our side.
Well, thanks again for you help. Goodbye.
Great. Let's go.
I don't think that's a good idea, but you're welcome to try.
You (male)Bastard! (female)Bitch! With the Gun Runners gone we will never even have the chance to arm our selves.  Get outta here your not  welcome here.
Go ahead. It's your funeral.  With out those guns we have nothing to back us up.
Thank you.
What happened to you did someone shoot you in the head?
Thank you for helping us with the Regulators. Please feel free to stay as long as you want. You might want to check in with Miles and Smitty, they may be able to help you with your further travels.
Hi, can I help you?
The name is Razor, I am the leader of the people you see here.   We live here at the whim of the Regulators of Adytum.
You've killed them all?  That's not a problem at all.  My people can now live free lives with the people of Adytum
I can't believe it.  You were able to kill them all.  The Blades and I thank you.
I have heard that the Regulators still control Adytum.  Are you not able to kill them all like you had hoped.

We would go with you, but without weapons the Regulators would kill us all.  There might be another possibility [Razor ponders a moment]  If you could get the Gun Runners to supply us weapons then a number of us could go with you.
Hello again,  I've heard that you have been playing with the Regulators.  I wanted to thank you for getting rid of them.  My people will be able to live with the people of Adytum in freedom now.
You will?  Well if you need help or have done it come back and talk to me.

voice_info.appearance: You see Jerry, a young Initiate.
sample_lines: Yea, being a Knight would be great, they see lots of action and get to build all the stuff. I haven't decided yet, but I'm leaning towards a Knight myself. Am I boring you? Some people say I talk a lo

Yea, Scribes have such a creative position. It would be great to think up new weapons, modify old ones, and keep records of every  detail of every item in the Brotherhood. Am I boring you? Some people
Yea, I'm still trying to decide. It's so tough, they're both really exciting. By the way, if you want the top bunk just let me know, I don't mind.

npc_lines.text: Yea, being a Knight would be great, they see lots of action and get to build all the stuff. I haven't decided yet, but I'm leaning towards a Knight myself. Am I boring you? Some people say I talk a lot but I just don't think they understand. I just have a lot to say.

Yea, Scribes have such a creative position. It would be great to think up new weapons, modify old ones, and keep records of every  detail of every item in the Brotherhood. Am I boring you? Some people say I talk a lot but I just don't think they understand. I just have a lot to say.
Yea, I'm still trying to decide. It's so tough, they're both really exciting. By the way, if you want the top bunk just let me know, I don't mind.
Are you all right? Maybe you need to see the doctor or maybe you just need some sleep. Well I better get back to studying.  Bye.

Oh, by the way, I'm glad you'll be my new roommate. My last one always wore ear plugs, I don't know why. Anyhow, feel free to leave anything you like here, I don't take up much space. Do you want the top bunk? I'll change if you want... you don't snore do you? Oh, it doesn't matter. See ya.

Yea, that's what I thought. Well, I'm glad you'll be my new roommate. My last one always wore earplugs, I don't know why. Anyhow, feel free to leave anything you like here, I don't take up much space. Do you want the top bunk? I'll change if you want... you don't snore do you? Oh, it doesn't matter. See ya.

voice_info.appearance: You see: Vault Dweller.
sample_lines: Hello! How goes the search?
Well, that's good to hear. Keep up the good work, I guess.
We knew that there was no hope. I don't think we'll get a new chip in time. I think that some of us should move outside before it's too late.

npc_lines.text: Hello! How goes the search?
Well, that's good to hear. Keep up the good work, I guess.
We knew that there was no hope. I don't think we'll get a new chip in time. I think that some of us should move outside before it's too late.
Please hurry.
Maybe you should come to one of our meetings. Theresa has some good ideas. We meet in her room on the second level, at five o'clock each evening.
That's what Theresa thinks. She's got it all worked out. We're thinking of leaving the Vault soon.
Why did the Overseer pick you? It's obvious you couldn't find your shoelaces, much less a new water chip. Oh well.
Don't you have a job to do? Hurry and find the chip!

voice_info.appearance: You see a Regulator, one of the guards of Adytum.
sample_lines: Welcome to Adytum, stranger. Watch yourself, we'll be watching you.
Zimmerman might have a use for you. Come inside, but remember, we're watching.
Go away!
