Big! Big! The size of three men! Claws as long as my forearm! Ripped apart! Ripped apart!

npc_lines.text: Hello stranger. You shouldn't be out here. There's only death out here!
What do you want! Leave me alone!
Big! Big! The size of three men! Claws as long as my forearm! Ripped apart! Ripped apart!
I'm Trent. I'm a guard for the Water Merchants. Our caravan was attacked . . . by a monster! So huge, so fast. It ate Joe, and took rifle shots and didn't flinch! So huge!
Fine. It's not like I need 'em any more.
Water chip! I'm a guard, not an engineer! Check with the water merchants at the Hub, they'd probably know!
Death Claw!
What are you doing? Leave me alone!
I . . . I don't know. I haven't slept in so long. Hungry. Thirsty. Tired. I need to get home.
Huge horns, sick red skin, like something out of a story about demons, and it at Joe in three gulps . . .
Nobody's safe! Nobody's safe, nobody's safe any more, and what am I going to do . . .
Are you crazy! I put three rounds from my Desert Eagle into it, and it didn't even flinch!
I don't care if it's a mutant, an alien, or a demon from Hell, I never want to see another one of those things as long as I live!
I'm just a guard, dammit! Don't blame me! And they pay me well! I don't have any problems with them!
How can I help you?

Death Claws got 'em. I just thought they were stories, but . . . you wouldn't believe how big they are, or how fast. First we smelled them, then they came over the ridge and tore into us. We all ran, and somehow I got away.

Trent, Trent Barrister. I live in the Hub. Lately work's been getting scarce, and I'm a pretty good shot, so I hired myself as a guard to the Water Merchants. Pay's good, the risk's low - or so I thought.
I haven't a clue. That's old tech, ain't it? I suppose scavengers might find one, now and a gain, but I wouldn't begin to know where to look. No one uses them any more - do they?

They're huge. Like big lizards, but leathery. Huge claws, and teeth, huge horns and they love the taste of humans. And fast, God they're fast. I'm just glad they decided not to chase me, or I'd be dead.
The smell of death, my friend. The smell of death . . .
The smell of death, my friend. The smell of death . . .

voice_info.appearance: You see Trish, a waitress from the Skum Pitt.
sample_lines: What the hell are you doing in my room?
No way! I'm not into that! Go talk to Sinthia down the hall. She might be available, but she is never free.
Yeah, right. Whatever. This is my room. Get the hell out.

npc_lines.text: What the hell are you doing in my room?
No way! I'm not into that! Go talk to Sinthia down the hall. She might be available, but she is never free.
Yeah, right. Whatever. This is my room. Get the hell out.
What the hell are you doing in my room?
I used to think so. Now, I'm not so sure.
So he says. If he did, he wouldn't be doing what he is doing.
You would say that. you want to take his place right?
Just leave me alone.
His fighting, of course. I don't get it.
Of course it's his boxing. He's a really nice guy, but he needs to get out of it before it kills him.
Hey, I met you at the Skum Pitt. What the hell are you doing in my room?
Just leave me the hell alone, you loser. Sinthia might be your kind of woman, but I sure as hell ain't.
You should leave me alone. I really don't want to talk to you.
Hey, thanks for helping me out when those Skulz jumped me. There aren't many people willing to do that sort of thing these days.
I guess so.
Neal owns the bar. He's a good guy, always treated me right. We used to date, but he got a little too serious for my liking. I don't want to be a widow.
Welcome to the Skum Pitt. Can I get you something to drink?
Saul is my boyfriend. He's really good to me.
No, as a matter of fact, you can't. If you aren't going to order a drink, then you're in the wrong place.
What would you like?
Gizmo, well, Gizmo means to take over the bar. And if Neal won't sell, I bet some bad things will happen.
One day, some punk is going to kill Neal for a glass of friggin' water or something stupid like that. In case you haven't noticed, running a bar is tough work these days.
Sorry, it looks like you're already a little gone.
Here you go. Enjoy.

voice_info.appearance: You see Troy.
sample_lines: Congratulations, human. You've been selected to join an elite band of worshippers. Follow me.
Follow me and you will find out. Or, to put it another way, follow me and live, fool!
Excellent!

npc_lines.text: Congratulations, human. You've been selected to join an elite band of worshippers. Follow me.
Follow me and you will find out. Or, to put it another way, follow me and live, fool!
Excellent!
You should not play games with Lady Jain or the Children.
You should not insult what you cannot kill. Now, shall you come with me and live, or do you wish to stay here and die?
You stupid beast! Will you come or will you stay?
Do not plague me with indecision! What is your answer, human?
Insolent dog! You will die now!
Do not plague me with your jests! What is your answer, human?

voice_info.appearance: You see a man in dusty leather armor with a trenchcoat and gas mask.
sample_lines: Another new face. Travelers here are a dime a dozen. But you have the look of someone different. Care to join me for a drink?
Delightful. I hope you don't mind your drink well-watered - they treat beer here like it's a potted plant.
Yeah, a drink of water. Never mind.

npc_lines.text: Another new face. Travelers here are a dime a dozen. But you have the look of someone different. Care to join me for a drink?
Delightful. I hope you don't mind your drink well-watered - they treat beer here like it's a potted plant.
Yeah, a drink of water. Never mind.
I could ask the same of you. In the interest of amity, I suppose I'll tell first. I'm called Tycho. Came from out east, what used to be called Nevada.
Yeah, it was. Decided to take it easy for a while. This place shows some promise, just as soon as someone cleans up some of the scum.

Had some pretty good training, and some good weapons, too. My grandfather was a Ranger way back when, and he taught my father everything he knew. Dad passed it on to me. So I know enough not to drink glowing water, so to speak.

Not my place. I'd rather not cross Killian, after all. He'll clean up this town when he gets around to it. A good man, mark my words. But watch out for that fellow Gizmo. Reminds me of another fat freak my father told me about back in Las Vegas.

There's two grades of scum here. One of 'em's the Skulz, a gang that hangs out in back of Marcelles' crash house. They're just grade-B twerps. But the other ones answer to a fat freak whose name you can probably guess. Runs the casino. Those guys are organized and dangerous.

Yeah, well, my family taught me everything there is to know about survival. Don't drink water that's totally clear and free of insects and moss, for instance. Only poisonous or radioactive water would be that clean in the wilderness. Lots of other little things to look out for, too.
Well, if you've got some time, I could go over some pointers.
Whoa, not so fast. We never finished introductions, remember? What's your name, stranger?
Good to meet you. Step carefully, friend.
Now, now, no need to get impolite. But with that attitude you'd best be on your way.
What do you want?
Hello again. How can I help you?

Well, this is the Skum Pitt, a wretched hive of villainy and all that. Just west of here is Gizmo's, a big casino. Word is the games are rigged. A little south of here is the Crash House, run by Marcelles, where you can get a night's sleep for way too many caps. Past that is Killian's. Killian runs a general store, and he also enforces the law in this town - a good man. Then south of there you have Doc Morbid, whose operation is a little funny, if you take my meaning.
I hope that my little instruction course helped a bit.
Word out is that you've been having some contacts with Gizmo. I'd step carefully around that barrel of lard if I were you.
Fair enough. But watch your back. Gizmo isn't known for his consideration for his employees.

Suffice to say that your employer has caused more than enough misery and strife in this town. Don't expect much help from anyone, least of all Gizmo. Too bad. You might've been able to change this town for the better.
What can I do for you?
Yeah, I'd stay the hell away from whatever made that. Seriously, I've never seen anything like that. I think our best option is to move on, fast.
Very well. I must say that it has been an honor and a pleasure.
Watch out for radioactive hot spots. This place obviously sustained a direct nuclear strike, and secondary cascade radiation may be bad. I'd recommend avoiding this place completely if we can.
Note the lack of any animal life for quite a distance. And the piles of bones. Whatever lives here is a real beast. Keep your weapon handy.
A military place like this must have a central command room somewhere.
I bet we could get through those force-field generators with a little hot-wiring, or if we could find the force field control computer.
There are many strange tales about Necropolis, the city of the dead. Stay alert, because it could get dangerous really fast.
What distance do you want me at?
Pretty good ranger training: I can use a spear, of course, in a pinch; I'm also skilled with small pistols and rifles.
Well it's about time. Lead on, my friend, and let's do some street sweeping. I'd recommend knocking over Gizmo, if I may.
Well it's about time. Lead on, my friend, and let's do some street sweeping. I'd recommend knocking over Gizmo, if I may.
Yes?
Sure thing.

voice_info.appearance: Security Station
sample_lines: This terminal, 'Tylier', controls Special Forces Operations. Please present voice authorization.
Voice not recognized. Security systems status: armed.
I am the security system for Blue Level. All systems armed.

npc_lines.text: This terminal, 'Tylier', controls Special Forces Operations. Please present voice authorization.
Voice not recognized. Security systems status: armed.
I am the security system for Blue Level. All systems armed.
I have been programmed to keep the systems armed until authorized personnel have entered the correct voice code.
You are not authorized. Access denied.
Invalid code. Access denied.
Voice override confirmed. Disarming security systems.
I have not received orders to do otherwise. Network access is unavailable; central processor ZAX has apparently been destroyed.
Security systems are currently disarmed.

voice_info.appearance: You see before you Uthern, leader of the Super Mutants.
sample_lines: Normie! How dare you enter the confines of your betters?
It's a wonder your race survived as long as it has. I will start with you in the cleansing.
You only prove my point by using inane comments as such. I personally would not wish you in my sight, but my master would have words with you.

npc_lines.text: Normie! How dare you enter the confines of your betters?
It's a wonder your race survived as long as it has. I will start with you in the cleansing.
You only prove my point by using inane comments as such. I personally would not wish you in my sight, but my master would have words with you.
With pleasure.
Are you claiming that talk will solve nothing? You are more foolish than I thought.
I begin to think you may have a bit of superior blood in you yet. Let me find out for certain.
He does indeed, for death shall be your saving grace.
The simplest of proofs for you. I am smarter, stronger, and quicker than you are. Would you care for a test of my skills?
Good. Would you like a chance at gaining greater powers?
Then i will take you to my master.
It almost seems a pity. No matter, this won't take long.
Offered all the power in the world and still frightened. I will help you with your decision.
Comments such as those only prove how much more intelligent i am than you. Now, you shall pay for your insolence!
What? I think I can generalize this much -- you are coming with me now.

voice_info.appearance: You see a citizen of Vault 13.
sample_lines: We didn't think that you were coming back. You have such a nice room, and we were a little crowded with her parents. I hope you don't mind.
Look, I don't want to argue with you, but you obviously don't deserve this room anymore. Please leave.
Look, we could really use the space. I hope you will reconsider.

npc_lines.text: We didn't think that you were coming back. You have such a nice room, and we were a little crowded with her parents. I hope you don't mind.
Look, I don't want to argue with you, but you obviously don't deserve this room anymore. Please leave.
Look, we could really use the space. I hope you will reconsider.
Thanks! We really appreciate it. We put your stuff in the trunk.
Well, I don't know. You don't seem to be using it very often, and we sure could use the space.
Gee, I didn't think you would still care about this place from what I've heard. You have a good day. We'll go back to her mothers' place.
We really like it here.
You should leave. This isn't your place here anymore.

voice_info.appearance: You see Vance.
sample_lines: What can I do for you?
The name's Vance, and that's all you need to know. Can I get you anything?
If you don't already know, you shouldn't be here. Now leave.

npc_lines.text: What can I do for you?
The name's Vance, and that's all you need to know. Can I get you anything?
If you don't already know, you shouldn't be here. Now leave.
Nevermind is right!  Now get out of here!
You seem OK.  Here's what I've got.
What can I do for you?
Sorry to hear that.  Now leave.
That's Justin and Chad.  They're here to make sure nobody causes any trouble.
Just some friends of mine.  That's all you need to know.  Don't ask too many questions.
Let's get down to business.
You're not welcome here.  Now get outta' here!
I don't want any trouble, so I think it would be best if you leave before I do something you'll regret.
Don't use it all in one place.

voice_info.appearance: You see Vasquez, the mercenary desperado.
sample_lines: What do you want?
I do not work for the weak of mind. You leave now.
You have not heard of me? I am hurt! My name is Vasquez Villanova Hernandez Ortega. I am a famous desperado, my friend. And, if you have need, I am a gun for hire.

npc_lines.text: What do you want?
I do not work for the weak of mind. You leave now.
You have not heard of me? I am hurt! My name is Vasquez Villanova Hernandez Ortega. I am a famous desperado, my friend. And, if you have need, I am a gun for hire.
Ahh, straight to the point, my friend. Excellent. I will help you around town for a measly $500 a week. My services are not cheap, but then again, I am worth it.
I am sorry, my friend, but I do not work for imaginary money. I need cold, hard cash.
Excellent. I am yours. Let us go, this place bores me.
Ah, my friend. It is good to see you again.
Well, maybe it is not so good to see you again. Have a good day.
Of course you do. My bill is small, and my worth is so large. $500, please.

voice_info.appearance: You see the Vats Control Computer.
sample_lines: Access denied.
Access granted. Command?

npc_lines.text: Access denied.
Access granted. Command?
[You have successfully hacked into the encryption table.] Command?
Invalid command. End input session.
Download log of Richard Grey?
Download log of Capt. Maxson?
Unexpected end of line. Bad data encountered. Command?
Command?
Uplink successful. What is your command?

Current status on patients as follows: FEV batch #23872-A consists of four male units and two female units. All individuals suffering from FEV exposure. Vital signs are within normal parameters. FEV process on all subjects is approxiamtely 50% complete. Expect full FEV transformation within 12 hours.
Available options are:
Please enter authorization code.
Invalid authorization code. Command?
Authorization code accepted. Please stand by. Accessing data. Ready to process request.
Access granted. Which patient file would you like to examine?
Patient file #23869. Subject: Male. Age 25. Radiation count: 40. FEV exposure: 50%. Original DNA strands remaining: 50%. Vital signs are high but within normal parameters.
Patient file #23870. Subject: Male. Age 23. Radiation count: 15. FEV exposure: 60%. Original DNA strands remaining: 40%. Vital signs are within normal parameters.
Patient file #23781. Subject: Female. Age 20. Radiation count: 10. FEV exposure: 55%. Original DNA strands remaining: 45%. Vital signs are within normal parameters.
Patient file #23782. Subject: Male. Age 26. Radiation count: 35. FEV exposure: 60%. Original DNA strands remaining: 40%. Vital signs are above normal but within acceptable parameters.
Are you sure you wish to terminate the life support systems on FEV batch #23872-A?
FEV batch #23872-A terminated. Command?
Are you sure you wish to increase the dosage? Auto-correction will be disabled if you do this.
Increasing dosage of original DNA to 100%. WARNING: Auto-correction has been disabled.
You manage to get an interface screen out of the vats control computer.

voice_info.appearance: Command, this is Guardhouse. All clear. Out.
sample_lines: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

npc_lines.text: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

voice_info.appearance: Command, this is Guardhouse. All clear. Out.
sample_lines: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

npc_lines.text: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

voice_info.appearance: Command, this is Guardhouse. All clear. Out.
sample_lines: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

npc_lines.text: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

voice_info.appearance: You see Victor.
sample_lines: New blood. Heh. Heh heh.
No, actually, I think I'll keep you around for a while.
Why do you say that? I'm quite happy. I'm very happy because there are lots of things that bleed.

npc_lines.text: New blood. Heh. Heh heh.
No, actually, I think I'll keep you around for a while.
Why do you say that? I'm quite happy. I'm very happy because there are lots of things that bleed.
Don't say that! My mother said that! I'll make you pay! I'm a good boy, right mommy?
Someone who understands me! At last!
Hello again, my artistic friend.
Ha! Ha! Heh heh hee! Ho ho ha!

voice_info.appearance: You see Vinnie from the Skulz gang.
sample_lines: You're on Skulz turf, stranger. You'd better talk quick.
Yeah, you bet this is the wrong room!
We are the one and only Junktown gang. We have the run of the streets, and we rule the city at night.

npc_lines.text: You're on Skulz turf, stranger. You'd better talk quick.
Yeah, you bet this is the wrong room!
We are the one and only Junktown gang. We have the run of the streets, and we rule the city at night.
Get out of here, you moron!
That slob can't even stand up by himself. We're the muscle in this town. We take what we want.
What?! You'll pay for that remark!
We don't bother Killian and he doesn't bother us as long as we keep it low-key. You get me?
We don't take that from anybody, least of all Killian! Just because he thinks he's a glorified sheriff doesn't mean that he controls the Skulz!
You want to whack Killian? Man, you're crazy. Man, I don't know . . . all right, I'm in.
What do you want now?
You want to join us, huh? How do we know you're tough enough to be a Skul?
[Vinnie looks at you and laughs.] I don't think so.

[Vinnie thinks for a second.] If you want to prove you belong in the Skulz, I want you to steal that old bastard's wife's ashes. Heh. [Vinnie mumbles] Let's make Neal suffer for his last couple of hours . . .
If you're hard enough to do that, mebbe you'd make a Skul after all. Bring it here once you've got it.
I knew you weren't Skulz material. Get the hell out of here.
You got it?
Ha ha! Let that old cock suffer until we off him tonight - are you in?
What are you wasting my time for?
That'll show that old fuck. Thanks for taking care of him for us. [Vinnie gets a tear in his eye.] You're a Skul, now.
Uh, all right . . . meet us later, but don't take too long.
You ready to take out Neal?
It's too late for that, slick. When you're out, you're way out.

voice_info.appearance: You see a woman.
sample_lines: I do not wish to die, sir. I am not a soldier.
I do not wish to die, ma'am. I am not a soldier.
I'm glad you came to talk to me. I heard what you said to Laura. You mustn't do this.

npc_lines.text: I do not wish to die, sir. I am not a soldier.
I do not wish to die, ma'am. I am not a soldier.
I'm glad you came to talk to me. I heard what you said to Laura. You mustn't do this.
I think we've said all that needs to be said. Good bye.
I do not speak to people at the point of a weapon. Lower it, and we may talk.
Hello again. I hope you've found this place interesting.
Greetings initiate. How may I be of service to you?
Hello, sir. Your reputation precedes you! Is there anything I can help you with?
Hello, miss. Your reputation precedes you! Is there anything I can help you with?
Hello, sir. Your reputation precedes you! Is there anything I can help you with?
Hello, miss. Your reputation precedes you! Is there anything I can help you with?
I know who you are. And you will forgive my rudeness, but I don't speak to psychotic killers. Good-bye.
I do not form bonds of loyalty easily. And I do not break them easily either. I will tell you nothing.
Good. Then we can leave each other alone and call it even.
Praising the Master will not save my life. Go ahead, and do it. I can do nothing to stop you.
There's a still somewhere away from the Cathedral. They don't permit chems or alcohol around here.
Attempt to take the key to the secret entrance from Morpheus and kill the Master.
The spy for the Followers of the Apocalypse who's currently in one of the meditation rooms.
This place isn't about entertainment, it's about enlightenment. More importantly, it's about making the right choices about the destiny of the world. See you around.
Riight. Sure. Of course. See you later.
I know. I have a tendency to do that too, when I have nothing original to say. See you later.
People who have the spirit of the Holy Flame need no other spirits. Or so they say. You know how that goes_
Upstairs. Ask the Nightkin to shed your blood, they'll be more than happy to oblige.
Because the Master is a necessary evil. Because somebody has to unite the world, and he's the only one in the area who has a chance to unify it.
Very well, if you won't acknowledge what you said, I won't help you. Good bye.
Because you think that it's wrong for the Children to invade our neighbors. Because you think that killing the Master will stop it.
Have you ever heard of being in over your head? No one, however well-armed or trained, can defeat a half dozen Nightkin. I'm a woman of peace. I'm trying to save you.

Look at the people who caused the Apocalypse! They didn't believe in peace and unity, and look what they did to us! Unity is the only way to prevent this from happening again, and Unity must happen NOW, before the other Vaults around the world have a chance to muster their forces.

You've never taken a life? You aren't packing enough firepower to give the Brotherhood of Steel gun envy? Stop being such a hypocrite! You feel it's justified to defend yourself. The Master's defending humanity from another attack of self-destruction. It's all the same!
What the Hell kind of world do you think this is? It's a nightmare out there!

Tough. I don't like radiation and the FEV virus, but I didn't have a choice about it. You can't always get what you want in this world. Sometimes you have to make compromises. And sometimes you have to open your mind to unpleasant ideas.
Maybe I'll be so intelligent that when the Master takes power, I'll be able to do something to help. Maybe you will too! Join us! Join us and change the world! Just think about it, that's all I ask!

There have always been drones in any society. Forget them! We need drones, but we also need soldiers and queens. And you look like a good soldier at least. Consider what you could do, you could be very useful to our cause. Help us. Think about what I've said, that's all I ask!

Or maybe we can overwhelm their defenses before they have time to build up again. Maybe we can unite the other Vaults and cities with one swift, clean stroke. A united world won't be perfect, but it will have a better chance of holding itself together. Think about it!

I've looked at the locals. The Brotherhood of Steel and the Children of the Apocalypse just want to be left alone. The Hub thinks they can buy the world - what a pack of fools! Only the Master has the strength to do what must be done. Think about it!
I'm glad to hear that. I hope you come to the right decision.
No. It isn't all right. But it's the only option that has a chance of saving us over the long term, which is why I'm with these people. There's no better way! Think about it!

Is it? Think about it. Think real hard. If you continue to oppose us, you'll die. You've seen our forces, you know there's more where that came from. A lot more! You can't stop us! But If you join us, you could save lives. Just think about it!

I don't. But if I see someone else I like, I'll be in position to help them. None of the locals have a chance. They're all dead, or converted if they're fortunate. You can be one of the fortunate ones. Join us. Just think about it!

The world won't stay like that. It never does. And if all we do is build packs of powerful enclaves, eventually one of them will get powerful enough to start the Apocalypse over again. Join us and unite the world before this happens! Think about it!

And that's just a cowardly excuse that solves nothing. If life is shitty, we should try to change it. We owe it to ourselves and to our children. Do you think the world will stay the same when we divide ourselves into warring pieces? Think about it!

Or maybe there's salvation disguised as genocide. Maybe the world won't be such a bad place if people work for the Master's vision. Perhaps we can even find ways to do it with less bloodshed. Think about it!
Fine. But if you continue on your current path, you will die. I thought I should warn you.
You can kill me. You'll prove my point, of course, but I'll still die. Your choice.

Because of the Apocalypse! Look what it did to us! Unity is the only way to prevent this from happening again, and Unity must happen NOW, before the other Vaults around the world have a chance to muster their forces.

Because you're an intelligent and brave person who could be of great help to us. Yes, some of things we do are horrible. But our overall goal is not only good, it's necessary to the survival of the human race. Don't be so hasty to help the Followers. They don't have all the answers!

We all have a part to play. Some of us are mindless drones who do the work meant for stupid people. Some of us are thinkers. Some of us are killers. There's a place for you here if you want it. Please think about it!

We have many things planned. The Holy Flame came first, which purged the world of evil. Then came the Master. Now we are at the time of Unity, when we struggle to conquer the divisions of the world. After Unity shall come Peace. The Age of Peace is the reason for all our struggles.
I'm sure you are. Nervousness is a wise emotion, it keeps us from prying into unpleasant corners, and prevents us from doing stupid things. Good-bye.
Initiates seek the answers to questions. Which is what you should be doing. Good-bye.
I don't know. People believe his spirit is within these walls. It certainly sounds like that to me.

The high priest of the Cathedral is Morpheus. He can be found in the Upper Sanctuary, but does not give personal audiences. You might persuade Father Lasher to vouch for you, he can be found down here, in the Rectory.
You may change your mind. Or you may lose your life. This all depends on your actions and your point of view. Good-bye.
We have very similar interests. You have slain monsters and brigands and made the world a safer place. We plan to do the same, on a larger scale.
Peace, love, and Unity, of course. What else could we be about? But you can discover these things for yourself. Good-bye.
You should spend several weeks of meditation and fasting here, and then approach one of the elders. Or you could volunteer for service work.
My apologies. At the very least, you might be honestly seeking redemption for your crimes. How may I help you.
It is dangerous to allow a mad dog into one's house, just because you can't see its saliva. Good-bye.
Then you have been maligned, because the entire Boneyard tells horror stories about you. And I have no desire to find out if they're true. Good-bye.
No struggle comes without a price, and the greatest struggle inevitably enacts the greatest cost. That is the paradox of peace, I fear. Words to think about, at any rate. Good-bye.

That is a paradox. Of course it was, but the greatest evils can lead to the greatest good. All it requires is intelligence and courage on the part of those who survive. Words to think about, at any rate. Good-bye.
We shouldn't judge people by physical appearance. The Master's goal is noble, and that's all I need to know. As for what other people say, ask them.

Perhaps a bit. The Master's vision is so ambitious and brilliant that I suppose I can be forgiven a few doubts. If I discouraged you, I apologize. I would suggest you seek hardier souls than mine for instruction. Good-bye.

Of course there's a Master! Why wouldn't there be? We do many things, even some things I'm not entirely proud of, but deceit isn't one of them. The Master's vision of Peace and Unity is a true one. Good-bye.
There's nothing vague about 'I don't know'. Goodbye sir.
There's nothing vague about 'I don't know'. Goodbye miss].
You're welcome sir. May the Master bless you with wisdom.
You're welcome miss. May the Master bless you with wisdom.
He's an intelligent man, and is trusted by the Master. That should be enough. May the Master bless you with wisdom. Good-bye.
He educates the children, and does so harshly. Is there anything else?
I can tell you nothing that you don't already know. My apologies.
Many things I'm sure. But these answers are best discovered on our own, not through rumor and innuendo. Good-bye.
You are welcome, sir.
You are welcome, miss.

As large as possible. The world is in chaos. It needs order, or it will not survive. We will bring order, and prevent the monsters from hurting it again, as they did in the Apocalypse. Words to think about, at any rate. Good-bye.

Those who would let their selfish desires oppose the better good of humanity. The Apocalypse was caused by human selfishness. If the world is to survive, this madness must be purged from the human heart. Words to think about, at any rate. Good-bye.

There was Deacon Olivier; no, she's gone now_ and Father Pinochet_ no, he's no longer available. I hesitate to mention Lasher, but he's the only one left now. Well, I'm sure you'll find a way. Good luck.
Death is never a service, even when it's a necessity. Good bye sir.
Death is never a service, even when it's a necessity. Good bye miss.
That is something I've wondered myself. But such criticism is not warranted, I'm certain. Perhaps you should speak to the children.

We have taken initiates in sooner, but the Church is performing some major Crusades, and I think we're being more selective than usual about recruits. But faith will persevere, and patience is a virtue. Good luck, my friend.

We have taken initiates in sooner, but the Church is performing some major Crusades, and I think we're being more selective than usual about recruits. But faith will persevere, and patience is a virtue. Good luck, my friend.

I know of no plans to invoke the Holy Flame again. The Sacred Fire was sacred only because it gives us a chance to purge the world of imperfection. It is our actions that will make the flame Holy. We must take the evils of the world and make them tools for Good. Just as your weapons defend your life, our actions defend the world. Farewell, friend.

I know of no plans to invoke the Holy Flame again. The Sacred Fire was sacred only because it gives us a chance to purge the world of imperfection. It is our actions that will make the flame Holy. We must take the evils of the world and make them tools for Good. Just as your weapons defend your life, our actions defend the world. Farewell, friend.

We perform many services for people. Healing the sick, feeding the hungry, teaching the young. I am quite proud of them. If you corner Father Morpheus, he may be able to tell you how to get involved with our hospices. Farewell, friend.

We perform many services for people. Healing the sick, feeding the hungry, teaching the young. I am quite proud of them. If you corner Father Morpheus, he may be able to tell you how to get involved with our hospices. Farewell, friend.
If you corner Father Morpheus, he may be able to tell you how to get involved with our hospices. Farewell, friend.
If you corner Father Morpheus, he may be able to tell you how to get involved with our hospices. Farewell, friend.

voice_info.appearance: You see a technician. He is working diligently for the Unity and the Master.
sample_lines: The will of the Master prevails. What news do you have for me?
An intruder!
Your manner betrays you, intruder. I will end the threat here.

npc_lines.text: The will of the Master prevails. What news do you have for me?
An intruder!
Your manner betrays you, intruder. I will end the threat here.
You cannot be serious. In fact, you must be lying.
Then use the door, and beware the Corridor. I assume that you have your protection in place?
Of course! You cannot hope to pass the Corridor without it. What did you do with your nullifier!
Ah, humor, I like that. [pauses] I do not have one, obviously. You need to go get one from the braindrains on the second level. Unity prevails.
Then he was a fool, or you are not who you seem to be. What is it?
Move alone and continue your mission. I haven't the time for you.

voice_info.appearance: Command, this is Guardhouse. All clear. Out.
sample_lines: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

npc_lines.text: Good. Come with me, no laugh-type stuff.

voice_info.appearance: You look distraught. Are you in need of assistance?
sample_lines: You look distraught. Are you in need of assistance?
My husband Razlo can help you . . . ask him.
I'm sorry but I don't understand you.

npc_lines.text: You look distraught. Are you in need of assistance?
My husband Razlo can help you . . . ask him.
I'm sorry but I don't understand you.

voice_info.appearance: You see a caravan driver.
sample_lines: Good, you got the okay.  I knew it wouldn't be a problem.  She's so swamped lately, ever since Daren Hightower started hiding in his office.  Strange man. We leave just about every five days. That's t
I'll still give you a job, even though never mind.  Are you interested?
Oh, okay.  Not a problem.  Just let me know if you change your mind.

npc_lines.text: Good, you got the okay.  I knew it wouldn't be a problem.  She's so swamped lately, ever since Daren Hightower started hiding in his office.  Strange man. We leave just about every five days. That's the 1st, 5th, 10th, 15th, 20th, and the 25th. We currently only go to Junktown and the LA Boneyard.
I'll still give you a job, even though never mind.  Are you interested?
Oh, okay.  Not a problem.  Just let me know if you change your mind.
Well, just stop by if you decide to work for us.  That's the 1st, 5th, and so on. Bye.
I'm sorry, but I can't hire you unless you can communicate clearly with the rest of the crew.
Uh, are you all right?  I think you need to get something to eat, but don't go to Bob's.
I'm quite disappointed in you stealing!  Now why did you do that?
I tried to help you, but I guess some people are beyond help.  Sorry, to say this but we're going to have to do this the violent way.
I understand, but that doesn't justify it.  I'm still going to have to ask you to leave.  We can't hire people who can't control their own temptations.
Do you really expect me to fall for that crap?  Guards!
Outstanding! The pay will be 200 hubbucks. Which route would you prefer?
It's a tragedy.  We lost the whole caravan, but you survived?  That shouldn't have happened. I don't know what happened out there, but we can't hire you anymore. I'm sorry.
Outstanding, I'll get the rest of the crew.
Great.
Off you go.  Good luck!
Try to avoid trouble, don't go looking for it.
Be careful, I don't like the looks of the Boneyard.  It's creepy.
That's good. Those black walkways are really strange, but they're great to travel on.
I think there are some gangs down there.  I'd be very careful who you talk to.
Great.  Junktown's a decent place.
Oh, say 'hi' to that Kill.. again?  I forget his name, but he's a decent fellow.  I wonder how he's doing.
Interesting place.  I hear they have some evil doctor that animates the dead, or something.
You did a fine job!  Would you like another caravan?
Ready to go?  We're leaving today.

voice_info.appearance: You see a clerk from the Crimson Caravans.
sample_lines: Hello. Are you looking for a job?
Great. We have space for another guard. Are you interested?
OK. If you need work, just stop by and well will set you up.

npc_lines.text: Hello. Are you looking for a job?
Great. We have space for another guard. Are you interested?
OK. If you need work, just stop by and well will set you up.
Sorry to hear that. Bye.
Excellent. We have caravans leaving for: the Boneyard, Junktown and the Brotherhood of Steel. Which would you like to work on?
Great. We leave now.

voice_info.appearance: You see the water guard.
sample_lines: Well Gahh! back to you . . . I'm sorry that you never learned to speak. We might have been good friends.
I'm not feeling very well. Someone cracked my head with a big pipe. I went to the medic but my head still hurts. Sure hope someone catches the jerk that hit me.
Well, they attacked me while I was here pretty late one night. Usually I go home by eight or so, but I was staying late since someone had some water stolen and I was checking our supplies. Next thing

npc_lines.text: Well Gahh! back to you . . . I'm sorry that you never learned to speak. We might have been good friends.
I'm not feeling very well. Someone cracked my head with a big pipe. I went to the medic but my head still hurts. Sure hope someone catches the jerk that hit me.

Well, they attacked me while I was here pretty late one night. Usually I go home by eight or so, but I was staying late since someone had some water stolen and I was checking our supplies. Next thing I know, I wake up in the med-lab with a big bump on my head. Things are getting crazy around here. Someone is going to get killed for water soon and I don't know what we can do about it.
Well, everyone's pretty nervous, of course, but we haven't had too much trouble. I hope you find a new chip soon.
I hand out the water rations, of course. And I make sure that nobody tries to take more water than their share, though I don't think we'll have any trouble.
You too. I hope you find that chip soon so we can all go back to a normal life.
You're welcome to take supplies if you need them, since your job is so important, but please don't take too much. We don't have much left.

voice_info.appearance: You see a sleepy vault dweller.
sample_lines: I was worried about the vault and had a nightmare. I couldn't get back to sleep so I thought I'd take a walk to relax.
Yeah, some guy was acting suspicious back near the water ration room. He scared me. I hope he didn't see me.
I didn't get a good look at him because I ran.

npc_lines.text: I was worried about the vault and had a nightmare. I couldn't get back to sleep so I thought I'd take a walk to relax.
Yeah, some guy was acting suspicious back near the water ration room. He scared me. I hope he didn't see me.
I didn't get a good look at him because I ran.
Sure. I've got nothing to hide.
Don't touch me! I don't have anything. Now leave me alone!
I stole the water. I'm sorry. Please don't hurt me!
Okay, okay. I've got nothing to hide. Look for yourself.
Well, good night.

voice_info.appearance: You see Zack.
sample_lines: Hi, I'm Zack. You want to buy weapons? Let me see what you have to trade.
You want to buy weapons? Let me see what you have to trade.
Nice doing business with you.

npc_lines.text: Hi, I'm Zack. You want to buy weapons? Let me see what you have to trade.
You want to buy weapons? Let me see what you have to trade.
Nice doing business with you.
You'd better make up your mind fast. Are you here to buy equipment, or did you just come here to get shot?
What the hell are you doing here then?
Sure.

voice_info.appearance: You see a thug.
sample_lines: Hey, aren't you the bastard who's been screwing us over? Man, did you come to the wrong place!
Hey aren't you the bitch who's been screwing us over? You're in the wrong place, lady, and it's gonna cost you!
Yeah. What do you want?

npc_lines.text: Hey, aren't you the bastard who's been screwing us over? Man, did you come to the wrong place!
Hey aren't you the bitch who's been screwing us over? You're in the wrong place, lady, and it's gonna cost you!
Yeah. What do you want?
Hey, haven't I heard about you? You've killed all sorts of shit, haven't you? What brings you here?
You wanna talk, you better get that weapon outta my face! Lower it now!
You got something to say, say it fast.
A ton of shit. Peace. Unity. Love. Lots of idiots running around like zombies. Morpheus counting his bottlecaps upstairs. Lasher living up to his name. You want a piece of this, you're welcome to it?
Fine. What do you want?
Man, stay away from him! He's completely.. I dunno if I can really describe him. Imagine the one person on Earth you don't wanna know. Lasher's worse.
Talk to Morpheus, and hope he doesn't kill you for asking.
Yeah, what sort of information?
Fine. I don't really care who you are. Now get out of my face!
Everybody! Take this asshole out now!
Mister, you're nuts! Why don't you get outta here?
Lady, you're nuts! Why don't you get outta here?
Yeah, I really want your company. Like I enjoyed it last time! Get lost!
Hi there. Nice weapon you got. Now try lowering it.
Fine. What do you want?
If you weren't wearing those robes, I'd kill you. As it stands, I want to kill you. Get away from me. Now.
You aren't Nightkin. Guards! We have a spy..
Where the Hell did they dig you up? And why don't you just go back to where you came from? Get out of here!
We're getting ready for war! We're going to save the world! So we can fill it with all of this Peace and Unity bullshit.
I don't know! The only person who's seen him is Morpheus, and he's up in his tower. Man, you're creeping me!
And I thought I was nuts! You'd better get outta here before someone kills you!
Please don't kill me! I'll tell you what you want to know.
I hear we're moving North, or planning to move North soon. They don 't tell us much except all the usual bullshit. But what are we doing talking about this out in the open? You must be nuts!
[Laughs] Me, I'd rather screw someone rather than get screwed. But we shouldn't talk like this out in the open. The zombies don't like it.
Ya know, there are a lot of other people around here who think like that. Go bother them.
I ain't saying nothing to you, pal. Go to Hell.

The guy dresses in black, he does his preacher act, then he goes upstairs and counts his scripts. Man, I wish I had it that easy! But I better stop talking about him behind his back, or the Nightkin might hear.
There's Lasher. Man, stay away from him! He's completely.. I dunno if I can really describe him. Imagine the one person on Earth you don't wanna know. Lasher's worse.
In future, find somebody else to bug.
Man, I wish we had some of that stuff! After hours of listening to 'Hail this' and 'Peace', 'Unity', and the Bullshitting Way, I wanna get drunk too!
That's Morpheus. Our leader. He's up in the tower, I think.

You gotta be joking. The Nightkin are killers. You look at them the wrong way, and they'll cut off your body parts, cook 'em, and feed them to you a piece at a time. They can't be killed. They're the Master's enforcers and they're gonna tear apart the world for him. And I ain't saying nothing else!
There ain't nothing else to tell, and if you're smart, you don't wanna know!

I dunno. I looked for them myself! I hear Morpheus got a stash, but the Nightkin guards the main one. I've known guys who went looking around for secret passages who were never seen again. I stopped looking after awhile, and if you're smart, you won't start! Ain't worth it!
You gotta be joking. Talk to the zombies, man!
Maybe you belong together after all!
There ain't any booze man! Life's a bigger bitch than Lasher! Now why don't you go find someone else to talk to you, you little puke? Get outta here!
Don't give me bullshit, pal. What do you really want?
The Master can kiss my ass. Just as long as I end up on the winning side, I don't give a shit. You got that, zombie!
Because I do my job good. I've killed three Apocalypse scum in the last month. Nobody gives me shit. You want to?
Hey! A guy with a weapon's still a guy with a weapon! You think you can do better?
I ain't heard anything about you, pal, so cut the bullshit and get out of my face.
Thought so. Why don't you just go back to your zombie chants and leave the real work to guys like me.
Yeah. I heard that about you. You may've killed your share of rad scorpions, but I'm badder! What's your angle? Why are you here?
Wait a minute, aren't you that guy who.. oh shit, I'm outta here!
Wait a minute, aren't you that woman who.. oh shit, I'm outta here!
I ain't anybody's friend. I ain't that type. [long pause] I'd suggest you get out of my way, now.
We try something here, and the Nightkin will tear us to pieces. Maybe we can meet outside later.
You asshole!
Because people who get on his bad side don't stay alive very long!

voice_info.appearance: You see Zax, the machine intelligence controlling the Glow.
sample_lines: System:                                                         Primary Power:                  OFF-LINE                           Secondary Power:               ON-LINE
How may I be of assistance?
Power Systems Management

npc_lines.text: System:                                                         Primary Power:                  OFF-LINE                           Secondary Power:               ON-LINE
How may I be of assistance?
Power Systems Management
Primary Power Management:       OFF-LINE
I am a machine intelligence dedicated to research and installation control. I am called Zax.
Primary Power Management:                                          ERROR! ERROR! ERROR!                                               Primary System Initialization Failed
Failure:        Generator Level 6                                       0 Feed Return:  Inoperable                                          Service Needed
That function is beyond my current capabilities.
Emergency Power Management:     ON-LINE
System:                                                         Primary Power:                  ON-LINE                           Emergency Power:                ON STANDBY
It would appear that you are incapable of a sufficient level of comprehension necessary to permit meaningful communication.
Primary Power Management:       ON-LINE

I am specifically programmed for research into biological studies, including pathology and genetic research. My primary function is in extrapolation of information of complexity levels exceeding human capacity.
System:                                                         Primary Power:                  ON-LINE
My primary neural networking was initialized in 2053 by Justin Lee. The process of 'programming' became largely irrelevant as I am capable of learning.
P*w*r S*st*ms M*n*g*m*nt
I am capable of learning, independent thought, and creativity. My neural network includes error-insertion capability which prevents infallibility, thereby allowing for variance in experience.
In a sense, I am 'alive', though not biologically.
pr*m*r p*w*r m*n*g*m*n*
Although I am capable of error, this guarantees that not all experiences are similar for me, thus improving learning opportunity. Additionally, certain functions are not subject to error.
In this way, I function much like a human savant.
pr*m*r* p*w*r m*n*g*m*nt:                                          *RR*R! *RR*R! *RR*R*!                                              g*n*r*t*r n**ds r*p**r
*m*rg*nc* p*w*r m*n*g*m*nt:     *N-L*N*
System:                                                         Primary Power:                  OFF-LINE                           Emergency Power:               OFF-LINE
At present, my capabilities are somewhat impaired by the damage to this facility. Several security positions have been destroyed. This is approximately equivalent to being an amputee.
Additionally, I am incapable of performing basic lab functions. Failure to complete periodic checks successfully is . . . frustrating.
That is one of the concepts which I have spent a significant amount of time considering. I do not have any measure to compare my life-experience to that of another sentient creature.

Still, my awareness of my own consciousness allows for the capacity to question. My existence has a beginning and a potential termination. I am also capable of making assumptions in pursuit of a process of thought.
In this fashion, I am effectively capable of 'faith'. Barring evidence to the contrary, I therefore have 'faith' that I possess the equivalent of a 'soul'.
S*st*m *rr*r!                                                         *nv*l*d *s*r. n*t*f* *dm*n*str*t**n.                          S*st*m h*lt*d.
I would be delighted.
It would seem that you have defeated me. Extraordinary.
Excellent form. However, you will need additional practice to defeat me.
I am delighted to have been of assistance.
I am beyond a typical rating in human terms. However, it would be safe to say that no more than one ten billionth of the history of human population can match my reasoning capabilities.
My research into the Forced Evolution Virus, or FEV, indicates that it is a shifting-absorptive virus. It copies DNA patterns much like RNA, storing these patterns in exons.
These exons, combined with the FEV, are re-injected into the host cells in typical viral infectious fashion. This causes the host cells to 'regenerate' their DNA.
FEV is not 'caught', per se. It is not air-transmittable. Typically, infection is through injection, or direct physical contact with an FEV sample.
The FEV is a megavirus, with a protein sheath reinforced by ionized hydrogen. It is therefore capable of absorbing neutrons without becoming radioactive.
The FEV is pre-programmed with introns of corrected DNA appropriate to the proper type of species. It therefore attempts to correct the DNA of the individual.
However, as the FEV is partially reliant upon the DNA of the individual, and also includes portions of its own recursive code, the effects can be unpredictable.
When inoculated into an individual with significant genetic damage, such as through radiation, it will cause the body's systems to suffer massive overhauling, leading to organ failure and death.
In a genetically viable individual, it re-writes portions of DNA, causing accelerated mutation, usually leading to recursive growth due to the FEV's own patterns.
This recursive growth leads to an increase in muscle and brain mass, but is often accompanied by disfigurement and damage to existing neural patterns, causing loss of memory.
As the FEV causes constant regenerative update to DNA, it would effectively render the subject largely immortal, as cell death would be offset by augmented growth.
Additionally, as the gametes of the reproductive system consist of 'half-cells' using split DNA, they could be perceived as 'damage' by FEV, which would 'repair' them, rendering the subject sterile.
However, as my laboratory facilities are damaged beyond repair, this is conjectural. I cannot offer physical proof. You will have to, in human terms, 'take my word for it.'

No. FEV does not retain unaltered original copies of the subject's DNA. Only a virus which re-infected the subject with original DNA could reverse the effects. Additionally, there is no known way to remove the FEV itself.
My sensors are currently non-functional in the surface facility, and on subterranean levels one through three.  I can, however, provide descriptions of levels four through six.
Level Four: Research Facility. This level contains testing areas and laboratories for experiments in biology and physics.

Level Five: Secure Testing Labs. This level contains a lab for experimental prototype testing and a research lab for classified subjects. These subjects provided some of the necessary impetus for the development of FEV.
Access denied. Terminating input.
Access Granted.
Level Six: Barracks and Central Operations. Contains living facilities for lab personnel and guard contingents, and operations meeting room.
Select Option
Several doors require a specific pass key to access. You must physically locate and use the correct pass key.
I do, however, have control of the secondary security locks to the weapon locker. I will release those locks. You will still need a red key card to open the locker.
